'''Evelyn''' is a woman who became trapped in her apartment after falling.


Evelyn had a cardiac episode in her apartment and fell, which knocked over a pile of stuff nearby and trapped her. Her downstairs neighbors and friends, [[Jaime]] and [[Liam]], called for help because they were worried about the cracking ceiling in their apartment. Due to the massive amount of hoarded materials in her apartment, the floor was likely to collapse quickly and couldn't bear additional weight. Andy wanted to wait for the structure to be stabilized before going after Evelyn, but Maya and Sullivan didn't believe they had time to wait. Sullivan wanted to send Ben in after Evelyn, but Maya suggested Andy instead because she's the lightest member of the team. Andy was sent in with a stretcher to bring Evelyn back out. She had to have Evelyn call out to her to make sure she was going in the right direction. When she reached Evelyn, she assessed her status and then put her on the stretcher. The floor started to crack as Andy made her way out. As she reached the door, she sent Evelyn out and Evelyn was pulled to safety in the hallway. She was then put on a stretcher to go to the hospital. Liam and Jaime said they were glad she was safe, even though her apartment had fallen into theirs.



She was married until her husband Jeffrey died. After his death, she began hoarding because she said her husband was the one who always knew what to keep and what to throw away.


She is friends with [[Jaime]] and [[Liam]], who live in the apartment beneath hers.


*She has arthritis in her fingers.

'''Finley''' is the friend and romantic interest of [[Piper]].


Finley was considering a move to New York due to a new job she'd gotten. She spoke to her best friend, Piper, about it, but Piper wasn't enthusiastic, making Finley believe she wasn't supportive. However, Piper was secretly in love with her and hadn't told her. When Piper fell into a pot hole in the street, Finley was worried about her. Piper then confessed her love and the two shared a kiss. Finley then accompanied Piper to the hospital once her leg was extracted.



She and her best friend Piper had romantic feelings for each other, but neither of them said anything until Piper was trapped in a pot hole and confessed that that's why she didn't want Finley to move away. They shared a kiss.

'''Fire Chief McCallister''' is the former fire chief for the [[Seattle Fire Department]]



Fire Chief McCallister came to the scene of a fire at the Garcia house. When [[Zaza Delgado]] was pulled out of the house with burns over % of his body, McCallister ordered Maya to wait the estimated eight minutes it would take to get another aid car to their location to transport him to the hospital, citing the risk of lawsuit if he died en route to the hospital in the engine. Maya said she was tired of risking lives by following protocols designed to avoid lawsuits and had her team load Zaza onto the engine with medical supplies against McCallister's direct order.

As a result of Maya's actions, McCallister said there would be an official investigation. He spoke to Andy and Sullivan about the incident, saying he should fire both of them and their captain and shut  down, but Sullivan said if McCallister made him captain of , he could get the house back in order. The firefighters were later informed that Maya had been relieved of her duties. ''("[[Forever and Ever, Amen]]")''

Maya, Carina, and Andy left the wedding to confront McCallister about this demotion. Maya said she was just doing what was right instead of allowing a child to die in the street. Carina pointed out that the child lived. Andy said she knew multiple male fire captains who were similarly insubordinate and weren't relieved of their duties, including her own father. Maya said she refused to accept her demotion, saying her team wouldn't accept it either. McCallister then told Andy she was reassigned to station  effective immediately. He told Maya she could keep , but he'd reassign the whole team, so she accepted the demotion pending investigation. She said Andy would be the best replacement in her absence, but he made it clear that Andy's reassignment was still in place. ''("[[Phoenix from the Flame]]")''


When a gas main exploded about half a mile from station , McCallister arrived after station  had been called as backup. With the threat of another explosion looming, Beckett told McCallister he would have to take command of the scene while Beckett helped with evacuation. ''("[[Things We Lost in the Fire (Station )|Things We Lost in the Fire]]")''

An investigation into his action was launched after this event. He decided to take early retirement as a result. ''("[[All I Want for Christmas is You]]")''


He was the fire chief of the [[Seattle Fire Department]]. He was appointed to this position after the arrest and removal of [[Michael Dixon]]. He took early retirement after the [[Things We Lost in the Fire (Station )|gas main explosion]], which led to the death of [[Dean Miller]].

'''Frank''' is the brother of [[Joey Phillips]].


While out patrolling, Jack and Ben noticed Sarah, standing in an alley with blood on her clothes. Jack got out and tried to follow her, but she ran away without saying anything, leaving behind her stuffed bear. Jack saw her again at the homeless camp and she told him that they told her not to get help, but her brother was dying. She led them to [[Joey Phillips]], who was injured when he fell through a floor in an old warehouse while looking for a place for them to sleep because Sarah's always cold. They noted that his collarbone was fractured and he was altered. They prepared to take him to the hospital, but he objected, as did the other kids, including Frank. Sarah said some of them were bio siblings and some were foster. They ran away when their foster dad got arrested and if the state found them, they'd be split up. Joey was keeping them together. They had to intubate Joey and then they took him to the hospital. Jack instructed the other kids how to get to Grey Sloan Memorial and told them to meet Joey there. They ran to the hospital alongside the ambulance and when they got there, they ran inside and sat together in the waiting room for news about Joey. ''("[[House Where Nobody Lives]]")''

They were later taken by social workers. ''("[[Save the Last Dance for Me]]")''

When Joey refused to do his physical therapy because he felt guilty for being safe and warm while he didn't know the same was true for his siblings, Bailey made some calls and arranged for them to come to the hospital to have pizza and play video games with him. They all assured Joey they were happy and safe in their new foster homes. ''("[[A Diagnosis]]")''


As a surprise for Joey, Ben arranged for Sarah, Ernie, and Frank to come to the push-in for the new engine. He hadn't seen them in months, but knew that Frank and Sarah were living with a family outside the city. ''("[[Too Darn Hot]]")''



At some point, he ended up in foster care, in a house with [[Joey Phillips]], [[Sarah (House Where Nobody Lives)|Sarah]], and [[Ernie (House Where Nobody Lives)|Ernie]]. When their foster father was arrested, they ran away together and started living on the streets. They were split up again when Joey was hospitalized and social services was called for the other three.

After they were split up, he said he was staying with a pretty nice lady who made pancakes. ''("[[A Diagnosis]]")''

'''Gabriella Aurora''' is one of Carina's friends from medical school.



Gabriella and [[Carina DeLuca]] met when they were in medical school. Due to their very busy, exhausting schedules, they never dated, but sometimes had sex to get a release. During their time in medical school together, they took a road trip in a car with a broken air conditioner, but still had a good time. At another point, Andrew visited them and stayed in Gabriella's room, which excited him.

Years later, when Gabriella heard that Andrew had been killed, she drove overnight to Seattle to see Carina. She made Carina espresso and food and they pored over memories of their time in medical school and memories of Andrew. Gabriella chided Maya for not speaking Italian and not being able to make good espresso for Carina, though Maya said she was trying to learn. When Maya left to deal with a friend emergency, they continued to share memories until Carina left to help Maya. ''("[[Make No Mistake, He's Mine]]")''


As the pandemic worsened in Italy, Gabriella traveled back to Italy to help out. Carina planned to join her. The day Carina was meant to fly out, Gabriella correctly deduced that Carina had not even begun packing. Gabriella called Carina several times throughout the day, asking for help working out problems she was having. At the end of the day, when Maya and Carina had a fight and Carina left for the airport on her own, Carina told Gabriella that Maya had proposed, but Carina didn't want to get married just to get a visa. Gabriella encouraged her to do it if the alternative was losing Maya, saying that she'd never seen Carina light up the way she did when she was with Maya. Even when she was grieving, it was clear that Maya made her happy. ''("[[Comfortably Numb]]")''



She and Carina have been friends since meeting in medical school. Despite having sex during this time, they never dated.


She is a doctor of some kind working at Paolo Calvino Hospital in Italy.

'''Garth Jones''' is a patient who was injured while playing hockey.


Garth came into the ER after being injured while playing hockey. He had run into [[Tyler Hemphill]] and stepped on his face. Garth had less serious injuries. He was treated in the ER and they ran tests. While he was waiting, he started to have trouble breathing. [[Steve Duncan]], who was in the bed next to his, called for a doctor. They determined that Garth's broken ribs had punctured a lung and it had collapsed. He was rushed into surgery to repair the damage.



He plays hockey with [[Tyler Hemphill]].

'''Gary''' is a friend of Dixon's who used their friendship to skip inspections.


Gary was starting a new business in Seattle. Since he was friends with [[Michael Dixon]], he was assured that the permits would be taken care of. Dixon then passed it on to Sullivan to approve without inspection. Sullivan misunderstood what was happening and sent Vic and Travis there to do an inspection. Gary immediately tried to send them away. They called Sullivan, who realized what he'd done and told them to go home, despite them having noticed multiple fire hazards.



He and [[Michael Dixon]] are friends.


He is the owner of South Seattle Home Center at  Shoreline Way, Seattle, Washington .

He was unaware that she was keeping a tiger in her house as a pet. When Yvonne refused to tell the firefighters what had happened, Gavin told them she'd been calling out for Lorelei before he left.


He is a delivery driver.

'''Graham''' is a resident of a building that had a power outage who had to be evacuated.


After the power went out in his building, Graham started eating all the ice cream out of his freezer. When station  came to search the building for [[Penelope Hayes]], who had gone missing, they came up Graham, who was confused. They thought maybe his apartment was filled with gas because he had left his gas stove on when the power went out, but Maya discovered that the apartment was filled with gas despite the stove not being the source. They then knew there was a gas leak in the building and took Graham down to the Aid Car for treatment while they evacuated the whole building.

'''Grant''' is the ex-boyfriend of [[Travis Montgomery]].



Grant takes care of his grandmother, Edith. When she started having tremors and falling often, Edith chose not to tell Grant about it because she didn't want him to worry. However, when Travis was checking on Edith while Grant was visiting, he told Grant that she needed to see a doctor very soon. ''("[[Reignited]]")''


Grant saw Travis again at a yoga place. Grant gave Travis his number, but Travis didn't use it. They were both lured to Edith's apartment under false pretenses, where she tried to set them up. Travis told Grant he was interested in seeing him again, but when Grant tried to make plans, Travis just said he'd be in touch.

The next morning, Grant came to the station. Travis told him he doesn't date, but then Grant laid out his plans for their first few dates and Travis agreed to get breakfast. ''("[[Let It Burn]]")''


Grant made Travis the promised breakfast, eggs cooked in a jar, which he promised would be the best thing Travis ever tasted. After tasting the eggs, Travis agreed. ''("[[Hot Box]]")''


Grant went shopping with Travis one morning before work and helped him bring the groceries into the station. While he was there, Travis learned he'd made plans with Maya and Vic to do aerial yoga. Travis thought it was strange that they were making plans and walked Grant out. Grant said he didn't want Travis playing games and if he needed to go slower, that was okay. ''("[[Not Your Hero]]")''


Grant came to the hospital when he learned that Travis has been taken there. They wouldn't tell him anything at the desk because he wasn't family, but Ben and  Vic filled him in on Travis's condition. He was confused about Travis having been left alone and angry when he learned that Ben had left him. He waited with Ben and Vic for news about Travis. Travis ultimately made it through his surgery and Grant took care of him as he recovered. ''("[[No Recovery]]")''

After six weeks, Travis was ready to try to go back to work, but Grant wanted him to ask for more time off. Travis went into work one day to talk to Sullivan about that, but got caught up in helping in the search for Max and felt he was ready to step back into work. Grant was upset by this, but Travis reassured him that it was the right decision. ''("[[Under the Surface]]")''


Grant had a meeting with a restaurant investor. He needed the dry cleaning that Travis had picked up for him, which Travis accidentally left at the fire station, so Grant said he'd pick it up during his break. When he arrived, he met Sullivan and was surprised by how attractive he was. ''("[[Do a Little Harm...]]")''


When the restaurant where Grant works decided to stay closed during the windstorm, Grant ended up going to Friendsgiving with Travis. When he arrived, he was enlisted to help with the cooking. After the team was called away, he helped Greg, Ryan, and Pruitt move the meal to the station. While the team was gone on a call, they finished the meal and player poker while they waited for their return. When the team returned, they sat down to eat. ''("[[Weather the Storm]]")''

Grant expressed his desire to leave the station after Friendsgiving was over, but couldn't because it was still stormy outside. When conditions improved, Travis told him he could leave. Before he left, they got into a fight and decided to end their relationship, because they wanted different things. ''("[[Crash and Burn]]")''



He started seeing Travis after his grandmother set them up. ''("[[Let It Burn]]")'' Travis told Grant they they'd have to go very, very slow for him to ease back into dating. Grant was okay with that, but after a difficult shift, Travis went to Grant, kissed him, and told him he didn't want a slow burn. ''("[[Hot Box]]")'' When Travis was injured in the skyscraper fire, Grant took care of him during his recovery. ''("[[No Recovery]]")'' Due to Travis being injured, they skipped over a lot of the early courtship, including having sex. To combat this, Travis wore part of his fire uniform and seduced Grant. ''("[[Do a Little Harm...]]")''

During Friendsgiving, things became awkward when Greg assumed Grant and Travis were married after seeing Travis's ring and Grant denied it quickly and emphatically. This worried Travis, who asked Grant about it at the end of the day. Grant revealed that he didn't want to get married. ''("[[Weather the Storm]]")'' Travis tried to talk to Grant about this, but they ended up having sex instead. Later, when Travis was left behind to look after Jack, who then ran away, they talked again. Travis said he wanted to get married again, as he had enjoyed being married. They argued over it and Travis called him Michael during the argument, so they both agreed it wasn't working and parted ways. ''("[[Crash and Burn]]")''


He takes care of his grandmother. His grandfather died of Parkinson's. ''("[[Reignited]]")''


He teaches yoga. He was also recently promoted to line cook at his restaurant. ''("[[Let It Burn]]")''

'''Greg''' is a man who was abusing his wife.


Greg's wife, Amy, was making eggs for their son for dinner when Greg got angry and attacked her, throwing the pan of eggs across the kitchen floor. Afterward, he acted as if nothing would happen, even when Crisis One responded to the call that Amy was having an anxiety attack. He told them that she had panic attacks all the time and minimized their concerns about her, saying they could leave and she would be fine. However, they had recognized the signs of domestic violence and Amy had quietly confirmed that she wasn't safe in the home. Jack stepped away to call the police and Vic impulsively picked up their son and told Amy it was time to leave. Greg called the polce himself and reported it as an attempted kidnapping. However, when police arrived, they found bruises on Amy and arrested Greg. They were only going to keep him overnight to let him calm down, but while he was gone, Vic helped Amy pack to leave for her cousin's in Portland and tell the police she wanted to press charges against him.



He is currently separated from [[Amy]] after he continuously abused her.


He and Amy have a son, whom Greg used to keep Amy from leaving.


*He and Amy lived at  Forrester Lane until she left him.

'''Greg Tanner''' is the father of [[Ryan Tanner]].



In , there was a windstorm, during which Pruitt had to board up the Tanners' windows.<ref>[[Weather the Storm]], x (S)</ref>


Greg was at the scene when they arrested a man during a poker game. He hid in a closet while the other players were asked to give statements. Ryan found him. He'd figured out that his father was there when he saw his father's favorite cigarette at the table. Greg immediately offered to give up any information he had, but Ryan said they just wanted a statement because they weren't after him this time. Ryan was also upset to learn that Greg had been back in Seattle for two and a half months and hadn't contacted him. When Greg then asked for a ride, Ryan tried to refuse, but ended up taking Greg to his next call, where he left Greg in the back seat while he interviewed someone who claimed to have been robbed. Greg told Ryan that the guy hadn't been robbed and explained why. Ryan then revealed he knew the whole time, because Greg had taught him to think like a criminal his whole life. At the end of the day, Greg told Ryan that he wanted to grow a relationship with Ryan, but Ryan said he didn't need one or want one. ''("[[Lost and Found]]")''


On his way to meet with his son, Greg saw a couple people trying to attack a kid. He stepped in to break up the fight, but they turned their attention to him instead and beat him up. He walked over to Station  to ask Pruitt to patch him up. He instead found Andy and Maya. Andy knew who he was and started to patch up his injuries. She wanted to take him to the hospital, but he refused, so she had him sign a waiver. When she and Maya were called out, Pruitt took over patching up his injuries. After a confrontation with Ryan, who believed he was lying about defending a kid, he tried to leave the station. However, when Andy and Maya returned to the station, they found him passed out in the elevator. They believed he had a cardiac bruise. They were able to resuscitate him and sent him to the hospital, where Ryan accompanied him, having heard from police dispatch that a civilian had intervened in a fight as Greg described. ''("[[Last Day on Earth]]")''


Greg stayed with Ryan while he recovered from his injuries. Ryan decided to bring him to Friendsgiving. When the team was called away, Greg had the idea to bring Friendsgiving to the station for them. While they waited for the team to return from their call, they played poker and reminisced. At the end of the day, they sat down to eat with the returned team, but Greg went to find Ryan, who revealed there was a warrant out for Greg's arrest. He told Greg he had two choices: he could arrest Greg or he could let Greg go and never ever see him again and he wasn't sure which he was going to do. ''("[[Weather the Storm]]")''

Greg told Ryan to arrest him and Ryan agreed, but used the storm as an excuse to put it off. ''("[[Crash and Burn]]")''

After disappearing, Greg resurfaced because he wanted to give Ryan the key to a storage unit, which he said held something for him. Ryan went to the unit and found a large amount of money, which he said was clean and told Ryan to use for the mortgage. ''("[[I Fought the Law]]")''



He is divorced from Ryan's mother.


He is estranged from his son.


*He likes gambling and cigars.<ref>[[Lost and Found]], x (S)</ref>

'''Gregory Dougal''' is a man who was caught in the process of kidnapping his daughter.


Gregory was upset with the custody arrangement after he and [[Janet (Home To Hold Onto)|Janet]] got divorced. He impulsively decided to kidnap Lindy and disappear with her. As he fled with her, he was pulled over by Ryan, who was suspicious of Gregory because he saw the ring tan line and a quickly packed bag for Lindy. He went back to his squad car and radioed in his suspicions. When it was confirmed that there was an Amber alert out for Lindy, Ryan stalled while they waited for additional help to arrive. Sensing that Gregory was starting to get impatient, Ryan went over to his car and quietly explained that it wouldn't end well for him if he fled with Lindy and convinced him to turn himself in and let Lindy go back with her mother while he was arrested.



He is divorced from [[Janet (Home To Hold Onto)|Janet]]. Together, they have a daughter, [[Lindy Dougal|Lindy]].


He was upset with the custody arrangement for his daughter after his divorce, which led him to try to kidnap her.


*He lives at  Cerritos Street in Seattle, Washington
*He's '", weighs  lbs., and has brown eyes.
*He drives a  Honda Accord.

'''Griffin Ford''' is a billionaire who came to the hospital to search for a reason for him making an error.


Griffin made a mistake while working on a rocket which led to it exploding over a gas station, causing several injuries, including the evisceration of [[Rigo Vasquez]]. ''("[[Satellite of Love]]")''

As bad press brewed and there was talk of criminal charges against him, Griffin went to Grey Sloan Memorial saying he believed there was a medical reason why he made that mistake and caused the rocket explosion. Tom got Meredith to run some tests, but when her other patient got a CT, she called in Jackson to take over. Jackson completed his tests and said there was nothing wrong with him and it seemed like he was just looking for an explanation where there wasn't one. Griffin then went to Tom and said he couldn't do all the good work he was working on if he were put in jail. He pressured Tom to lie and say something was wrong with him. After some thinking, Tom came back to him and said he had an aneurysm which could have affected his judgment and might require surgery. Tom said when they'd know whether or not he'd need surgery would depend on how large the check was. ''("[[Life on Mars?]]")''



He was married, but said he was a bad husband.


He owns a large tech company.


*He sucks at golf.
*He has a dog named Emmie.
*He has a vitamin D deficiency.

Jack asked Gulden where [[Sean (Lost and Found)|Sean]] was and Gulden told him that they tried to treat him, but he left as soon as Jack did. ''("[[Lost and Found]]")''

'''Hallie''' is a woman who was in a car accident and then got swept up into a tornado.


Hallie was driving in a car she and her husband had just bought when she was hit by [[Wes (Twist and Shout)|Wes]], who claims Hallie was turning when she wasn't supposed to be. When station  arrived on the scene, Maya put a collar on Hallie, then Andy checked her out. Hallie said her right hand was hurting, but couldn't tell if her other hand hurt as well. Before they could get her out, a tornado swept through the town, forcing them to abandon Hallie to shelter themselves. Andy told her to cover her head, but Hallie began to panic immediately and pulled off the collar.

When the tornado passed, Hallie found herself still trapped in her car, a short ways away from where she'd been before. Travis Montgomery was there at a political event and he came out to calm her down while they waited for the aid car to come and get her out. When she started to panic more, Travis had [[Norton]] bring him tools and he got Hallie out and onto a table as an aid car arrived to take her to the hospital. He then found her phone and used it to call her husband. He assured Adam that Hallie was okay, then handed the phone to Hallie so she could tell him herself.



She is married to Adam. They got married a year ago, but have been together for five. Their wedding took place in her parents' backyard and she says it was the best day of her life.

'''Hannah Sherwood''' is a woman who was rescued after getting her hand stuck in a garbage disposal.


Hannah was doing dishes when her wedding ring fell down into the disposal. She impulsively reached for it and got her hand stuck in the garbage disposal. She called for help and Ben, Travis, and Dean responded to the call. Travis, who had the most experience with the situation, began taking the disposal apart from below while Dean and Ben talked to her and gave her pain medication. Her daughter watched them work and seemed disinterested in her mother's condition. When Hannah noticed the tattoo on Parker's arm, she nearly pulled her hand out, but they stopped her. Once Travis finished taking apart the disposal, Hannah was able to remove her hand. Then they bandaged her up and told her to follow up with the hospital. Despite her detached attitude during the ordeal, Parker hugged her mom.



She is married to Val Sherwood. Val is in the Army and is frequently deployed. Hannah said she missed Val every day and worried she was screwing up Parker on her own.


Her daughter, Parker, started acting out when her wife was deployed because she missed her mom.


*She and her family live at  Cedar Drive.

'''Harold''' was one of the passengers on the train with a bird flu outbreak.


Harold and his son, Will, were on the subway when the train stalled. A few people on the train were injured, including Will. While Maya was examining him, he coughed up blood. Maya noticed his luggage, which indicated he'd just gotten off an international flight, and asked where he'd been. Harold explained that he'd been in Bashran with his mother, an aid worker. Maya, remembering the news reports about an outbreak of the avian flu, called out to report the symptoms and the CDC was called in. Another subway passenger, [[Neil]], had been on the same flight and also had some symptoms. After talking to Harold about Will's condition, Maya and Jack made an announcement to the whole care and informed them they wouldn't be able to leave until the CDC cleared them. Tensions started to rise as Will and Neil's condition declined. When [[Reese]] tried to leave, a security guard, [[Kenneth]], stopped him using a taser, which caused him heart trouble. Because they didn't have access to the outside, Jack decided to use Harold as a walking blood donor for his son. Once the blood got to Will, he started to improve and once the CDC arrived, he was moved to the hospital in isolation.



He was involved with Will's mother, but they didn't stay together.


His son was born when he was very young. When Will was younger, they got along well, but when Will went to live in Bashran with his mother, he and Harold drifted apart.


*His blood type is O-.

'''Harry''' is a man who threatened to light himself on fire after his wife left him.


Harry's wife shocked him one day by saying their marriage was over after twenty-five years. The next day, his neighbors called  when they saw him yelling and pacing in his front yard. Crisis One arrived to find Harry quietly sitting in his car. Travis asked him what was going on and suggested he call his wife, not aware of what had happened between then. Harry called his wife and held the phone up so Travis could hear her yelling at him. Then he picked up the container of gas next to him and poured it on his lap. He quickly began to choke on the fumes, so Travis was able to persuade him to open the door so he could breathe. He did while revealed that he had a lighter in his hand. Travis started asking him about his work. Though he recognized Travis was just trying to distract him, he answered the question. At this point, Andy insisted on calling the engine, so they would be able to put him out if he lit himself on fire. When it arrived, Harry became agitated. He told Travis about his wife suddenly leaving him, saying it was a long-time coming. That was news to him, as she had not previously mentioned anything to him. To connect with Harry, Travis confessed that he was doing the same thing to someone, falling out of love and not giving him the chance to fix things. Harry then lit the lighter and dropped it as his feat, igniting himself. Maya and Sullivan quickly put him out with fire extinguishers with some help from the hose. They then put him on a stretcher and got him into the aid car to go to the hospital.



He was married to his wife, Susan, for  years when woke up one day and told him it was over, blindsiding him. On their wedding day, she gave him a lighter engraved with a No\uebl Coward quote, "Marriage is the aftermath of love." He later used that same lighter to light himself on fire.


He's a scholar. He wrote his dissertation on No\uebl Coward.

'''Hattie''' is a documentary filmmaker who tried to make a film about a "haunted" house.


Hattie, Cory, and Tobias were making a documentary about the Hackett Murder House when Tobias and Cory ended up trapped in the house while Hattie escaped. Hattie called for help and station  responded. Maya, Travis, Theo, and Sullivan entered the house to search for them while Hattie remained outside. Maya and Sullivan searched the downstairs while Travis and Theo checked upstairs. Maya and Sullivan found Tobias, who was trapped under a fallen shelf. They freed him and took him out. Then they noticed Travis and Theo weren't reachable by radio. Tobias informed them there was a trap door in the house, so they went back in and searched for it. When they found it, they broke through it and evacuated Travis, Theo, and Cory, who had all fallen down there.



She works with [[Cory]] and [[Tobias]], making documentary films.


She makes documentary films.

'''Henry Lau''' is [[JJ Lau|JJ's]] father and [[Pruitt Arike Miller|Pru's]] grandfather.


Henry and his wife, Petra, flew from Hong Kong to Seattle to meet their granddaughter, Pru, and her father, Dean. Upon their arrival in Seattle, they pledged their support for Dean suing over his wrongful arrest, which they'd seen on video. They also pledged their support for Pru. They had looked up Dean and his parents to know who Pru had in her corner and arranged to meet Dean's parents at his houseboat to get to know each other. After the dinner, they expressed desire to continue to visit Pru and get to know her.



He is married to [[Petra Lau]].


His great-grandfather built parts of the transcontinental railroad. Then his son opened a store, which was burned down. They re-built it, but it was burned three more times because they were Chinese. After that, they moved to Hong Kong and made their fortune there.

He and his wife were both dismayed at how their daughter turned out, including her leaving her daughter shortly after birth. Despite this, they had a strong desire to be in Pru's life and help support her.


He and his wife are the owners of Lau Central Pacific Holdings, a private equity firm.

'''Hima''' is a high school fling of Maya's.


Hima met Maya while racing at their school. She invited Maya to get pizza, but changed the plans to a movie when she learned Maya was on a strict diet. They hung out and studied together, but Hima questioned Maya's strict adherence to her diet and training. The two shared a kiss, but it didn't go much further because after stopping to check on Hima who had tripped during a race, Maya's father drilled into her that she couldn't have any distractions. After winning her next race, Maya brushed off Hima's congratulations.



She and [[Maya Bishop]] had a very brief thing when they met while running. They studied together and shared a kiss. However, after Maya's father criticized her for stopping during a race to check on Hima, Maya ended things.

'''Holly''' is a woman who was raped in college by [[Jeremy Benanti]].


When Holly was in college, she went to a bar where they had $ margarita night. She drank many of these and went outside when she felt like she was going to vomit. [[Jeremy Benanti]] follow her out. When she woke up the next morning, she didn't know anything was wrong until she went to take a shower and realized her panties were missing. She showered, then noticed she had bruises up and down her sides. Her roommate told her to report it, but she didn't know what to say because she didn't know what happened. She ended up failing out of school the second semester. Her parents sent her to a shrink and she had a recovered memory of Jeremy pulling her beside the dumpster outside the bar and raping her. She reported it to the dean, but the dean said he didn't want to ruin a young man's future over the word of a drunk college dropout.

Years later, Holly learned that [[Andy Herrera]] had killed Jeremy in self-defense after he attempted to rape her outside a bar. She was shocked when Andy came into the coffeeshop where she was working to ask her to come talk to the prosecutor about her experience in the hopes of the prosecutor dropping the manslaughter charge against Andy. She tried to get Andy to leave, saying she didn't want her son to see Jeremy's case associated with her, but Andy persuaded her to tell her story. Once Holly told Andy what had happened to her, Andy said that she was looking at ten years if convicted and she needed people to stand up and say it wasn't right for her to go to jail for defending herself. Holly agreed to go with Andy to the prosector's office and the charges against her were dropped.



She has a son she's raising on her own because his dad isn't in the picture.


She is a barista at La Gaviota.

'''Howard Bonaman''' is the husband of [[Brenda Bonaman]].


At some point in his life, after trying for a while, Howard and his wife, Brenda, were told that she couldn't conceive a baby. Because of this, Howard planned exciting trips to fill that space.

On one of those trips, duck hunting, Howard accidentally shot Brenda in the neck. She was rushed to the ER and then immediately to the OR. Before they anesthetized her for her surgery, she complained of abdominal pain and [[Callie Torres|Callie]] discovered that she was about to give birth, despite believing she couldn't conceive. Before she could have her surgery, they needed her to give birth, so she was instructed to push. The pushing caused one of the pellets in her neck to dislodge and travel to her heart, causing arrhythmias. She was unable to see or hold her daughter before they had to anesthetize her for surgery. Despite some complications, her surgery went well and she was able to meet her daughter when she woke up. Howard was shocked when he was told that he had a daughter.



He is married to [[Brenda Bonaman]]. Together, they have one daughter.


Howard and Brenda believed she couldn't get pregnant, so they filled their lives with as much excitement as they could. When she did become pregnant, she went the duration of the pregnancy without knowing she was pregnant until she went into labor at the hospital and gave birth to a healthy baby girl.

'''Ifeya Miller''' is the mother of [[Dean Miller]].



Ifeya used to walk her children to school every day. The other kids would laugh because they looked different and because she talked different and she would bend down and say to her son, "We are Nigerian and we are brave". ''("[[Something About What Happens When We Talk]]")''


Ifeya, along with her husband and daughter, went to her son's house to have dinner with him and Jack. During the dinner, Ifeya and Bill continuously tried to get Dean to join the family business. This came to a head when Yemi announced that she wanted to move out of their house, inspired by Dean. Ifeya then took Dean outside to talk to him privately, where he explained that being a firefighter is more than a job to him. He and Ifeya then made a deal that she would back off Yemi and let her move out and support her if he would go on a few dates that she set up for him. ''("[[Baby Boom]]")''


When Pru was born, Ifeya and Bill disapproved of how she came into the world and cut Dean off for some time. However. After the start of the [[COVID- Pandemic]] and Dean's wrongful arrest, they started to mend fences.

Ifeya came to Dean's house to babysit Pru while he went to work. He spent a bit of time before they left explaining to her how to take care of Pru, but she reminded him she'd taken care of kids before. ''("[[Here It Comes Again]]")''


When JJ's parents came to town to meet Dean and Pru, they arranged to have a dinner with Ifeya and Bill. Despite a small amount of tension, with Ifeya expressing that she didn't want Pru influenced by JJ's lifestyle, the dinner went well and JJ's parents expressed desire to continue visiting her and having a relationship with her. ''("[[I Guess I'm Floating]]")''


On the first day of Crisis One, Ifeya went to [[Dean's Houseboat]] and babysat Pru so he could go to work. She felt it was too soon to launch the program and believed they needed more training. ''("[[Can't Feel My Face]]")''


Despite Dean's will stipulating that he wanted Pru to be raised by Ben and Bailey in the event of his death, Ifeya and Bill took her to live with them and insisted that they would be raising her instead. They also cleared out Dean's houseboat and arranged for it to be sold. When Ben and Bailey tried to reach a good solution for everyone, she refused and said she needed to override her son because she didn't believe he'd made the right decision for Pru. However, when Pru woke up that night crying for Bailey, she called Bailey and let her, along with Ben and Joey, help put Pru back to bed. ''("[[A House Is Not a Home]]")''

After months of fighting, Ifeya and Bill came to Ben and Bailey's place and told them that they wanted Pru to live with Ben and Bailey permanently, but wanted virtually all holidays and alternating birthdays. Bailey rejected the offer, saying that arrangement made them glorified nannies while Ifeya and Bill got to do all the fun things. She then implied that she was privy to some private medical information that could make the difference in court. Ifeya then told Bailey she'd had a heart attack and had had surgery to implant a pacemaker, which they were still adjusting. It made it difficult to keep up with a toddler. Ifeya and Bill then agreed to sharing the holidays, but Ifeya still asked Ben to quit firefighting, as she didn't want Pru to lose a second father to a fire. ''("[[Cold Blue Steel and Sweet Fire]]")''



She is married to [[Bill Miller (Character)|Bill Miller]] with two children. They met when they were .


She wanted both her children to join the family business and puts a lot of pressure on both of them to be successful. She was disappointed when Dean became a firefighter and when his daughter [[Pruitt Arike Miller]] was born, she cut him off and refused to meet his daughter.


She started and runs her own business. She expects both of her children to join the family business.


*She was born in Nigeria and came to the US as an exchange student.
*She speaks both English and Yoruba.

'''Inara''' is a woman whom Jack saved from her abusive husband. She had a short-lived romantic relationship with Jack.



Inara and her son, Marcus, were living with her new husband, Ted. Marcus witnessed Ted hitting his mother and turned the burners on to fill the house with gas. Then his mother called  to report a gas leak. The firefighters responded to the calls, which happened three times in a single week. During the third call, they became suspicious that something more serious was going on, especially after Jack saw Inara signing to Marcus that daddy had calmed down. Jack separated Marcus and Inara from Ted and used sign language to learn the truth about what was happening, including that Inara didn't have anywhere else to take Marcus. She also said she'd called the police the first time it happened, but Ted convinced them she was overreacting and he'd locked her in a closet for eleven hours that night. Once he knew the truth, Jack helped Dean stall Ted while Inara went inside and packed a bag. Then they lied to Ted and said it was safe for him to stay in the house but not for Marcus and Inara to stay with him. While he was disputing this, they noticed flames in a room in the house. The fire was quickly extinguished and Ted believed that Marcus started it. When the firefighters witnessed him grabbing Marcus and yelling at him, they pulled him away. Jack then took Inara and Marcus to [[Marsha Smith|Marsha's]] house where she welcomed them to stay with her. Knowing that Inara had started the fire when she was inside packing her bag, Jack told her to flush the matches she had, throw away the clothes she was wearing, and scrub herself in the shower. She thanked him for his help. ''("[[Dream a Little Dream of Me]]")''


Inara and Marcus continued to live with Marsha. Jack came by after his shift and spent time with Marsha, Inara, and Marcus, who taught him facts about dinosaurs. ''("[[Louder Than a Bomb]]")''

During the Covid- pandemic, Jack delivered groceries and supplies to them. He was unable to come inside, but flirted with Inara from a distance as she stood in the doorway. ''("[[Nothing Seems the Same]]")''

Inara made energy bars for the firefighters, which she sent to the station with Jack. While he claimed the others loved them, she knew that wasn't true as she'd tasted one herself. Later, when a loose tiger became trapped in the barn at the station, Jack FaceTimed Inara and Marcus so they could see the tiger. ''("[[Wild World]]")''

Inara told Jack he didn't have to keep feeding them, but he said he wanted to. ''("[[We Are Family]]")''

One day, while Inara was at work, Marsha collapsed, so Marcus texted Jack, who brought the aid car to pick her up. She was struggling to breath, so they took both her and Marcus to Grey Sloan. She was immediately tested and taken to the COVID unit. Jack and Marcus were also tested immediately and Inara was tested later. Marsha's test came back positive, but the other three tested negative. Jack was upset because Marsha had continuously refused to wear her mask. When Inara got home from work, she was worried that Marsha would die and they'd have to find another place to live. Jack offered to stay in the apartment with them until Marsha was able to come home, to keep them safe from Ted. He ended up sleeping on the couch, while Marcus slept on the floor next to him. ''("[[Don't Look Back in Anger]]")''

After some time in the hospital, Marsha started feeling better. She video called Inara, Jack, and Marcus asking for gossip and Inara and Jack were surprised to learn that Marcus already knew the two of them had hooked up and both he and Marsha were happy about it. Later, when Jack came home and asked Inara officially to be his girlfriend, Marcus and Marsha both celebrated. ''("[[Learning to Fly]]")''

Marsha's condition continued to improve until she was finally told she'd be able to go home the next day. Jack took the day off and he, Marcus, and Inara planned to come to the hospital to pick her up. However, as they were getting ready to leave, Jack got a call from Emmett telling them not to come as Marsha had taken a turn and they expected her to need to go on a ventilator later that day. Jack hadn't gotten a call as her son was her emergency contact. They were all heartbroken that they wouldn't be able to bring her home, so Maya brought the ladder truck to the hospital and Jack climbed up with Marcus and they held a sign outside Marsha's hospital window telling her to get better soon so Marcus could beat her at Parcheesi. ''("[[Make No Mistake, He's Mine]]")''

Inara called Jack when Marcus panicked after seeing a fire truck drive by. He was worried that something would happen to Jack while he was at work. At the advice of Theo Ruiz, whose own father was a firefighter who died in the line of duty, Jack took Marcus on a tour of the station over the phone and explained to him that most of the job wasn't very dangerous at all. This helped reassure Marcus that Jack wasn't going anywhere. ''("[[No One is Alone]]")''

With Marsha on a ventilator, her son eventually stepped in and used his power of attorney to have them remove it. When the time came, Jack, Inara, and Marcus did a video call with the hospital. Her son was also on the call, but left as soon as the process was initiated. Levi explained to them that there would probably be shallowing of her breathing and it could take minutes or hours. They stayed on the call and talked to her as she breathed. Hours later, while Jack was sharing a memory of Marsha getting a pet bird to talk to, they were surprised to hear Marsha laughing. She had woken up and was breathing well enough on her own. All the firefighters celebrated along with Inara, Jack, and Marcus. ''("[[Save Yourself]]")''

When Marsha improved enough to come home, Inara and Jack got her set up on the couch with everything she needed before they went to work for the day. ''("[[Here It Comes Again]]")''

As Marsha progressed in her recovery, she offered to take Marcus to the park to work on an egg-drop project for school, giving Jack and Inara their first real alone time as a couple. They started to kiss some time after Marsha and Marcus left, but were interrupted when [[Sonia]] fell past their window into the dumpster. They rushed downstairs to help her. While Jack was talking to Sonia, keeping her calm, Inara was shocked to learn that Jack had slept with [[Eva Vasquez|a married woman]]. After Sonia was taken to the hospital, Jack and Inara returned to their alone time and had sex. ''("[[Comfortably Numb]]")''


With the tension growing between her and Jack, Inara decided to take Marcus and move to California to live with her sister. She'd previously been unable to as Ted knew where the sister lived, but the sister had moved and Ted had gone to New York with a new woman, making Inara believe it was safe. Before she left, she attended Maya and Carina's Wedding with Jack. At the wedding, Inara stopped Jack when he started to say something. She was insistent that she was going to take Marcus and move and that Jack would stay in Seattle with Marsha. She knew that Jack wasn't in love with her, but rather with their family unit and didn't want Marcus to continue to get attached. ''("[[Forever and Ever, Amen]]")''



[[Ted]]
She is divorced from [[Ted]]. Because he was abusive, she lives in fear that he'll find her.

[[Jack Gibson]]
She developed a relationship with Jack after Jack helped her escape her abusive husband and set her up to live with Marsha. Their relationship grew until one day, while Marsha was in the hospital with COVID and Marcus was asleep, they kissed and then had sex. Jack tried to talk to her about it afterward, but she said she felt good and didn't want to lose that good feeling, so she asked him to wait. ''("[[Out of Control]]")''


She has one son, Marcus. She also has a sister who lives in California, whom she went to live with after she deemed it safe to do so without Ted finding her. ''("[[Forever and Ever, Amen]]")''


*She lived at  Bryn Mawr Court.<ref>[[Dream a Little Dream of Me]], x (S)</ref>
*She knows American Sign Language.<ref>[[Dream a Little Dream of Me]], x (S)</ref>

'''JJ Lau''' is a woman who had a brief romantic liaison with [[Dean Miller]].



JJ was trying to have sex with her sometimes-boyfriend Seth when the smoke detector kept beeping. Annoyed by the sound and their inability to have sex, Seth took a baseball bat and hit the smoke detector. JJ took the smoke detector to the fire station to have it repaired and then took it home.

Later, the firefighters were called to her apartment because her neighbor heard her screams. They found her on the floor, where she had fallen and hit her head. Her smoke detector was still beeping. Dean asked her if she had an attic, but she said it was more like a crawl space. He broke through the ceiling, which released smoke. He quickly picked up JJ and carried her out. ''("[[Invisible to Me]]")''

Outside the building, JJ protested that she didn't want to leave because she was losing all her worldly possessions. Despite this, Dean told her to stay outside. She watched as her neighbors were evacuated. When Dean brought out Seth, she worried over him because she had thought he was at work. She went with him to the hospital so he could be treated. She later showed up at the fire station and told Dean that Seth had died and she didn't know where else to go. ''("[[Contain the Flame]]")''

Dean later came to JJ's apartment and told her the incident report from her place had been accidentally destroyed, so he had to go over things again. She realized he had made it up as an excuse to see her and ask her out on a date. She headed him off and asked him out instead.

He went back to her home that evening after a long day of work and started ranting to her about the day. When he saw her staring, he went to leave, but she interrupted him with a kiss and then he carried her back into her apartment. ''("[[Shock to the System (S)|Shock to the System]]")''


She and Dean went to a concert that kept them out until  AM. When they finally came home, they had sex before Dean had to leave for work.\ua''("[[Hot Box]]")''


After a final hookup with Dean, JJ decided she was done with empty sex and went on a spiritual journey, looking into herself and practicing celibacy. During that time, she learned she was pregnant while on tour with Beck. Months later, she finally showed up at Dean's place to tell him she was pregnant. She apologized for not telling him sooner, but said she felt she couldn't until she felt the fetus move and realized they would be a person who had a right to know their dad. When Dean came home from work, he discovered that JJ was there. He brought her ice cream and she invited him to feel the baby moving, which delighted him. ''("[[House Where Nobody Lives]]")''

She continued to stay with Dean, though she declined the offer to spend the day with him so he could avoid his work camping trip, saying she had a prenatal spa day planned. At the end of the day, she was surprised when he came home early. He told her he wanted to get married, but she made it clear that that wasn't something she wanted. He backed off and the two of them sat together and ate cheetos. ''("[[Into the Woods]]")''


During the blizzard, JJ was trapped along with several members of the community, at station . While she was there, she went into labor. She was upset because the blizzard made it impossible to get to the hospital for the epidural she wanted. With help from [[Carina DeLuca]] over FaceTime, Maya helped her cope with the pain, even passing on Carina's suggestion that she masturbate to relieve the pain and progress her labor. JJ then gave birth in the station bathroom. ''("[[Ice Ice Baby]]")''

JJ refused to the name the baby immediately, saying that, like with bands, she wanted to wait until something cool happened and she just knew. Not long after that, she packed up her things and left, telling Dean she'd never intended to stay, but wanted him to have the choice to keep the baby or place her for adoption. She told Dean to give her a good name and a good life and tell her to look JJ up when she's a teenager. ''("[[Satellite of Love]]")''


Some time after leaving Seattle, JJ briefly stopped in Hong Kong on her way to an ashram in India and told her parents about Pru, prompting them to visit Seattle to meet Pru and Dean. ''("[[I Guess I'm Floating]]")''



[[Seth (Station )|Seth]]
She was seeing [[Seth (Station )|Seth]], whom she described as her sometimes-boyfriend. Despite this, she flirted with Dean while she was at the fire station. He later died of smoke inhalation.

[[Dean Miller]]
JJ and Dean flirted while she was with Seth. After Seth died, JJ came to the station and talked with Dean, explaining to him that she had nowhere else to go.

Later, Dean came to her apartment and said that the accident report was damaged, so he had to do it again. JJ quickly picked up on the fact that he was making up excuses to see her, so she asked him out on a date.

Dean came back and started ranting about his day, and was getting ready to leave after he saw JJ staring at him, but she kissed him and they went back to the apartment, with Dean carrying her. ''("[[Shock to the System (S)|Shock to the System]]")''

She continued seeing Dean and tried to get him to play hooky to spend the day with her. She brought his watch to the station when he forgot it and entered a private area of the station. ''("[[Every Second Counts]]")''

Dean later broke things off with her because their relationship was interfering with his job. ''("[[Under the Surface]]")''

They hooked up a few times after this breakup, which resulted in JJ's pregnancy. ''("[[House Where Nobody Lives]]")''


Her job involves reviewing music. ''("[[Hot Box]]")''


*She has an original Purple Rain album signed by Prince.<ref>[[Contain the Flame]], x (S)</ref>
*She's a deep sleeper.<ref>[[Contain the Flame]], x (S)</ref>
*Pre-pregnancy, she liked praline ice cream. During her pregnancy, she started enjoying strawberry more.<ref>[[House Where Nobody Lives]], x (S)</ref>
