'''Kate Lachman''' is the [[Attending#Department Head|head]] of [[Obstetrics and Gynecology|OB/GYN]] at [[Grey Sloan Memorial Hospital]].


Kate butted heads with Carina when Carina asked for access to her patient files for an investigation. Arizona stepped in and clarified that Carina meant a study, not an investigation, and used their past friendship to get Kate to agree to give them access. While they looked through the information, Carina noticed that the Grey Sloan c-section rate was higher than average and had started increasing three years prior and Kate did more than twice as many as the next nearest doctor. Arizona confronted Kate with the information, but Kate brushed it off, despite Arizona pointing out the correlation between Kate's c-sections and her going out of town for the weekend.



She has a daughter named Lindsay who went to the day care and is friends with [[Sofia Robbin Sloan Torres]].


She and Arizona are close friends due to their daughters being friends and working in the same hospital.


She is the [[Attending#Department Head|Head]] of [[Obstetrics and Gynecology|OB/GYN]] at [[Grey Sloan Memorial Hospital]].


*In [[Anybody Have a Map?]], Richard specifically has the Head of OB paged to his OR and a few OB/GYNs can be seen in the OR later, none of them being Kate. It's possible that Kate no longer held the position at the time or that she was simply tied up with another patient and sent other doctors of her department to answer his page.

'''Katherine Bishop''' is the mother of [[Maya Bishop]].



Katherine's husband, Lane, openly preferred their daughter to their son. When Lane started ignoring Maya after she got second place in a race, Katherine just sat by and watched, even after he took a dish of mashed potatoes away from Maya and threw it at the wall after openly insulting both their children. ''("[[Into the Woods]]")''


A few months after Maya made captain, Katherine came to visit her, saying she felt it was time to visit her daughter's workplace. She then revealed that she'd left Lane and apologized to Maya for not protecting her from the abuse. Maya said she loved her dad and didn't believe he was abusive. She told her mother she was just being dramatic. When the team was called out, Maya left, but Katherine stayed at the station. Hearing Ben and Sullivan fight made her nervous, so she kept busy by helping set up the tables for that night's spaghetti dinner. When Maya returned, she was upset with her mother for coming into her workplace and taking over. She re-iterated that her father was the reason she won a gold medal and said that Katherine needed therapy, but she didn't think she did. ''("[[The Ghosts That Haunt Me]]")''


During the COVID- Pandemic, Katherine moved back in with Lane. ''("[[Comfortably Numb]]")''


On the day of her wedding, Maya went to her parents' house, where she officially came out to them for the first time ever and told them she was marrying a woman she loved. She also told her mother that she deserved better than to be cowering in the hallway behind her husband. She said Carina offered to have Katherine come live with them, something Maya herself wanted, and said that if she decided she'd had enough, she knew where they lived and there would always be a bed there for her. When Lane tried to object, Maya silenced him. Katherine later attended the wedding without Lane. ''("[[Forever and Ever, Amen]]")''

At the wedding, Maya and her team found out that Maya had been fired as Captain. She, Carina, and Andy went to Fire Chief McCallister's office in an attempt to convince him to reverse his decision, yet to no avail. A disappointed Maya returned to the party and informed the guests of what had happened. She decided not to let it ruin the fun and turned the music back on to dance, with Katherine being one of the first guests to join in. ''("[[Phoenix from the Flame]]")''



She is married to [[Lane Bishop]]. After spending some time in therapy, Katherine began to understand how abusive he was to her and their children and decided to leave him. ''("[[The Ghosts That Haunt Me]]")'' However, when the pandemic hit, she moved back in and they got back together. ''("[[Comfortably Numb]]")''


She and her husband have two children, [[Maya Bishop|Maya]] and [[Mason Bishop|Mason]]. As adults, Maya is a fire captain and Olympic gold medalist while Mason is a homeless artist.


*She appears in the background with no lines in [[Phoenix from the Flame]].

'''Kathleen Noonan''' is a fire cadet who got advice and help from Andy.



Kathleen was walking out of station  when she was stopped by Vic and Andy, who questioned why she was there. She told them she was a cadet at the fire academy and was checking out each station to see where she might fit in once she was finished with her training. She didn't feel like she was good enough to get a spot at station . Andy offered to give her a proper tour of the station and some advice on how to get better. She and Vic had her squeeze rice to improve her grip strength and re-dressed an injury she'd patched up herself. At the end of the day, Andy also introduced her to Sullivan, saying she's station  material. ''("[[Crazy Train]]")''


When Kat's friend and the only other female in her academy class quit, Kat came back to the station to talk to Andy again. Andy told her about meeting Maya in training and relying on her. Andy worried Kat was thinking about quitting herself, so she asked Sullivan for permission to take her on a call with them. She was able to persuade him to let Kat observe. They were called to an apartment building where [[Penelope Hayes]] had gone missing while playing hide-and-seek with her brother. She was considered high-risk because she had asthma, which her brother said was triggered by her being scared. Kat joined Andy and Jack to search a portion of the building. However, when they met up with Ryan and Jenna, who were also searching, Kat suggested redistributing the teams so each team had one firefighter and one police officer, a technique she'd just learned in training. Kat and Andy continued the search with Jenna. They heard from another building resident that Penny liked to hang out in the basement, so they went there to search and found her trapped in a washer. They couldn't get it open, so they had to call for backup. The backup arrived, but also brought news of a gas leak in the building, which had forced an evacuation. Due to the danger, Andy sent Kat out along with everyone else but Sullivan, who helped her free Penny. Later, Andy apologized to Kat for putting her in danger like that and then being brusque with her when sending her out, but Kat said that going on the call was the best thing she did. ''("[[The Dark Night]]")''



Her friend, Laura, was in the same class she's in at the fire academy until she quit.


She was working at the skyscraper when the fire happened, in a cubicle writing code for dating apps. Watching the firefighters respond to the fire inspired her to quit her job and apply to the fire academy.

'''Kelly''' is a woman who was saved from choking.


Kelly was choking on something when Andy and Rigo arrived. Her husband directed them to the backyard, where [[Jeff (Station )|Jeff]] was doing the Heimlich on Kelly as she wheezed. Rigo instructed him to stop, because the Heimlich wouldn't work on her as she was still breathing some. They were all then distracted when Andy started screaming because she saw a raccoon. Kelly's airway then became completely blocked, so Rigo did the Heimlich, dislodging the object, and then they loaded her into the ambulance to get checked out at the hospital.



She is married to [[Tony]].

'''Kenneth''' was one of the passengers on the train with a bird flu outbreak.


Kenneth was on a subway train when the train stalled, injuring some of the passengers. When Maya and Jack arrived to help, Kenneth offered his assistance, citing his experience as a security guard. They said they'd keep him in mind. When they discovered two passengers who likely had avian flu after coming to Seattle from Bashran, Jack and Maya announced that to the passengers after calling the CDC. Because of this, none of the passengers were allowed to leave the train. In the midst of some chaos involved in treating the two passengers, an impatient passenger, [[Reese]], tried to leave despite the warnings. To stop him, Kenneth used his taser, which caused a cardiac event in Reese. Kenneth watched as they treated him using medication from another passenger. Once he was stabilized, the CDC arrived and all the passengers were evacuated and decontaminated.


He is a security guard.

'''Kevin''' is the husband of [[Marnie]].


While Kevin's wife, Marnie, was pregnant with their second child, she had a fetal ablation. When she finally went into labor, she was upset because her water had broken, but labor wasn't progressing. Since an epidural had nearly killed her two years prior during her first delivery, that wasn't an option. An allergy to pitocin eliminated that option, meaning she just had to labor slowly in the hospital.

After twenty hours of labor, trying many things to progress her labor, [[Carina DeLuca]] suggested clitoral stimulation with climax to induce the release of oxytocin. Arizona was reluctant to suggest that, but when Marnie and Kevin asked for any other option to avoid a c-section, she eventually suggested it. With a little help from Kevin, Marnie was quickly crowning.



He is married to [[Marnie]].


He and his wife have a two year old and are expecting their second child.

'''Kitty Dixon''' is the wife of [[Michael Dixon]] and mother of [[Emmett Dixon]].



Kitty's son, Emmett, and his boyfriend, Travis, came to her home when it was her husband's birthday to have dinner. Things were tense at the dinner because of Travis and her husband's mutual dislike. Despite this, Kitty tried to keep things light and happy, trying to distract them all when the conversation turned to more tense subjects. However, at dinner, things came to a head when Kitty revealed that Michael was planning to run for mayor and his first order of business if elected was to shut down Crisis One. This caused a fight between him and Travis. After the fight, Kitty and Emmett went outside to talk. When Travis came outside, Kitty left the two of them to talk and during this discussion, the two of them broke up. ''("[[Alone in the Dark]]")''


With the race for mayor under way, Kitty attended events with her husband. One of these events was for the Northeast Seattle Homeowner's Association. During this event, Kitty mostly walked around drinking. When a tornado siren rang out, Travis directed everyone to go inside. Once inside, he confirmed there was a tornado approaching and told everyone to get low and stay low. Kitty huddled with her husband and Travis as the tornado passed. Once the wind died down, Travis told everyone to stay down while he went outside to check on things. Travis discovered a woman trapped in a car nearby, [[Hallie]], and the crowd watched while he got Hallie out of the car and onto a table to stabilize her. ''("[[Twist and Shout]]")''


Kitty and her husband got into a fight, resulting in one of their neighbors calling Crisis One. Maya and Ben arrived to find Kitty there alone, as Dixon had left. Maya talked to Kitty, believing that Dixon had been abusing her, only to have Kitty brush off her concerns. Kitty talked about how awful her husband was, but denied any abuse on his part. When Dixon arrived home, the two of them fought and threw things, resulting in Dixon being injured. Despite this, they both said they were fine and Ben, Maya, and Clarke left. ''("[[Dancing With Our Hands Tied]]")''



[[Michael Dixon]]
She is married to [[Michael Dixon]]. She says she married him as an act of rebellion against her rich family. ''("[[Dancing With Our Hands Tied]]")''

Keith Vanderbilt
Before marrying Dixon, she was involved with Keith Vanderbilt. ''("[[Dancing With Our Hands Tied]]")''


She and Dixon have one son, Emmett.


*She had a neck lift.<ref>[[Alone in the Dark]], x (S)</ref>
*She liked [[Alicia]].<ref>[[Alone in the Dark]], x (S)</ref>
*She and her husband live at Garret and nd.<ref>[[Dancing With Our Hands Tied]], x (S)</ref>

'''Kyle Rexton''' is a veteran who was arrested after attacking a shop owner with a knife.



Kyle went into Major Surplus & Survival to buy back a knife he'd sold there only to find that the owner, [[Jimmy (Poor Wandering One)|Jimmy]] wanted him to pay twice as much. Angered, Kyle pulled a knife on Jimmy and cut him. Soon afterward, Station  arrived and Jack and Andy were sent in to treat the injuries. When they realized the situation was ongoing, Andy called in Sullivan, knowing he would have special insight as a veteran. Jack then tried to talk Kyle down, offering him the extra money he needed to buy back his knife. While was considering it, Jimmy tackled him, sparking the situation again. Kyle then grabbed a grenade, pulled the pin, and threatened to blow them all up. Once Sullivan arrived, he was able to calm Kyle down enough to allow Jack and Andy to take Jimmy out to be treated, though he was unaware that Andy stayed inside the store.

Kyle and Sullivan then shared stories about the war, surviving explosions and the loss of their units. Kyle was frustrated because he couldn't get help promptly through the VA and he couldn't remember what he had for breakfast. He'd lost all his friends. He pointed out to Sullivan a pair of boots his friend Sara sold to that store so she could afford to pay her rent, and then she went on to complete suicide. Sullivan shared a story of a man from his unit who did the same thing because he couldn't cope with the guilt of accidentally causing the deaths of two others in the unit. He was angry about that as he felt that guy wasted the life he had and let the enemy claim another. Kyle told Sullivan that he just wanted the pain to stop. Sullivan took the time he was distracted to wrap his hands around Kyle's, holding the grenade in place. Kyle then tried to get Sullivan to leave, but Sullivan refused to leave a man behind. He gets Kyle to think of [[Ashley]], his girlfriend, so calm him down. Andy then revealed herself to them and said he needed to tell Ashley the truth and give her the chance to be there for him. Sullivan was then able to lead Kyle out of the store, where he was arrested by SWAT as the grenade was neutralized. ''("[[Poor Wandering One]]")''


A week after his arrest, Kyle was taken to the hospital with chest pain. Teddy examined him in the ER and talked about his history, which included PTSD after an explosion which killed his unit. He said he'd taken SSRIs in the past, but had to stop because he couldn't afford them anymore. He also reported memory loss. Teddy witnessed him having what looked like a complex partial seizure. She paged neurosurgery and Amelia did an MRI, which showed gliosis in his frontal lobe, which was causing the seizures. He was taken into surgery that day to operate and relieve his symptoms. ''("[[Give a Little Bit]]")''



He is dating [[Ashley]]. He tried to end things with her when he started having the seizures, feeling she shouldn't have to deal with that, but she came to the hospital anyway when she got the call that he was there.


He had a friend named Sara who completed suicide after her time at war. He also told Sullivan none of his friends were talking to him anymore. ''("[[Poor Wandering One]]")''


He was in the United States Marine Corps. During his time, he served in Iraq and Afghanistan.


*He was  at the time of his surgery.

'''Lane Bishop''' is the father of [[Maya Bishop]].



When Lane's children, Maya and Mason, were teenagers, he showed a strong preference for Maya, who forewent everything else to be the best at running, unlike Mason, who continued to pursue his art. He went to all of Maya's races and kept her on a strict diet and training schedule to keep her in top condition. When she got second place in a race after stopping to check on a friend, he gave her the silent treatment and said she was a loser. He continued this treatment until she won her next race. ''("[[Into the Woods]]")''

Once, when Maya won her race, but didn't beat her own time, he forced her to walk  miles home. ''("[[The Ghosts That Haunt Me]]")''


After his wife left him, Lane visited Maya since Maya had ignored his calls. He found her at the station as she was just leaving for a call. She asked him to stick around and wait for her, but he saw her on the news and came to the scene, where he watched from he sidelines. When he perceived her not to be doing anything, he blamed her for playing captain while her family was falling apart. She pointed out that she was the captain. He got angry because he thought she was freezing him out after her mother had filled her head with drama. She told him to step back so she could return to work, which only angered him more. He yelled at her not to raise her voice at him, drawing attention to himself. Maya ordered him to leave, pointing out that interfering with emergency personnel is a crime. When she turned around, he grabbed her by her hair and pulled her back. The bomb squad and USAR captains both rushed to her assistance. As they restrained Lane and forced him back behind the barrier, Lane taunted Maya for having strong men fight her battles. She snapped back that unlike him, she didn't need to win her gold medals through other people. She assured her colleagues she was fine and got back to work. ''("[[Louder Than a Bomb]]")''


During the COVID- Pandemic, Katherine moved back in with Lane. ''("[[Comfortably Numb]]")''


On the day of her wedding, Maya went to her parents' house, where she officially came out to them for the first time ever and told them she was marrying a woman she loved. She also told her mother that she deserved better than to be cowering in the hallway behind her husband. She said Carina offered to have Katherine come live with them, something Maya herself wanted, and said that if she decided she'd had enough, she knew where they lived and there would always be a bed there for her. When Lane tried to object, Maya silenced him. ''("[[Forever and Ever, Amen]]")''



He is married to [[Katherine Bishop]].


He openly favored his daughter, Maya, over his son, Mason, which drove Maya to be hypercompetitive to keep his attention and Mason to drugs and homelessness.

'''Lenya Hughes''' is the mother of [[Victoria Hughes]].



Lenya was working at her restaurant with her husband when it was set on fire. Firefighters came to the scene soon afterward and [[Theo Ruiz]] escorted Lenya and Anthony out with help from their daughter, Vic. Theo carried a crock pot out with them, as Lenya refused to leave without it. Once they were out, they were given oxygen, but were focused on how much they would lose and when they'd be able to get back inside.

After the fire was out, Lenya and Anthony insisted on Vic taking them inside to start cleaning up and figuring out what they could save. She tried to tell them it wasn't safe, but they knew she could keep them safe. Once they were inside, Vic gave her helmet to her mother, but her mother put it down instead of putting it on as she started to pick up tables. While they cleaned, Vic confronted her parents about them not checking in on her amidst the protests and especially the death of Breonna Taylor.

Later, Vic found an office in the restaurant which had two bulletin boards full of pictures and articles about her. Her mother told her they brought as much of Vic as they could to the restaurant as she rarely came by anymore. Lenya also shared the experience of raising a Black daughter and how much that scared her. She told Vic she wasn't around much when Vic was growing up in service of trying to give her a better life. Lenya then started breaking dishes not broken in the fire. She said it was Greek tradition to start the grief process. Vic, Anthony, Theo, and Travis all joined in. Once the dishes were broken, they started to clean up. ''("[[Say Her Name]]")''


Several weeks later, when the restaurant was restore to its former glory, Vic set it up as the location for Maya and Carina's wedding, for which Lenya and Anthony were grateful. Lenya and Anthony attended the wedding. ''("[[Forever and Ever, Amen]]")''



She is married to [[Anthony Hughes]].


Her family disowned her when she married a Black man and refused even to meet her daughter. Lenya never told her daughter this, believing she had enough burden to bear without that one.


She and her husband own and run [[Kaminski's]], a Polish restaurant in Seattle.

'''Lila''' is Jack's sister, from whom he was separated following a fire that killed their parents.


In June , Lila was living in a house with her parents and two brothers, [[Cal]] and [[Jack Gibson]]. One day, for their parents' anniversary, the kids decided they wanted to make a cake, but they didn't know how to work the oven. Their dad, Marco, found them and lost his temper when he saw Lila with her head in the oven. After he calmed down, he apologized and said parents lose their tempers sometimes, but that didn't mean they'd send the kids away, as Jack suspected might happen. Marco then told them the oven was faulty and they'd buy a cake instead. Then he helped them clean up the kitchen.

Later that night, Jack woke up and saw a fire in the house. He woke up Lila and covered her with a blanket to get her out of the house. Once he got her outside, he ran back inside to find Cal and their parents. He found Cal and carried him outside. When he tried to go back in for their parents, Lila stopped him. Soon afterward, the windows of the house blew out. Shortly afterward, the kids were told that Marco and Samantha had died and each of them was taken by a different social worker.



She was adopted in  by [[Marco]] and Samantha. During the same time frame, they also had two other children living there and had plans to adopt at least [[Jack Gibson]] as well. However, they died in a fire before the adoption could go through and the three children were separated.


*She was legally adopted on January , .
*She had a recurring nightmare in which her teeth fell out.
*She is deaf and uses American Sign Language to communicate.

'''Lindy Dougal''' is a girl who was nearly kidnapped by her father.


Lindy's father, Gregory, was upset with the custody arrangement after he and [[Janet (Home To Hold Onto)|Janet]] got divorced. He impulsively decided to kidnap Lindy and disappear with her. As he fled with her, he was pulled over by Ryan, who was suspicious of Gregory because he saw the ring tan line and a quickly packed bag for Lindy. He went back to his squad car and radioed in his suspicions. When it was confirmed that there was an Amber alert out for Lindy, Ryan stalled while they waited for additional help to arrive. Sensing that Gregory was starting to get impatient, Ryan went over to his car and quietly explained that it wouldn't end well for him if he fled with Lindy and convinced him to turn himself in and let Lindy go back with her mother while he was arrested.



Her parents are recently divorced. Her father got arrested because he attempted to kidnap her and run away with her.

'''Lorelei''' is a Bengal tiger who was being kept illegally by [[Yvonne Boyd]].


When Lorelei was a cub, she was living in a roadside zoo. Yvonne decided to take her home with her, feeling she could give Lorelei a better life than she could have in the zoo. She raised Lorelei from that point on, keeping her in the house and setting up an enclosure in the backyard for her to play.

During the  Covid- pandemic, there was a meat shortage, forcing Yvonne to skip meals for Lorelei. One day, while she was preparing Lorelei's breakfast, a delivery driver came to the door with a package. It startled Lorelei, who was hungry, and she mauled Yvonne before leaving Yvonne's house. She wander around Seattle for a while, and mauled at least one other person, before ending up in the barn at Station . Jack was the first to notice her, but before he could stop her, Vic entered the barn and came face to face with the tiger. Dean saw what was happening and retrieved some meat from the fridge, which he used to lure Lorelei away from Vic so Vic could get to safety. Then they secured the entrance to the barn and called Animal Control, who came to take Lorelei to the zoo.


*She weighs  pounds.

'''Lucas Ripley''' was the Fire Chief for [[Seattle Fire Department]].



In , Lucas was working with then-friend Robert Sullivan when they responded to a call about a car accident. When they arrived, Robert recognized one of the cars as belonging to his wife, so he immediately rushed to help her. He tried to break protocol to help her, but Lucas told him he was too close to the situation and needed to back off. Claire died, which strained their friendship. ''("[[Do a Little Harm...]]")''


By , Ripley had become the Fire Chief of the Seattle Fire Department. When Station 's Captain Kennedy was promoted to Battalion Chief, Ripley appointed the station's relatively new Lieutenant [[Theo Ruiz]] as Captain. Not too long after his promotion, Theo made a fatal error on a call that led to the death of his long-time friend [[Michael Cooper Williams|Michael Williams]], husband to fellow firefighter [[Travis Montgomery]]. Crushed by guilt, Ruiz asked for a demotion after the tragic event. While Ripley initially tried to fight him on it, he agreed and Ruiz was demoted back to Lieutenant. ''("[[No One is Alone]]")''


When the captain candidates came out for their practical tests after taking their written exams, Ripley unexpectedly came out to observe. He watched as each team of four took turns acting as captain. When Jack decided to leave without the dummy after two sweeps turned up nothing, Ripley complimented him on being the first person in fire years to master that variation. After Andy had her turn and had to call for mayday when [[Cole Edmonds]] was hit by falling debris, he witnessed [[Battalion Chief Frankel]] berating her over her decision to stay in and find the dummy instead of coming out. He told her he'd speak to her about it later, as she was meant to judge the candidates impartially. He then told Andy that part of being captain is making tough decisions, like between the ethical choice to continue rescuing the dummy or the safer choice of coming out. ''("[[Stronger Together]]")''


Ripley came out to the strip mall fire. He was surprised to see Jack in charge instead of Andy, but Jack told him Andy had to take a personal day. ''("[[Let It Burn]]")''


Believing that Frankel had shown bias in the issue, Ripley decided to interview the crew of Station  himself, getting their input on who should be captain. After interviewing all of them, he went to the hospital to interview Pruitt, who said he wouldn't recommend either Jack or Andy to be Captain. ''("[[Every Second Counts]]")''


While doing the final interviews of the Captain candidates, he was paged away to a skyscraper fire in downtown Seattle. He said the interviews were postponed until further notice. When Station  arrived at the fire, he gave them directions. When he learned that there were combustibles on a floor above the fire, he sent Ben and Travis to vent the stairway so civilians on the top floor could get out. While that was happening, the fire jumped floors between the panes of glass in the window. Ripley was helping evacuate the base camp they had set up, when Jack radioed down and said there was a trapped civilian and they needed elevator rescue. Ripley said that wasn't possible because they couldn't jump the fire in the elevator or risk spreading the fire through the elevator shaft. Despite this order, Andy took the elevator key and sent it up to them. Ripley told her making tough calls like this was part of the job she wanted. He took the key back from her and went out down the stairs. ''("[[Not Your Hero]]")''

Andy asked Ripley over the radio for help to rescue Jack, but he refused and ordered Andy to leave the building herself because it wasn't safe to be there. Despite this order, Andy stayed in the building to save Jack. Dean soon came out of the building and also requested help to go rescue Jack, which was also refused. Ripley told him to help the people already outside. Against this order, Dean re-entered the building. When Vic exited the building with Travis, he asked how they were all doing. Vic didn't believe he cared, but he insisted that he cares more than she could know. He also said that if she came at him like that again, she'd be fired. ''("[[No Recovery]]")''


Six weeks after the skyscraper fire, Ripley introduced them to [[Robert Sullivan]], their new captain, who immediately established himself as a strict, by the book boss. He said he wanted to improve station 's efficiency and wanted to start immediately. ''("[[No Recovery]]")''


Ripley attended a peer group for firefighters, where he talked about being haunted by the skyscraper fire and the choices he had to make that day. After the group was over, Vic approached him and apologized for the way she spoke to him during the skyscraper fire. He said she should share her own experience because it might help others. ''("[[Lost and Found]]")''


Ripley came to a training held by the firefighters of Station  for the police department, training them in CPR and first aid. When Ripley noticed Sullivan being particularly hard on Maya and singling her out, he sent Sullivan home, knowing that it was the anniversary of his wife's death. ''("[[Do a Little Harm...]]")''


Ripley attended Dean's surprise birthday party, where he flirted with Vic over cutting the cake. After the party, they went home together. ''("[[Do a Little Harm...]]")''


During the windstorm, the team was called in because B shift was stranded. At the station, they were surprised to see Ripley there, checking on the stations. They went over storm protocols and gathered extra supplies to be ready. Andy and Sullivan were soon after called out for a car accident, then Greg, Ryan, Pruitt, and Grant surprised the team by bringing Friendsgiving to the station. Meal prep continued, but another call came in and Ben, Dean, Travis, Maya, Vic, and Ripley headed out to cover it, leaving Jack alone at the station. On their way to the call, a tree branch went through the windshield of one of the engines and a fallen tree blocked the road for the other. Ripley and Vic stayed behind to cut up the tree while Maya led the rest of the team to the emergency on foot. After breaking up the whole tree, they finished the drive to the house, where a fire had started during a rescue. The fire was then extinguished. Ripley then announced that Seattle Fire Department wasn't taking calls anymore and everyone should seek shelter immediately, so the team returned to the station and sat down to eat. At the table, Ripley announced that Maya would be a lieutenant soon and he already put her in for a transfer to station . ''("[[Weather the Storm]]")''

Ripley got a call that Andy and Sullivan hadn't been heard from in over an hour and hadn't arrived at their last known destination. He was called back to headquarters, so he left Pruitt to act as Captain during the rescue mission. ''("[[Crash and Burn]]")''


Maya was set to transfer to station , but Sullivan came to him and said he wanted all three lieutenants because he felt they each played an important role at the station. ''("[[I Fought the Law]]")''


One day, an RV crashed into the side of station . A young girl came out of the driver's seat and said her mother was shaking and wouldn't stop. To prevent further damage to the building, Travis disconnected the fuel in the vehicle. Then they worked to expand the exit to get Ellie's mother out. Once she was freed, Lucas helped Travis and later USAR stabilize the building so it wouldn't collapse. This was complicated when a broken cellphone sparked and explosion fueled by the extra propane tank under the sink in the RV. ''("[[Baby Boom]]")''


While Ripley was visiting with Sullivan and trying to rekindle their friendship, Station  got a call out for a car accident. Ripley checked the page and recognized the number that called  as Vic's. Because of this, he joined them on their call. After helping the team rescue [[Josh (Station )|Josh]] and [[Emmanuelle]], he took Vic home and tucked her into bed. She was worried because of their fight about her having told Travis and told him that if that small fight was enough to end them, he should take his good-smelling shirt and leave. He said he didn't want to leave and instead climbed into bed with her, even though she was sick. ''("[[When It Rains, It Pours!]]")''


During a power outage, the generator at station  had a worrying result, so Ripley supervised while Pruitt fixed it and then wrote him a recommendation for the job he was applying for. Ripley noted that Pruitt was way overqualified for the job, but Pruitt said he thought it would be nice to be a big fish in a small pond for a while and get some praise. ''("[[The Dark Night]]")''


Ripley jumped in to help when a fire at a coffee processing plant got out of control. He oversaw operations outside, but when all other firefighters were trapped leaving the captain of  alone inside, Ripley superseded his order for no one else to come in and went in after him. After getting knocked over by exploding coffee beans, he was able to get [[Ted Conlin|Conlin]] out. Vic, after watching and waiting for him, said she wanted to spend forever with him and proposed that they get married for real, not just as a way to get around the rules as he'd suggested. She told him not to answer right away and they agreed to meet for breakfast the next day in order to talk about them. The next morning, he went to a flower shop to get her flowers and accept her proposal. However, as he left the shop, he collapsed on the sidewalk. ''("[[Friendly Fire]]")'' Ripley was found by [[Levi Schmitt]], whom he'd met in the flower shop, and taken to [[Grey Sloan Memorial Hospital]], where Bailey recognized him as he was being treated in the ER. Maggie ran several tests, trying to get to the bottom of why he passed out in the street. Eager to see Vic and accept her proposal, he made multiple attempts to get discharged so he could leave. When Maggie left him alone in his room, even after making him promise not to leave, he left the hospital in search of Vic, which was discovered when Maggie got his test results that showed his condition was much worse than previously believed. ''("[[What I Did for Love]]")''

The tests showed he'd been exposed to some kind of toxin, which could kill him. He was out searching for Vic, but agreed to go to a hospital if they promised to find Vic and bring her to him. Once he was at the hospital, it was confirmed that he'd been exposed to hydrofluoric acid at the coffee plant fire, which was affecting his calcium levels. They started treatment, but Maggie told them it wasn't working and now was the time to say goodbye. His sister and Sullivan talked with him for a while and then Vic went in and sat with him until he died. ''("[[Always Ready]]")''


When Sullivan overdosed on fentanyl, he saw Ripley, who told him that he had a problem and needed to repair his life from top to bottom. ''("[[Satellite of Love]]")''



Exes
He'd been married twice. First, to an unknown person when they were very young, then to Eva, who disliked his job and made him sleep on the couch regularly only six months into their marriage. ''("[[Do a Little Harm...]]")''

[[Victoria Hughes|Victoria "Vic" Hughes]]
Lucas first met Vic during the Captain peer reviews. Vic yelled at him and blamed him for the outcome of the call, saying he wasn't doing his job and making sure all stations were on par with Station  with response times. ''("[[Every Second Counts]]")''

After the skyscraper, the two had another confrontation in which Vic blamed him for not caring about her team and evacuating the entire building with her whole team still inside. Even though Lucas told Vic that if she came at him like that again, he'd fire her, he was clearly bothered by what she'd said. ''("[[No Recovery]]")''

The two reconciled when Vic attended a peer group for firefighters, she was surprised to see Ripley there, sharing how the skyscraper fire affected him. After the group, she apologized to him for how she'd acted that day and its impact on his feelings about the day. ''("[[Lost and Found]]")''\uaDuring the police training session at Station , which Chief Ripley was overseeing, they flirted. After Dean's birthday party, Vic asked him out for a drink and then two of them slept together. The next morning, she snuck out of her own apartment, worried about what it meant, but Lucas called her later that day and they presumably agreed to keep seeing each other. ''("[[Last Day on Earth]]")'' 

Ripley visited Station  during the storm, and even though he was worried it looked like he was there for her, Vic told him they could be professional while at work. After working together on a call breaking up a tree, Vic and Ripley agreed that what they'd done was hot and hooked up at the station. ''("[[Weather the Storm]]")''
After Ripley announced Maya's promotion to lieutenant and transfer to Station , Maya asked Vic details (since Vic was seeing Mayhorn from ) in front Ripley, who was clearly curious, but Vic quickly shut it down. Later, Lucas tried to find out more from Vic, but they were interrupted by Pruitt. ''("[[Crash and Burn]]")''

Four months after the windstorm, they were still seeing each other. They went to Astro Corner Coffee Shop so they could eat together in public and Lucas asked if they could do more of that because he liked being in public with her.\uaThey then started to have sex in the parking lot, but the manager caught them and asked them not to. ''("[[Crash and Burn]]")''

Vic learned that Ripley had told his sister about them and he was surprised she hadn't told anyone. She decided to tell Travis and told Ripley that she'd told her best friend. Not realizing that meant Travis, Ripley said he knew that she had the sense to tell someone away from the station. ''("[[I Fought the Law]]")''

When Lucas learned that Vic had told Travis, he was upset and believed she wasn't considering the consequences of other firefighters knowing. The two had an argument in Vic's bunkroom and Vic asked Lucas if their conversation (meaning their relationship) should be over. Lucas left before he could say anything he didn't mean.\ua''("[[Baby Boom]]")''

After their fight, Vic was uncertain what their future held. Because she was sick, Sullivan sent her home while Lucas brought burgers to ask Sullivan for advice about Vic. Even though he tried not telling Sully who he was seeing, Sullivan guessed quickly. When the station received a partial  call, Lucas quickly realized it was Vic and joined the team to rescue her. After she treated a couple that had been in a car accident during a storm and delivering their baby, Lucas was checking up on her in the Aid Car, but Vic told him she didn't need him and that she was awesome to which he responded that he knew.\uaLater, Lucas was taking care of Vic at her apartment and Vic confronted him that they hadn't finished their fight and told him he was wrong because if an argument was all it took to break them up, they shouldn't even be together, so if they couldn't fight and make up, he could take his nice-smelling shirt and go. Lucas responded that he didn't want his shirt back and that no matter what, he didn't want to go, "I don't want to let you go." He then got into bed with Vic despite the fact that she was sick. ''("[[When It Rains, It Pours!]]")''

Sometime after this, Lucas christened Vic with her nickname, "Eggy" because of the dish she ordered for breakfast at the Astro Corner Coffee Shop. The manager of the diner apologized about scolding them when they were about to have sex in the parking lot and said they were relationship goals. He also assumed that Vic and Lucas were married, calling Lucas Vic's hubby. Lucas then told Vic about his previous wives and that if he would get married a third time, he would take it very seriously and he wouldn't be game unless he knew it was really right.\ua''("[[Always Ready]]")'' Around this time, Vic met Jennifer, Lucas' sister, and the two hit it off even when Vic told her about how the two of them jumping out of planes during the weekends\ub\ub\ub\ub\ub\ub\ub.''("[[Always Ready]]")''

With their first fight out of the way, things settled quite nicely for them. While he was at the station to talk to Sullivan, they took advantage of a brief power loss to make out a little. When discussion Pruitt's recent trip to Hawaii, they discussed going on a trip themselves, but because of the secrecy, they decided that they could only go on trips in their heads. At the end of a difficult day, Vic said she wanted to go on a real vacation with him, but she still acknowledged that they couldn't without telling everyone they were dating, so she dismissed the thought as a mere fantasy. ''("[[The Dark Night]]")''

In order to be able to stay together without worrying about their different ranks, Ripley suggested they get married, but they dismissed the idea as too crazy. However, after seeing him make a difficult call and go in after the captain of station , she proposed to him for real, saying she wanted to spend the rest of her life with him. He tried to respond, but she told him not to reply right away. They agreed to meet for breakfast the next morning and talk about them. However, the next morning, Ripley didn't show up, which Vic took as a rejection. She didn't know that Ripley had collapsed right after getting her flowers and had to be taken to the hospital. ''("[[Friendly Fire]]")''

When Lucas woke up a the hospital, he asked for Vic, but the other firefighters told him they couldn't reach her. While waiting for test results, Lucas checked himself out of Grey Sloan to go look for Vic. When Sullivan called, he said he'd go back to the hospital after he found Vic and explained what had happened. Sullivan then told him he had to go to the hospital urgently because he had inhaled chemicals at the fire, and he agreed to go to a hospital if they would go get Vic and bring her to him. They did so, but by then, his condition\uahad worsened and Jennifer, his sister, believed Vic was at fault for what had happened to her brother and pulled the family card, keeping Vic from knowing anything about Lucas' condition. However, when she learned what really happened and that Vic had proposed marriage, she let Vic in, but by then it was time to say goodbye. Vic struggled with not wanting to go into the room, but ultimately, Travis helped her get there. Lucas accepted her proposal\uaThe couple reunited, albeit briefly. Vic said they could finally take that vacation and described their dream vacation. Lucas then accepted Vic's proposal and asked if they could get someone in the room to get married, but Vic just wanted to have the moment with him, just them. A crying Vic told him she was really ready to spend the rest of her life with him and Lucas said that at least he got to spend the rest of his with her.\uaThey shared a kiss and Vic held his hand until he died.\ua\ub\ub\ub\ub\ub\ub\ub''("[[Always Ready]]")''

After he died, Vic was lying on top of the firetruck crying over Lucas as\uashe remembered when they said "I love you" for the first time while her team surrounded her.''("[[Always Ready]]")''


[[Jennifer Ripley]]
He is very close with his sister Jennifer. Their parents died when he was in college and she was still a kid, which brought them even closer. She worried about his job and even more when he took up dangerous hobbies. ''("[[Always Ready]]")''


He and [[Robert Sullivan]] were good friends when they worked at station . Their friendship was strained when Robert's wife died on a call while Ripley was working on her. ''("[[Do a Little Harm...]]")''


He was the Fire Chief for the [[Seattle Fire Department]]. Before deciding on a new Captain, Ripley also acted as interim Captain for Station  for six weeks. He had been with the Seattle Fire Department for over fifteen years when he died. ''("[[Lost and Found]]")''


*He was pronounced dead at :.<ref>[[Always Ready]], x (S)</ref>
*He liked beer.<ref>[[Friendly Fire]], x (S)</ref>
*He was left handed.<ref>[[Every Second Counts]], x (S)</ref>

'''Lucia DeLuca''' was the mother of [[Carina DeLuca|Carina]] and [[Andrew DeLuca]].



At her wedding, her sister or sister-in-law, Stella, had a heart attack. Later, at a cousin's wedding, she stabbed her husband in his hand. ''("[[Forever and Ever, Amen]]")''


One year, while her husband was manic, he spent all their Christmas money. Lucia saved up and bought one present to surprise her children with, a pair of roller skates. Andrew tried to give them to Carina, but she put on one and had him put on the other and they each held up their other leg and skated around the house together. ''("[[Helplessly Hoping]]")''


When her children were still young, Lucia and her husband, Vincenzo, decided to divorce. Lucia wanted to move to the United States for a fresh start. Vincenzo declared that he would rather their family be split up, so Carina told her mother to take Andrew to the US with her and leave Carina in Italy with her father. ''("[[Helplessly Hoping]]")'' She then took Andrew to Wisconsin, where he grew up. Carina was sixteen when her mother left to go to the United States. ''("[[Comfortably Numb]]")''


Lucia died unexpectedly of a stroke while in Italy. Her daughter lied to her son, saying their mom was merely sick, and waited until he was in Italy to tell him in person that she was dead. ''("[[Momma Knows Best]]")''


When Andrew had been stabbed and was having surgery, he imagined himself on a beach with Meredith, who was in a coma due to COVID-. After some time on the beach, he heard his mother calling out to him. He told Meredith he needed to go with her and they walked off together. ''("[[Helplessly Hoping]]")''



She was married to [[Vincenzo DeLuca]].


She and Vincenzo had two children: Carina and Andrew. She called them two parts of a whole.


*She is the only character who was seen on Meredith's beach who did not make any previous appearance on the show.
*According to [[Maggie Pierce]] in [[Undo]], DeLuca's mother was "probably at work" during his assault and that she knows her. This is a major storyline inconsistency. Showrunner [[Krista Vernoff]] eventually addressed the discrepancy in a tweet saying they had simply forgotten and suggested it be amended as Maggie knowing his stepmother.<ref>https://twitter.com/KristaVernoff/status/?s=</ref>

'''Luis''' is [[Alysha]] and [[Ms. Debbie|Ms. Debbie's]] landlord.


Luis called for a welfare check on two of his tenants who hadn't left their apartment in three days. When Crisis One arrived, Luis led them up to the apartment and, when they received no answer, let them into the apartment.


He is a landlord for the Chatham Building where [[Ms. Debbie]] and [[Alysha]] live.

'''Luisa Berrol''' is Andy's lawyer.


Luisa represented Andy at her bail hearing shortly after she was arrested. Judge [[H. Pendleton]] accepted Andy's not guilty plea, told her her trial was set for May , and set bail at $,. ''("[[Death and the Maiden]]")''

While Andy awaited her trial, Luisa called her and told her the firefighters' union would allow her friends to testify on her behalf, which was good news for her. She told Andy it showed that the union supported her instead of staying on the sidelines like the department had. ''("[[The Road You Didn't Take]]")''

After talking to Jack about his childhood, Andy realized that Jeremy must have attacked other woman before her, so she began searching for any women who could come out and testify to support Andy's version of events. When she found a comment on one of the articles about her from a woman whom Jeremy had raped in college, she and Luisa went to the prosecuting attorney, [[James Pope]], but he said he needed more proof than that. Undeterred, Andy tracked down the woman, [[Holly (Crawl Out Through the Fallout)|Holly]], and she and Luisa went to the coffee shop where Holly was working to ask her to talk about her experience. Holly initially refused, but after talking to Andy, she came to the prosecutor's office. After she shared her experience, Pope dropped the charges against Andy. ''("[[Crawl Out Through the Fallout]]")''


She is a criminal defense lawyer.


*She likes oat milk lattes.<ref>[[Crawl Out Through the Fallout]], x (S)</ref>

'''Lynn''' is a woman who came to the station to have three car seats installed.


Lynn was at home, but tired of the power going out, so she went for a drive around town. She ended up going to the store and buying the three car seats she needed for the triplets she was expecting. Then she drove to the fire station, where Jack installed them for her. When she started to feel a little faint, she was given water and lay down on the couch at the station. She took a nap, but Pruitt woke her up when her phone rang, not wanting anyone to worry about her. It was her husband calling. Unbeknownst to her, he'd been in a car accident and then electrocuted and was calling her to tell her he loved her one last time before dying.



She was married to [[Marshall]] until his death.


She was expecting triplets when her husband died.


*She's good with coupons and used them to get the third car seat free.

She's part of [[Elizabeth Archer|Elizabeth Archer's]] healing team.

'''Mai''' is one of twelve Thai women who were held hostage by [[Mr. Phillips]].


Mai came to the United States in search of something better for herself, but ended up working for [[Mr. Phillips]], who held her and eleven other women in a building he owned, working in a sweatshop. He took their passports and kept them from leaving the building, telling them that if the police found them, it would be worse for them than staying inside. When the building caught on fire, they were all trapped in a locked room. They covered their faces and huddled together behind a barrier they made to protect themselves. When [[Pablo]], the security guard from the building, told firefighters about the secret room where they were trapped, they were rescued and led outside to triage. At triage, the women were reluctant to talk to the firefighters until they were reassured that they were not in trouble. Travis noticed a scar on Mai's hand and asked about it. She said she'd gotten cut on a sewing machine three years prior, but they had just stitched up on site rather than taking her to a doctor. Mai then told the firefighters what Mr. Phillips had done. Mai and the other women were then taken to [[Seattle Presbyterian Hospital]] to be checked out and [[Natasha Ross|Fire Chief Natasha Ross]] promised to have an immigration lawyer meet them there to see what they could do to get the women S-Visas and financial compensation for what had happened to them.


She worked in a textiles sweatshop.


*She speaks English and Thai.

'''Marco''' is Jack's foster father who died in a house fire.


In June , Marco was living in a house with his wife and their three children, [[Lila (House Where Nobody Lives)|Lila]], [[Cal]], and [[Jack Gibson]]. One day, for Marco and his wife's anniversary, the kids decided they wanted to make a cake, but they didn't know how to work the oven. Marco found them and lost his temper when he saw Lila with her head in the oven. After he calmed down, he apologized and said parents lose their tempers sometimes, but that didn't mean they'd send the kids away, as Jack suspected might happen. Marco then told them the oven was faulty and they'd buy a cake instead. Then he helped them clean up the kitchen.

Later that night, Jack woke up and saw a fire in the house. He woke up Lila and covered her with a blanket to get her out of the house. Once he got her outside, he ran back inside to find Cal and their parents. He found Cal and carried him outside. When he tried to go back in for their parents, Lila stopped him. Soon afterward, the windows of the house blew out. Shortly afterward, the kids were told that Marco and Samantha had died and each of them was taken by a different social worker.



He was married to Samantha until his death.


He and his wife had one adopted child, Lila, and two foster children, Jack and Cal. They also had plans to adopt Jack. When they died, the three children were split up.


He was a high school science teacher.


*He believed overpopulation was the greatest threat to the planet, which is why he and his wife decided to foster and adopt instead of having biological children.

|name = Marcus

|other family = [[Ted]] ''(ex-stepfather)''

|last appearance = [[Comfortably Numb]]
|count = 
|seasons = '''[[Station |S]]:''' [[Season  (Station )|]] and [[Season  (Station )|]]
|portrayed by = [[Ansel Sluyter-Obidos]]
}}
'''Marcus''' is the son of [[Inara]], whom he helped save from her abusive husband by repeatedly turning on the burners to cause gas leaks.



Marcus and his mother, Inara, were living with her new husband, Ted. Marcus witnessed Ted hitting his mother and turned the burners on to fill the house with gas. Then his mother called  to report a gas leak. The firefighters responded to the calls, which happened three times in a single week. During the third call, they became suspicious that something more serious was going on, especially after Jack saw Inara signing to Marcus that daddy had calmed down. Jack separated Marcus and Inara from Ted and used sign language to learn the truth about what was happening, including that Inara didn't have anywhere else to take Marcus. She also said she'd called the police the first time it happened, but Ted convinced them she was overreacting and he'd locked her in a closet for eleven hours that night. Once he knew the truth, Jack helped Dean stall Ted while Inara went inside and packed a bag. Then they lied to Ted and said it was safe for him to stay in the house but not for Marcus and Inara to stay with him. While he was disputing this, they noticed flames in a room in the house. The fire was quickly extinguished and Ted believed that Marcus started it. When the firefighters witnessed him grabbing Marcus and yelling at him, they pulled him away. Jack then took Inara and Marcus to [[Marsha Smith|Marsha's]] house where she welcomed them to stay with her. Knowing that Inara had started the fire when she was inside packing her bag, Jack told her to flush the matches she had, throw away the clothes she was wearing, and scrub herself in the shower. She thanked him for his help. ''("[[Dream a Little Dream of Me]]")''

He and his mother continued to live with Marsha. ''("[[Louder Than a Bomb]]")''


During Covid-, Marcus, Inara, and Marsha isolated at Marsha's place together. Marcus didn't like when they wore the masks because he couldn't read their lips. He also wanted to show Jack his new train set, but Jack couldn't come inside to see it. ''("[[Nothing Seems the Same]]")''

When a loose tiger became trapped in the barn at the station, Jack FaceTimed Inara and Marcus so they could see the tiger. ''("[[Wild World]]")''

Jack came over one day before work so Marcus could show Jack his new train from a distance. ''("[[We Are Family]]")''

One day, while Inara was at work, Marsha collapsed, so Marcus texted Jack, who brought the aid car to pick her up. She was struggling to breath, so they took both her and Marcus to Grey Sloan. She was immediately tested and taken to the COVID unit. Jack and Marcus were also tested immediately and Inara was tested later. Marsha's test came back positive, but the other three tested negative. Jack was upset because Marsha had continuously refused to wear her mask. When Inara got home from work, she was worried that Marsha would die and they'd have to find another place to live. Jack offered to stay in the apartment with them until Marsha was able to come home, to keep them safe from Ted. He ended up sleeping on the couch, while Marcus slept on the floor next to him. ''("[[Don't Look Back in Anger]]")''

Jack came over after his shift one day to help Marcus with his online homework. Jack offered him money for every prime number he could name and Marcus quickly cleared him out. He then ate several grilled cheese sandwiches trying to keep with Jack, then went to take a nap. ''("[[Out of Control]]")''

After some time in the hospital, Marsha started feeling better. She video called Inara, Jack, and Marcus asking for gossip and Inara and Jack were surprised to learn that Marcus already knew the two of them had hooked up and both he and Marsha were happy about it. Later, when Jack came home and asked Inara officially to be his girlfriend, Marcus and Marsha both celebrated. ''("[[Learning to Fly]]")''

Marsha's condition continued to improve until she was finally told she'd be able to go home the next day. Jack took the day off and he, Marcus, and Inara planned to come to the hospital to pick her up. However, as they were getting ready to leave, Jack got a call from Emmett telling them not to come as Marsha had taken a turn and they expected her to need to go on a ventilator later that day. Jack hadn't gotten a call as her son was her emergency contact. They were all heartbroken that they wouldn't be able to bring her home, so Maya brought the ladder truck to the hospital and Jack climbed up with Marcus and they held a sign outside Marsha's hospital window telling her to get better soon so Marcus could beat her at Parcheesi. ''("[[Make No Mistake, He's Mine]]")''

Inara called Jack when Marcus panicked after seeing a fire truck drive by. He was worried that something would happen to Jack while he was at work. At the advice of Theo Ruiz, whose own father was a firefighter who died in the line of duty, Jack took Marcus on a tour of the station over the phone and explained to him that most of the job wasn't very dangerous at all. This helped reassure Marcus that Jack wasn't going anywhere. ''("[[No One is Alone]]")''

With Marsha on a ventilator, her son eventually stepped in and used his power of attorney to have them remove it. Marcus was very angry about Marsha dying, so Jack took him to the station gym and had him punch a punching bag as a healthy way of dealing with the anger. He then hugged Jack and cried. When the time came to remove the ventilator, Jack, Inara, and Marcus did a video call with the hospital. Her son was also on the call, but left as soon as the process was initiated. Levi explained to them that there would probably be shallowing of her breathing and it could take minutes or hours. They stayed on the call and talked to her as she breathed. Hours later, while Jack was sharing a memory of Marsha getting a pet bird to talk to, they were surprised to hear Marsha laughing. She had woken up and was breathing well enough on her own. All the firefighters celebrated along with Inara, Jack, and Marcus. ''("[[Save Yourself]]")''

As her recovery continued, Marsha offered to take Marcus to the park to work on an egg-drop project for school, allowing Jack and Inara their first real time alone together as a couple. ''("[[Comfortably Numb]]")''



He lived with his mother and stepfather until Jack helped them leave after learning Ted was abusive. Now he lives with his mom and [[Marsha Smith|Marsha]], whom he considers his family.


*He is deaf and communicates with sign language.<ref>[[Dream a Little Dream of Me]], x (S)</ref>
*He lived at  Bryn Mawr Court.<ref>[[Dream a Little Dream of Me]], x (S)</ref>
*He has many prime numbers memorized.<ref>[[Out of Control]], x (S)</ref>

'''Margaret Chen''' is a woman who pretended to have amnesia to get taken to the hospital.


Margaret's son, Jason, had seizures starting when he was born. In order to get him all his medicines, she stole money from her company because her insurance wouldn't cover it. She was planning to pay it back, but she got caught before she could. She was arrested, but her son got his medical care. On the day she was supposed to be sentenced, she instead fled and hit herself on her head so she could feign amnesia. When a park ranger found her, firefighters were called to the scene. They checked her out and then took her to [[Grey Sloan Memorial Hospital]]. As her son was at [[Seattle Presbyterian Hospital]], she fled Grey Sloan and went to Seattle Pres instead. Andy, Dean, and Maya recognized her and got her to sit with them. After they learned she was a fugitive, Andy demanded the full story. Margaret explained about her son and said his surgery was that day and he was worried he'd die and not get to see her again. She asked them if she could have a few minutes to see him before his surgery and then she'd go with the police. They talked to Ryan and convinced him to take her into the hospital, where she said goodbye to her son. Once he was taken to surgery, she held out her arms so he could arrest her.



She has a sister who is taking care of her son.

'''Marion Hughes''' is the grandmother of [[Victoria Hughes]].



In the s, she participated in many boycotts and sit-ins. ''("[[Get Up, Stand Up (Station )|Get Up, Stand Up]]")''


Since her parents worked all the time, Vic came home after school and stayed with her grandmother, who encouraged her to have fun and watched musicals with her. When Vic was a teen, she told her grandmother that she was going to have the lead in West Side Story. She then noticed that her grandmother quickly forgot which musical she was doing and started singing a song from Pirates of Penzance instead. She also noticed that there was no food in a pot with boiling water, despite her saying dinner was nearly ready.

Later, on the night she was set to debut in Pirates of Penzance, Vic first had to check on her grandmother, making sure she took her meds and that the stove was off before going to her show. As she sang, her grandmother came into the theatre and started singing along. Then she climbed onto the stage and they sang the song together.

At some point after that, Marion died.



Since her son and daughter-in-law worked constantly, she took care of her granddaughter, Victoria, after school.


*Pirates of Penzance was her favorite musical.
*She claimed to have never passed a math test in her life.
*She was set to appear in [[Get Up, Stand Up (Station )|Get Up, Stand Up]] but her scenes appear to have been cut from the episode, for which the actress was still credited as a guest star.

'''Marnie''' is a pregnant woman who had a long, difficult labor.


While Marnie was pregnant with her second child, she had a fetal ablation. When she finally went into labor, she was upset because her water had broken, but labor wasn't progressing. Since an epidural had nearly killed her two years prior during her first delivery, that wasn't an option. An allergy to pitocin eliminated that option, meaning she just had to labor slowly in the hospital.

After twenty hours of labor, trying many things to progress her labor, [[Carina DeLuca]] suggested clitoral stimulation with climax to induce the release of oxytocin. Arizona was reluctant to suggest that, but when Marnie and Kevin asked for any other option to avoid a c-section, she eventually suggested it. With a little help from Kevin, Marnie was quickly crowning.



She is married to [[Kevin]].


She and her husband have a two year old and are expecting their second.

'''Marsha Smith''' is a woman whose Christmas tree caught on fire.



Her cat, Chairman Meow, got caught in the satellite wires on her roof. She called for help and Pruitt came. He untangled her cat and brought him back down to her. ''("[[Dream a Little Dream of Me]]")''


Marsha's tree caught on fire. While she waited for the fire department to arrive, she tried to put the fire out on her own but was unsuccessful. When Jack and Dean arrived, they quickly put out the fire and she broke down in Jack's arms, repeating that the tree was on fire.

Months later, Jack was still thinking about that call and how Marsha was all alone, except that tree, which burned down. After telling [[Diane Lewis]] about Marsha, he went to her apartment to bring her some groceries and some company. She thanked him and invited him in. ''("[[Something About What Happens When We Talk]]")''

While living alone, Marsha bought herself a bird. She didn't know she was scared of birds until she went to clean its cage and it ended up flying around her apartment. ''("[[Save Yourself]]")''

Marsha continued to be close to the firefighters, even bringing them donuts after Pruitt's death. When Jack needed a place for [[Inara]] and [[Marcus]] to stay after he learned Inara was being beaten by her husband, he took them to Marsha's place, where she welcomed them into her home. ''("[[Dream a Little Dream of Me]]")''

Inara and Marcus continued to stay with Marsha. ''("[[Louder Than a Bomb]]")''


During Covid-, Marcus, Inara, and Marsha isolated at Marsha's place together. Marcus didn't like when they wore the masks because he couldn't read their lips. He also wanted to show Jack his new train set, but Jack couldn't come inside to see it. Marsha expressed that she wasn't sure masks were doing anything, but Jack told her people said the same thing about seat belts when they first came out. ''("[[Nothing Seems the Same]]")''

One day, while Inara was at work, Marsha collapsed, so Marcus texted Jack, who brought the aid car to pick her up. She was struggling to breathe, so they took both her and Marcus to Grey Sloan. She was immediately tested and taken to the COVID unit. Jack and Marcus were also tested immediately and Inara was tested later. Marsha's test came back positive, but the other three tested negative. Jack was upset because Marsha had continuously refused to wear her mask. When Inara got home from work, she was worried that Marsha would die and they'd have to find another place to live. Jack offered to stay in the apartment with them until Marsha was able to come home, to keep them safe from Ted. He ended up sleeping on the couch, while Marcus slept on the floor next to him. ''("[[Don't Look Back in Anger]]")''

After some time in the hospital, Marsha started feeling better. She video called Inara, Jack, and Marcus asking for gossip and Inara and Jack were surprised to learn that Marcus already knew the two of them had hooked up and both he and Marsha were happy about it. Later, when Jack came home and asked Inara officially to be his girlfriend, Marcus and Marsha both celebrated. ''("[[Learning to Fly]]")''

Marsha's condition continued to improve until she was finally told she'd be able to go home the next day. Jack took the day off and he, Marcus, and Inara planned to come to the hospital to pick her up. However, as they were getting ready to leave, Jack got a call from Emmett telling them not to come as Marsha had taken a turn and they expected her to need to go on a ventilator later that day. Jack hadn't gotten a call as her son was her emergency contact. They were all heartbroken that they wouldn't be able to bring her home, so Maya brought the ladder truck to the hospital and Jack climbed up with Marcus and they held a sign outside Marsha's hospital window telling her to get better soon so Marcus could beat her at Parcheesi. ''("[[Make No Mistake, He's Mine]]")''

With Marsha on a ventilator, her son stepped in and used his power of attorney to have them remove it. When the time came, Jack, Inara, and Marcus did a video call with the hospital. Her son was also on the call, but left as soon as the process was initiated. Levi explained to them that there would probably be shallowing of her breathing and it could take minutes or hours. They stayed on the call and talked to her as she breathed. Hours later, while Jack was sharing a memory of Marsha getting a pet bird to talk to, they were surprised to hear Marsha laughing. She had woken up and was breathing well enough on her own. All the firefighters celebrated along with Inara, Jack, and Marcus. ''("[[Save Yourself]]")''

Marsha recovered enough to come home, so Inara and Jack set her up on the couch with everything she needed before they went off to work. ''("[[Here It Comes Again]]")''

As her recovery continued, Marsha offered to take Marcus to the park to work on an egg-drop project for school, allowing Jack and Inara their first real time alone together as a couple. ''("[[Comfortably Numb]]")''


After some time, Inara decided she and Marcus were going to move to California to live with her sister. Marsha encouraged Jack to talk to Inara about it and go with them, saying she was used to living alone and would love to visit them in California. ''("[[Forever and Ever, Amen]]")''


About a week before Christmas, Marsha took Jack to a Christmas tree farm. He was drunk, but she had taken away his whiskey so he could sober up before he had to work. She later sent cookies to the station for the team. ''("[[All I Want for Christmas is You]]")''


Jack got a text from Marsha while he was at the hardware store, asking if he was okay and why he wasn't texting her back. He tried to compose a reply, but deleted both attempts. ''("[[Dancing With Our Hands Tied]]")''



She is estranged from her son, likely due to her alcoholism.

She, Inara, and Marcus consider themselves each other's family. ''("[[Make No Mistake, He's Mine]]")''


*She doesn't like pineapple on pizza.<ref>[[Dream a Little Dream of Me]], x (S)</ref>
*She is afraid of birds.<ref>[[Save Yourself]], x</ref>

'''Marshall''' is a man who was electrocuted after a car accident.


Marshall was driving back to work when he was in a car accident. There were downed wires nearby electrifying the ground, so the firefighters told him to stay in his car while they worked to free him. However, when they noticed a fuel leak under his car, they no longer had time for him to wait, so they instructed him to jump carefully out onto the ground, making sure to land on both feet simultaneously. He did so, but then he had to continue hopping toward a safe area. While hopping, he lost his balance and fell into the road. The power was then shut off, so the firefighters approached him and saw that he was singed around his nose. Travis advised Ben that what you can't see with electrocution is often worse than what you can see. They started to work on him, but he was quickly declining. Travis wanted to intubate, but Ben stopped him because he wouldn't be able to talk once he was intubated. They told him he should call his wife. He called Lynn and told her he loved her and she replied in kind when he pushed her. She worried about him, but he wouldn't tell her what was happening. After they hung up, he quickly died.



He was married to [[Lynn (Station )|Lynn]] until his death.


He and his wife were expecting triplets when he died.


*He considered himself lucky.

'''Martin''' is the estranged father of [[Shauna]].


Martin's daughter, Shauna, was looking at wedding dresses with her estranged father when she passed out and hit her head. Andy and Rigo arrived and quickly confirmed a carbon monoxide leak in the store. They took Shauna out to the aid car, but their departure was delayed when Andy noticed smoke coming out of a manhole. Shauna realized she'd left her purse in the shop, so Martin went back to get it, over Andy's objection that he stay in the aid car, and was hit in the chest when the manhole cover was blown into the air. They got him into the ambulance, where they noted severe blunt trauma to his chest. They worked on him and when the rest of the team arrived, Travis and Ben took over. They tried to get Martin to the hospital, but they hit serious traffic and had to pull over to work on him. Unfortunately, he died of his injuries.



He was estranged from his daughter for many years after being absent for much of her childhood.


*He was  at the time of his death.

'''Mary''' is a woman who was injured when a party bus she was on crashed.


[[Susan]], Mary, and [[Carla]] rented a party bus with their friends for a Mom's Day Out. Their driver was overtired and drove the wrong way up an off-ramp and crashed. The women were all ejected from the bus. Mary had an injury to her leg, while Susan was impaled on a piece of the bus and Carla was trapped under the bus. The driver was dead on arrival. Station , on their way to the hospital with another patient, stopped to help. They cut the bar that was impaling Susan and then lifted the bus off Carla to free her. They set up a nearby triage, where they treated Mary and the other six women. Mary had an open fracture to her leg and they struggled, but eventually stopped the bleeding. Once Carla was pulled out from under the bus, she crashed, but they were able to resuscitate her. All the women were then taken to the hospital.



She is close friends with [[Carla]] and [[Susan]]. Carla and Susan are said to be like oil and vinegar, with Mary being the glue that holds them together.


Mary chose the bus because it was supposed to be safer.

'''Mary''' is a woman who was rescued from a house fire by Station .


Mary's husband, Jimmy, had been sent out to get supplies for his mother to make pies. Instead, he sat in the driveway for two hours when the carport collapsed on his car due to the wind storm. Mary finally spotted him and called for help. Station  arrived on foot after trees blocked their way and worked to free Jimmy. Mary was irritated at him for running away instead of helping her deal with his mother, Ruth, whom she felt was undermining her parenting. This was affirmed when they heard her over the radio responding immediately when they cried, instead of letting them cry it out. Mary went back inside for her safety while they continued to try to free Jimmy.

However, a spark started a fire in their house. When the team noticed, they jumped into action to rescue the family and put the fire out. Maya had to run back to the truck to get supplies. She sent Ben and Travis in to get Ruth, Mary, and the babies out while Dean and   finished getting Jimmy out. Travis and Ben found Mary trying to go upstairs after the babies, so Travis pulled her out while Ben went upstairs to get the babies. He found Ruth in their nursery holding both of them to her chest. He took the babies from her and told her to follow right behind him. Once the babies were out, Mary and Travis took them to check them over and Ben realized that Ruth hadn't followed him out. Even though Travis warned him to wait for oxygen, Ben took a deep breath and ran back into the house after Ruth. He got to the room, but before he could get her out, the doorway became blocked with flames, trapping them inside. He radioed out with his situation and then waited with Ruth for help.

When Maya returned, she and Vic came inside and carried Ruth out with them right after Ben. Then they were able to focus on putting the house fire out. When Ruth was brought over, Jimmy was concerned about her, but Mary pushed him back, saying Ruth needed air and not to aggravate her.



She is married to [[Jimmy (Weather the Storm)|Jimmy]].


After the birth of Mary's twins, her mother-in-law, [[Ruth (Weather the Storm)|Ruth]], stayed with them and starting taking over their care in a way that made Mary uncomfortable. She was upset with the notion that Ruth wanted to move in with them. However, after Ruth saved the babies during a house fire, Mary was defensive and protective of her.


*She and her family live at  Silkwood Lane.

'''Mason Bishop''' is the brother of [[Maya Bishop]].



As a teen, Mason was involved both in art at his school and running. His father, who openly preferred Maya for focusing all her energy on running in order to be the best, insulted him constantly for refusing to give up art in order to be the best at running. While their mother stood by their father, Maya said she'd come to Mason's art show. ''("[[Into the Woods]]")''


As an adult, Mason was arrested for stealing art supplies. Ryan called Maya to let her know and she verified that he was her brother. She was shocked to learn that Mason had been living on the streets. He had given up running and taken up art when he was young because Maya was a superior athlete. His parents refused to support his art, including when he got into art school because they invested all their time and money into Maya. ''("[[Reignited]]")''


Mason came to the area where his sister and Andy were giving hepatitis vaccinations. Andy offered him one, but Maya said no needles for him. Maya also offered him some food and things she'd brought in case she ran into him, but he refused, saying he didn't want handouts. She also offered to have him live with her. He refused that as well.

Maya later found Mason's camp and brought him food and art supplies and told him she was there when he wanted more. He painted a large picture on a nearby wall, but left the area. ''("[[Let It Burn]]")''


At the time of Maya and Carina's wedding, Maya had no idea where he was. ''("[[Forever and Ever, Amen]]")''



As a child, Mason was left behind because his sister was a superior athlete. He gave up running and took up art. He got into art school, but his parents wouldn't pay for it because they invested all their money into Maya, who went on to win an Olympic gold. ''("[[Reignited]]")''


*He first OD'd the day his sister won her gold medal. ''("[[Reignited]]")''
