'''Max Forrester''' is the son of [[Natalie Forrester]] who ended up being rescued by [[SFD Station ]].


Max and his mom, Natalie, were evacuated from their apartment building when there was a fire. While waiting outside the building, Natalie collapsed and was taken to the hospital. She coded in the ER, but they were able to resuscitate. When she regained consciousness, she was worried about her son, Max, who has anxiety and likes to know what's coming and what to expect. However, when he came in so she could talk to him, she coded again and had to be rushed into surgery. There was damage to her heart that indicated a recent heart attack that hadn't been treated, likely because she thought it was just heartburn. Maggie placed an LVAD to take the pressure off her heart, but because of the severe damage she saw, she told Natalie's husband, Evan, that it was unlikely that Natalie would ever wake up. Despite this, Evan persistently refused to tell Max that his mom was dying and instead lied to him that everything would be okay. When Evan went to Natalie's room to say goodbye to her, he left Max with Andrew because he didn't want Max to see his mom like that. Andrew took Max up to the roof to talk to him about how sometimes people don't know how to tell other people bad news. He worried Max, who thought it meant that his mom was dead already, and he took off and then left the hospital on his own. ''("[[Momma Knows Best]]")''

The police were called to track Max down and [[Ryan Tanner]] found him walking alongside the street by himself. He called out to Max, but Max started running and fell into a manhole down into the sewer, where he was swept away. [[SFD Station ]] was called to coordinate a rescue effort. Evan asked to come along and help. They almost had him at one drain pipe, but because of an oxygen tank malfunction, Maya wasn't able to get down the sewer in time. Andy jumped down impulsively, but she wasn't able to get a proper hold on Max and he was swept away again. The last place where they had a chance to catch up to him turned out to have a very small opening, too small for an adult, so they were forced to lower a loop down to Max so he could be pulled up on his own. However, Max refused to trust his father, who had told him to let go of where he was holding and grab the loop. Evan then confessed to Max that his mother was dying and apologized for not telling him before. Max then grabbed the loop and was lifted to safety. Evan then took Max to his mother's hospital room, where he lay with his mom to say goodbye. ''("[[Under the Surface]]")''



His mother is dying.


*He likes to hide when he's scared.<ref>[[Momma Knows Best]], x</ref>
*He was ten years old at the time of his rescue.

{{Firefighter Infobox |name = Maya DeLuca-Bishop |image = Sx-.jpg |status = Unknown |alias = Firefighter Barbie |title = Lieutenant |marital = [[Carina DeLuca]] ''(wife)'' |siblings = [[Mason Bishop]] |parents = *[[Katherine Bishop]] *[[Lane Bishop]] |other family = *[[Andrew DeLuca]] \u ''(brother-in-law)'' *[[Lucia DeLuca]] \u ''(mother-in-law)'' *[[Vincenzo DeLuca]] ''(father-in-law)'' |job = '''Current'''
Fire Lieutenant '''Former'''
Fire Captain |workplace = [[SFD Station ]] |first appearance = *'''[[Station |S]]:''' [[Stuck]] *'''[[Grey's Anatomy|GA]]:''' [[A Diagnosis]] |count = |seasons = *'''[[Station |S]]:''' [[Season (Station )|]], [[Season (Station )|]], [[Season (Station )|]], [[Season (Station )|]], [[Season (Station )|]], and [[Season (Station )|]] *'''[[Grey's Anatomy|GA]]:''' [[Season (Grey's Anatomy)|]] and [[Season (Grey's Anatomy)|]] |portrayed by = [[Danielle Savre]] }} '''Maya DeLuca-Bishop''' is the former captain and current lieutenant of [[SFD Station |Station ]] of the [[Seattle Fire Department]]. She is married to [[Carina DeLuca|Carina DeLuca-Bishop]]. Maya grew up with an abusive father, who pushed her to train excessively to ensure her winning every race, going as far as forcing her out of bed the morning after a race by pouring cold water over her rather than letting her enjoy her victory. He also put her on a strict diet that wouldn't even allow her to eat a cookie. As such, Maya missed out on the things that most teenagers occupy themselves with, like music and celebrity crushes. During practice, one of her competitors, [[Hima]], approached her and invited her to tag along with the rest of the team for pizza. Maya declined because of her diet. Hima had noticed him at races before and commented he was a bit scary. Maya admitted he was. Hima then invited her to the theatre to watch the latest movie, which Maya accepted. As their friendship grew, Maya developed a crush on her. While Hima was helping her with her trigonometry, she discovered that Maya wouldn't even eat a cookie per her father's imposed diet. Maya knew how it looked but she praised herself lucky for having a dad who put her above everything else, never missing a single race, while other dads were always working or vanished after a divorce. Hima then found out Maya didn't know anything about pop culture. When she asked if Maya had a celebrity crush, Maya replied she had a crush, though not a celebrity one. She then leaned in and kissed Hima. During the next race, Hima twisted her ankle and fell on the track. Maya, who was leading the race, stopped to check on her. Hima urged her to keep going but Maya only managed to get back to second place. Her father was furious with her and told her she had no friends on the track, only competition. That night at the dinner table, he punished her by denying her potatoes. He then went on to ignore Maya completely and turned to Mason, who wasn't used to receiving attention from his father. Mason said he finished third in a mile run and got a piece in the school art show. Their father told him to quit art so he could achieve first place. Maya stood up for him by saying she would come to his art show and reached for the potatoes, but her father grabbed them and threw the bowl into the wall and he told Mason he couldn't hear losers, who are dead to him. His behavior made her put all her attention back into training. She won the next race and as her father congratulated her, she ignored Hima's attempt at high fiving her.[[Into the Woods]], x (S) [[File:xMayaMedal.png|thumb|Maya's gold medal.]] Maya then went on to win a gold medal in the , meter sprint in the Olympics in London. She did so on a sprained ankle, pushing through the pain like she had been taught.[[No Recovery]], x (S)[[House Where Nobody Lives]], x (S) On her first day at the fire academy, Maya met Andy. Andy tried to tell her they didn't have to be friends because they were the only two women. Maya said there's safety in numbers and they ended up sticking together. When Andy struggled with a hose drill, Maya coached her through it.[[No Recovery]], x (S) [[Tiffany (Stuck)|Tiffany's]] house caught on fire when her laptop cord sparked on her bed while she was in the bathroom. Station responded to the fire. Pruitt sent Maya and Andy in to do search and rescue while Dean, Jack, and Travis put out the fire. Maya and Andy quickly found Tiffany and brought her outside, where she said Charlie was still inside. With the fire extinguished, they searched for Charlie and quickly found a puppy. Dean carried Charlie out and handed him over to a grateful Tiffany. While fighting an apartment fire, Jack and Pruitt got separated when Jack entered a kid's room to look for a child. When he came back out, he couldn't find Pruitt because of the smoke. He had to tell Andy he couldn't find her dad and she and Maya came to help look for him. They found him on the floor, unconscious and pulseless. They tried to take him out, but they noticed the fire was choking, so they couldn't go out of the apartment. Once Andy got a pulse on her father, they strapped him to Jack and the four of them jumped out the window onto landing pads. Pruitt was then taken to [[Grey Sloan Memorial Hospital]], where he had surgery and then was diagnosed with mesothelioma. He knew he had to step down as Captain immediately. He said Jack could be in charge until they filled the job. When Andy protested that, he promoted her to lieutenant and said they could share the responsibilities until a new captain was officially chosen.[[Stuck]], x (S) Station got called out to Stratford Middle School, where someone had pulled the fire alarm. [[Principal Linsley]] met them and said it was likely a false alarm. They said they'd won as quickly as they could to clear the building and get the kids back inside. They went through the building and found the alarm that had been pulled. They turned off the alarm and went continue their sweep, but Ben found Tuck still inside the building. He followed Tuck and saw that he was the one who had pulled the alarm. He needed to get Ben to the school for his friend Ava, who was pregnant and in labor. He did everything he knew to do, but still needed help. Ben and Vic delivered Ava's baby and after a brief complication when the amniotic sac didn't rupture, Ava and the baby were both healthy and stable.[[Invisible to Me]], x (S) When a crash caused a tanker to overturn, Station responded. Dean and Travis had to pry [[Shawn (Invisible to Me)|Shawn]] out of his car while Vic and Ben worked on the truck driver, who had gotten out of the cab and fallen. They noticed it was hot around them just as Andy realized it was an ethanol fire. It was surrounding Ben and Vic and they didn't have enough foam to put it out. Vic and Ben couldn't get out without leaving the truck driver there to die. They got him as wet and cool as they could as they treated him and then conserved their air while the rest of the team tried to figure out how to get them out. Andy eventually decided to back the truck over the flames to get them out and drive it back out.[[Invisible to Me]], x (S) After Ben and Dean discovered that The Langham was on fire, they called the rest of the team in to help and started an evacuation. When the team arrived, they went up to the roof. They located the flame under the roof and created a ventilation hole, despite Jack wanting to make a strip. The hole wasn't sufficient to make the fire die down, so Andy authorized them to cut a strip. The strip worked and the fire started to die down. They got off the roof less than a minute before the roof collapsed.[[Contain the Flame]], x (S) When Andy was confused about her feelings, she called Maya and Vic to drink and hang out. They talked on the porch and admitted Ryan's looks when he came over to talk to Andy.[[Contain the Flame]], x (S) Station responded to a medical call. [[Dallas]] called the police after her brother and friends wouldn't wake up when she pulled them out of the pool. They'd made ice cream with liquid nitrogen and poured the rest in the pool to make it look cool. They were able to get the kids all breathing again, but then Jack suddenly jumped into the pool. He emerged with another kid that Dallas thought had gone home. They got her breathing as well and Dallas went to give them numbers to contact parents, but she had trouble breathing and vomited. She was dry drowning. She was put in an ambulance and taken to the hospital.[[Contain the Flame]], x (S) Maya went with Travis on a medical call. They tended to [[Edith]], who had fallen and dislocated her shoulder, something that had happened before. Maya was shocked that Edith refused pain medication. Travis saw her foot shaking and asked if she had seen a doctor for it, but she said she was fine. Travis told her she needed an adjustable bed and her grandson was supposed to get her one. She said that she hadn't told her grandson about it because she didn't want him to worry.[[Reignited]], x (S) The team responded to a fire at a B&B on Sunken Meadow Road. Ben and Vic laid out the hoses, but before they could take them into the fire, a neighbor drove over one and popped it. They went to get a replacement line, but it turned out to be unnecessary because the fire was small and contained to the stovetop. They later returned to the Inn when the fire reignited and engulfed the building in flames. When a fire reignited in her face, Vic started to have a panic attack and Ben pulled her out while Andy doused the flames. Outside, Vic's ear was treated where it had been burned. Inside, Andy heard popping. She tried to go toward where she heard Deborah, but there were exploding wine bottles between them. They looked for the fuel that was feeding the fire to stop it off while Andy ran past the bottles to get to Deborah. Andy tied off her leg above a wound and then helped her out, using a tray as a shield from the glass. They were able to turn off the gas to the house, to keep it from reigniting. Once they got Deborah out, they realized she'd inhaled some glass. They couldn't intubate, so they did a crike and got her breathing again. Then they took her to the hospital. When Ben later came to Vic and offered to help her, she denied any trouble, saying she was still a rookie and something like that could damage her reputation forever.[[Reignited]], x (S) While on duty, Maya received a call from [[Ryan Tanner|Ryan]], explaining that her brother was in jail for stealing art supplies. When she arrived at the jail, she was surprised to find out that he was unhoused. She explained to Ryan how he took an interest in art but his parents had no attention or investment to give him since it was all put into her Olympic training, and that Maya blamed herself for his drug addiction. Ryan said to her that he would keep Mason at the jail overnight and keep an extra eye on Mason while on patrol, which Maya agreed to.[[Reignited]], x (S) Maya and Andy responded to a call for an Aid Car at a police stakeout, just in case anyone got hurt. They got bored as they waited in the ambulance, unable to leave. After the lost the video feed and heart gunshots, Andy, worried for Ryan, wanted to go in immediately, but Maya reminded her that they had to wait to be called. Not long after, they were called in and they learned that it was another officer, not Ryan, who had been shot and they took him to the hospital for an x-ray because the bullet had been caught by his vest.[[Shock to the System (S)|Shock to the System]], x (S) While Jack and Andy were taking The Incinerator test, they left Travis in charge as he had seniority. He took his role very seriously. When they were called out to an intersection, they couldn't find the emergency. Suddenly, Vic noticed [[Piper]] calling out to them from here she was stuck in a pothole in the middle of a crosswalk. When a truck didn't notice her and was heading in her direction, Vic put herself between Piper and the truck and covered them. The truck swerved at the last minute and missed both of them. Travis was very cautious about making sure no one else fell in. They quickly discovered that the asphalt was digging into Piper's leg, keeping her trapped. They'd have to dig around her to free her. They dug for a while, but eventually, they had to pull Piper out when her leg started to swell. She was then taken to the hospital. At the end of the shift, Vic confessed to the others that she was scared of fire. They decided to help her without telling Jack and Andy, who would be obligated to report it.[[Stronger Together]], x (S) Maya and Travis did fire drills with Vic, exposing her to flames. Maya continued the drills, even when Vic started to panic. Maya tried to coach her through it, but Vic said it wasn't helping and stopped the drills. They later went jogging, which Vic also didn't enjoy, but Maya said it was jogging or the torches.[[Let It Burn]], x (S) Maya and Andy took an ambulance out to give hepatitis vaccines to unhoused people. They saw Mason, who declined a vaccine and Maya's help. Despite this, Maya returned to the area to bring Mason supplies, both things she thought he needed and things he thought he needed. When she jogged by the area later, she saw that he'd painted a mural on the wall, but had left the area.[[Let It Burn]], x (S) A fire started at Flanner's restaurant and quickly spread to the rest of the strip mall. Station was called the respond. Jack rushed in to evacuate people, followed by Ryan, despite Ryan not wearing turnout gear. They evacuated all the survivors they could quickly while Maya, Dean, Vic, and Travis set up the lines to douse the fire. Audrey tried to get them access, but her blistered finger meant the pad couldn't read her print. Dean was sent to put the override code in, but he forgot the code and couldn't radio out because his radio was on the wrong channel, so after two failed attempts, the others were locked in the garage with no way out. With the fire in the house, the garage started to heat up. They searched for anything they could use to try to free themselves. They found a toolkit, which Karen used to pick the lock on the trunk of the car and retrieve a jack. They tried to use the jack to lift the garage door, but it wouldn't budge. As the temperature climbed, Ryan decided to hot wire the car and try to use it as a battering ram. Jack said it was a bad idea, but Ryan started it anyway. Andy was able to stop him before he moved the car. Jack had the idea to use the motor from the internal door to get access to the house. It didn't work and they started to wear out. When Pruitt arrived and gave Andy a pep talk, she used the last of her energy to think of a plan. She saw the water heater and decided they could use the pilot light to create an explosion. It worked and once they were free, they were all cooled down and rehydrated.[[Hot Box]], x (S) Station anxiously waited to be called in on the skyscraper fire. When the evacuation was started, they had to keep the civilians calm as they waited for their turns. They were able to free Jack and then evacuated the building.[[No Recovery]], x (S) Six weeks after the skyscraper fire, the team gathered at the station to meet their new captain. However, her oxygen tank wasn't working, so they went to get a replacement tank. While she was gone, Andy heard Max's voice down below them. Over Maya and Sullivan's objections, Andy jumped down into the drain to try to get to him. However, the flow of water picked up and while she was pulled underwater, Max was swept away. When they arrived, they learned that the opening was smaller than they expected, too small for an adult to fit down to get him. When they heard Max down below them, they considered using a jackhammer to widen the opening, but Ben found that there was a gas line near them and it's too risky. Since they couldn't get an adult down into the drain, they decided to send down a loop for Max to grab. Max was scared to let go and jump to the loop, even when his father told him to. Back at the station, Maya was upset with Andy for ruining their first chance to get Max.[[Under the Surface]], x (S) Station was called to the apartment of [[Evelyn]] after her downstairs neighbors were worried about her after her floor started collapsing into their apartment and she didn't answer her phone. She went to their house and told them she is bisexual, in love with a woman, and getting married to her. She told her mom that she didn't deserve to be cowering behind Lane in the hallway and invited her mom to come live with her and Carina. Lane tries to talk to her, but Maya cut him off and left. Maya's mother came to the wedding alone.[[Forever and Ever, Amen]], x [[Andy Herrera]] Maya and Andy are best friends and each other's confidant.[[Stuck]], x (S) They met at the fire academy and banded together as they were the only two women in their class and have been best friends ever since.[[No Recovery]], x (S) However, when Andy snapped at Maya that the Captain's race wasn't her fight, Maya backed off and was cold toward Andy.[[Contain the Flame]], x (S) She continued to ignore Andy, but after realizing you should let the people you love in, she went to find Andy, but was shocked to see Jack's uniform top outside the Captain's bedroom.[[Reignited]], x (S) While on a stakeout together, unable to leave, they started talking and sorted through their issues together.[[Shock to the System (S)|Shock to the System]], x (S)\uaWhile trapped in a burning garage with no way out, the two worked together to find a way to escape and Andy was worried when Maya was knocked over from the explosion.[[Hot Box]], x (S) Maya also helped Andy look for Jack during the skyscraper fire.[[No Recovery]], x (S)\ua When Andy decided she needed to move out of her father's house, Maya supported her and offered to let Andy move in with her. However, later that day, when Andy jeopardized Maya's shot at rescuing [[Max Forrester|a kid]], Maya was angry at her.[[Under the Surface]], x (S)\uaThe two later resolved their differences and Andy often came into Maya's bathroom while Maya was showering to ask her for advice. When Ripley announced that Maya had applied for lieutenant and she would have an interview, Andy was upset Maya hadn't told her. Maya later confessed she hadn't told her because she didn't want her and Andy to get competitive, but Andy told her she wasn't afraid to get competitive with her. Later, when Sullivan took his anger out on Maya during the police training, Andy took Maya's side and yelled at Sullivan.[[Do a Little Harm...]], x (S) The next shift, Andy and Maya worked together on Aid Car and Maya was supportive of Andy who was worried Sullivan would fire her, but Sullivan didn't.[[Last Day on Earth]], x (S) During the windstorm, Maya was initially rostered on Aid Car,\uabut Andy took her place along with Sullivan so Maya could impress Chief Ripley. When Ripley announced that Maya would be promoted to lieutenant at station , Maya tried to call Andy to tell her the news, but it went to voicemail.[[Weather the Storm]], x (S) Maya was worried about Andy when Ripley told the team that she and Sullivan hadn't reached Rainier First Hospital and she drove the firetruck and helped rescue Andy and Sullivan. She attended Andy's Medal of Valor ceremony and later hosted a party at their apartment for the occasion. Maya also teased Andy about having sex with Ryan in her room during the party.[[Crash and Burn]], x (S) When Andy didn't want to give an interview about winning her Medal of Valor, Maya supported her, but told her that she'd lost her "firegasm" and the two worked together to help a woman with fake amnesia to see her son before his surgery. The two also agreed to have shower boundaries.[[I Fought the Law]], x (S) After Maya and Jack had sex for the first time, Maya wanted to tell Andy about it, but kept getting interrupted by Andy's own issues with Ryan and later decided to continue keeping her relationship a secret.[[Baby Boom]], x (S) After agreeing to finally tell Andy the truth, Maya and Jack decided to secretly hookup one last time, but Andy found them in the supply closet. Andy slammed the door in anger and ignored Maya throughout the drive to the call, but made it clear that she was mad at her best friend. Later, Maya and Andy argued again and Andy said she felt humiliated that Maya didn't think enough of Andy to tell her she was seeing Andy's ex-boyfriend.[[Friendly Fire]], x (S)\ua After Chief Ripley died, Vic crashed with Andy and Maya and the two took care of her by making her breakfast and trying to reach her when she wasn't in her room despite the tension between them. Maya asked Andy if they should talk later, but Andy said they should just focus on Vic. Later at the funeral, Andy and Maya talked and Maya apologized for not telling Andy about Jack and Andy accepted her apology before Maya asked Andy how she was coping with the funeral. After the funeral, while at the bar, Andy and Maya talked about Andy and Jack and Vic. Andy then told Maya that Ryan had thought that she and Sullivan were together. Maya told Andy that she'd seen their moment at the hospital, too, but Andy refused to believe it.[[For Whom the Bell Tolls]], x (S) Maya is a firefighter at [[SFD Station |Station ]] of the [[Seattle Fire Department]]. When Sullivan assigned the team special skills, Maya got assigned incident operations.[[Lost and Found]], x (S)\uaAt Ripley's recommendation and Sullivan's insistence, Maya applied to be a lieutenant and was promoted shortly after.[[Home To Hold Onto]], x (S)[[Weather the Storm]], x (S) When she was initially promoted to lieutenant, she was supposed to transfer to station . After the storm, with Jack benched, Maya acted as temporary second lieutenant.[[Crash and Burn]], x (S) However, when she was supposed to transfer, Sullivan asked Chief Ripley to let him have all three lieutenants, which meant that Maya remained at station as a lieutenant.[[I Fought the Law]], x (S) When Ripley died and Robert was promoted to Battalion Chief, Maya advocated for herself to be appointed Captain. She was granted the promotion, making her the youngest Captain ever in the Seattle Fire Department as well as the first female Captain at Station .[[The Ghosts That Haunt Me]], x (S) She is a former Olympic athlete. She has won a gold medal, on a sprained ankle with her best ever time in the , meter run.[[No Recovery]], x (S) *Her father calls her kiddo.[[Into the Woods]], x (S) *She runs.[[Contain the Flame]], x (S) *She can kind of cook.[[The Dark Night]], x (S) *She won an Olympic Gold Medal at the Olympics in London.[[No Recovery]], x (S) **As a result of this, her picture is on a Wheaties box.[[Forever and Ever, Amen]], x (S) *She speaks a little Nepalese, which she learned while backpacking through Kathmandu.[[The Dark Night]], x (S) *She absorbed her twin in utero.[[The Dark Night]], x (S)\ua *She hates road trips.[[Into the Wildfire]], x (S) *She was the youngest fire captain in Seattle. *She was the first female fire captain of Station . '''Mel''' is an unhoused woman who called for help for [[Ameen Deng]].


Mel had been living near [[Ameen Deng]] in an encampment for a few weeks when he started showing signs of distress. He asked her not to call --, but when he started gasping for breath, she called anyway. When the aid car arrived, she led them to Ameen.

'''Melly Wyatt''' is a woman who held Emmett, Ben, and Jackson at gun point.


Melly Wyatt was in Humboldt Park as Ben, Jackson, and Emmett treated a stabbing victim. She saw them take the victim into the PRT and climbed in the front seat, where she used a gun to force Emmett to start driving away. Once they were some distance away, Melly had Emmett stop and then held the gun on him as he walked to the back of the PRT and opened it. Then she demanded drugs in exchange for his life. Ben tried to talk her down, but she refused, even when he said that he couldn't take his hands off the stabbing victim without him dying. Emmett then climbed into the PRT to get the drugs, but tripped, startling Melly, who then fired the gun and hit Jackson in his leg. Ben gave Emmett the code to open the cabinet where the drugs were kept. Melly happily started grabbing them once the cabinet was open, then fled the PRT. However, a car was driving by at the same time and she was struck and killed.


*She was pronounced dead at :.

'''Michael''' is a childhood friend of [[Ben Warren]].


Michael's friend, Danny's, father had a very nice car. Michael, Danny, and [[Ben Warren|Ben]] decided to take his car for a little joyride. They decided to drive the car quickly and stand in the backseat to get extra thrill. Danny's friends noticed he never let them drive and so never stood in the back himself, so Ben dared him to. However, when he did so, the car crashed and threw him out, causing a head injury that left him in an unconscious state even years later.



He, [[Danny Monroe]], and [[Ben Warren]] were all childhood friends.

'''Michael Williams''' was a firefighter at SFD Station  of the [[Seattle Fire Department]], and is Travis's late husband. 



Michael met Travis when they were in the fire academy. Travis helped Michael practice rescuing trapped persons by pretending to be one in a scenario created by Theo to help him study. Michael successfully rescued Travis. By the next year, they were dating secretly. However, when Travis came over to Michael and Theo's place, they learned that Theo knew  and was happy for them. They continued to date until, in , while having dinner with Theo, Travis accidentally referenced their future children. This prompted Michael to pull out a ring to propose. Travis surprised him by producing a ring of his own. They proposed and accepted simultaneously. ''("[[No One is Alone]]")''

When they told Travis's parents they were engaged, his parents were silent on the issue and then his father left the table. As they planned the wedding, Travis asked his mother to read a poem she'd written while she was pregnant with Travis at the ceremony. She agreed, but on the day of the wedding, neither of his parents came. Michael promised to be his family and show up for him.

After the wedding, Nari read the poem to them privately. Michael said she'd done her best, though Travis said it wasn't enough. ''("[[Ice Ice Baby]]")''

When Theo came up for a promotion to captain, the three of them celebrated with some champagne. After the promotion went through, Travis worried about Theo being Michael's captain given their friendship. He worried about Theo being responsible for Michael being injured on the job. Michael reassured him that it would be okay. However, some time later, at a scene, Theo miscalculated and told Michael it was safe to shelter in place. It wasn't, and Michael ended up dying. ''("[[No One is Alone]]")''



[[Travis Montgomery]]
He was married to [[Travis Montgomery|Travis]] until his death. Neither of Travis's parents was present at their wedding and never publicly accepted their marriage. ''("[[Ice Ice Baby]]")'' After their wedding, they honeymooned at a B&B. ''("[[Reignited]]")''

At some point during their marriage, they won a trip to the Maldives. During the trip, Travis worried about not having much time left on their trip until Michael told him to stop and enjoy himself instead of just worrying about not having enough time left. ''("[[No One is Alone]]")''


[[Theo Ruiz]]
He and [[Theo Ruiz|Theo]] were best friends until his death, for which Theo was responsible. They attended the fire academy together and were probies together. They also lived together until Michael married Travis. ''("[[No One is Alone]]")''


He was a firefighter for [[Seattle Fire Department]] at station  until he died in the line of duty.


*He made a great veggie meatloaf. He gave Travis the recipe before he died.<ref>[[Stuck]], x (S)</ref>
*Halloween was his favorite holiday.<ref>[[Demons]], x (S)</ref>

{{Police Officer Infobox |image = Sx-.jpg |name = Michael Dixon |alias = Dick |status = Alive |marital = [[Kitty Dixon]] ''(wife)'' |children = [[Emmett Dixon]] |job = '''Current'''
Deputy Chief of Operations '''Former'''
Fire Chief |workplace = '''Current'''
Seattle Metropolitan Police Department '''Former'''
[[Seattle Fire Department]] |first appearance = [[Indoor Fireworks]] |last appearance = |count = |seasons = '''[[Station |S]]:''' [[Season (Station )|]], [[Season (Station )|]], [[Season (Station )|]], and [[Season (Station )|]] |portrayed by = [[Pat Healy]] }} '''Michael Dixon''' is the former fire chief for [[Seattle Fire Department]]. When he was a cop, he pulled over the mayor's son, who was drunk. Instead of arresting him, he instead told the son to go straight home, knowing that would earn him a favor from the mayor. Instead of going straight home, the son caused an accident which killed a family of five. He spent only a single night in jail before being released. Dixon later cashed in that favor to be named the fire chief. ''("[[The Ghosts That Haunt Me]]")'' Michael was chosen to replace the late [[Lucas Ripley]] as fire chief in Seattle. He gave a press release promising good things for Seattle under his leadership. Then he visited Station , where they made bad first impressions by mocking him without knowing he was standing behind him. He declared his intentions to use specifically Maya to generate good press for the fire department. After Station responded to a fire at a store where a set of fireworks had been set off, he lauded the department's efforts in that case during a press conference. ''("[[Indoor Fireworks]]")'' While they were playing ping pong, Ben proposed to Dixon that he sponsor a program to staff ambulances with physicians, bringing the hospital to the public. He rejected Ben's idea and then left to go to a meeting. After watching [[Martin]] die, Ben went back to Dixon and asked him what he had to do to make the physician response team happen. He asked Dixon to give half the money and said he'd get Grey Sloan to make a fellowship to cover the other half. ''("[[Eulogy]]")'' Dixon was pleased when Maya was named the new captain of station and supported her when she gave her first big speech to the team. Later, he ran into Pruitt, who was having trouble getting his cancer treatment covered even though the cancer was almost definitely a result of his work as a firefighter. Dixon brushed off Pruitt and his concerns. ''("[[House Where Nobody Lives]]")'' Dixon came to the station the day the PRT launched, posing for photographs and preparing for the press. He also introduced his son, [[Emmett Dixon]], the newest recruit for station . He asked Sullivan to take it easy on Emmett, because he wasn't a natural talent even though he worked hard. ''("[[Satellite of Love]]")'' When Dixon learned that station was responding to [[Kyle Rexton]] holding a knife on a shop owner, he tried to get Maya to back her team off so PD could step in with their negotiator. She refused, saying Sullivan had unique insight because he and the subject were both veterans and her team was handling it. Later, Dixon went back to Maya and told her to get his son off the scene. She refused, saying he's part of her team. Dixon then ordered the SWAT team to approach and said PD would be making the calls once SWAT was in position. Before this could happen, Sullivan peacefully led Kyle out, where he was arrested and the grenade he was holding was neutralized. When they returned to the station, Dixon told Maya that if she put his son in danger again, he'd bury her in desk duty. ''("[[Poor Wandering One]]")'' When Pruitt lined up boots on the steps of city hall to represent the firefighters who had died of cancer within the last year, Dixon was upset at the display. ''("[[Poor Wandering One]]")'' On Emmett's day off, Dixon planned to have dinner with him and his girlfriend, Alicia, and show her around the station. They had dinner along with Travis, who had come to the station to get his forgotten headphones. At the lunch, Dixon made it clear he intended for Emmett to make lieutenant within six months and asked Travis if he could do it on his own or if he'd have to pull some strings. Travis said a few decades on the job might toughen him up. After a fire in the city was upgraded to a three-alarm, Dixon excused himself to make an appearance at the scene. Later, after it was upgraded again to a level-five, all firefighters in the city were called to the scene. Dixon told the arriving members of station to stay safe and not get killed because it would be murder on the city's insurance. ''("[[No Days Off]]")'' Following Pruitt's death, Dixon launched an investigation into Maya and her decision to allow Pruitt to go onto to the roof where he fell to his death. When he arrived at the station, he found Travis posing for a calendar and believed Maya had planned that to garner sympathy. He then invited the whole team to his country club to celebrate his son's engagement to [[Alicia]]. He then proceeded into Maya's office to question her, along with [[Jerry Cooke]]. He asked Maya to go over what had happened and she explained what Pruitt had chosen. When she became emotional speaking about it, he told her to pull herself together and not make him regret endorsing a female captain. She informed him that her emotion was not a weakness but a strength. After the questioning was finished, Maya reminded Dixon that during the same call, Sullivan left his post and entered the building, but he couldn't reprimand him because it would reflect poorly on himself, as he'd appointed Sullivan. She told him he could order her back to work or order her to do whatever and she'd do it. ''("[[Dream a Little Dream of Me]]")'' Dixon was annoyed when Sullivan stopped him from going home because he had something to tell him. Thinking it was about Pruitt's funeral, he finally agreed to fund it. Sullivan then confessed that he and Andy were married. He additionally confessed to stealing drugs from the PRT and overdosing while on the job. After hearing his confession, Dixon made it clear to Sullivan that he expected him to keep it to himself. If it got out, he'd have a drug scandal marring his first year as Chief and made it clear he'd turn them over to the feds, risking prison time for Sullivan, Ben, and Bailey, if it got out. As Sullivan left, Dixon told him Sullivan owed him one and he wouldn't forget that. ''("[[The Ghosts That Haunt Me]]")'' In exchange for keeping quiet about Sullivan's theft and overdose, Dixon tried to push through permits for a friend's new business without inspections. Sullivan decided not to let that happen and went to the Civil Services Commission and confessed to what he had done and detailed Dixon's corruption. ''("[[Bad Guy]]")'' Dixon came to check in at the scene of a series of explosions at [[Pacific Northwest General Hospital]]. While Maya was trying to report on what happened, he instead walked away to talk to the press. While he was at the scene, talking to the press, two officers came and informed him they had a warrant for his arrest. They arrested him on charges of fraud and extortion. ''("[[Louder Than a Bomb]]")'' He revealed at Sullivan's hearing that all charges against him had been dropped. ''("[[We Are Family]]")'' Dixon was called on to testify at Sullivan's hearing to determine if he would be allowed to continue to be a firefighter. He was quick to shift any blame off himself, claiming he didn't report it immediately because he was holding his own internal investigation. He also insinuated that Sullivan used the fact that Emmett is gay to keep him quiet on the issue. He also implied Sullivan had been using drugs during other calls, including the one where Pruitt Herrera died. After testifying, he told Ben to let Sullivan go down and not go down with him. ''("[[We Are Family]]")'' In the wake of Dean's lawsuit against the Seattle police, Dixon came to the station and told Maya to put a muzzle on Dean if she valued her career and their relationship with the police department. She told him the police department should be the one mending fences, not the fire department. ''("[[Here It Comes Again]]")'' In the wake of George Floyd's death, Dixon appeared on television making a statement on behalf of the police department. He said the police department stood in support of their communities. Then he knelt on camera. ''("[[Get Up, Stand Up (Station )|Get Up, Stand Up]]")'' As the protests continued, Dixon appeared on television again, telling people that protesting was not the way to get their voices heard. ''("[[Say Her Name]]")'' On the first day of Crisis One, Dixon spoke to [[Sean Beckett]] and expressed his excitement over Crisis One, because it meant PD didn't have to respond to "mental health crap" anymore. ''("[[Can't Feel My Face]]")'' Emmett and Travis came over on Dixon's birthday to have dinner. While they were looking through old photos of Emmett, Dixon shifted the conversation to SFD, which he believed needed more conservativism. Travis challenged him, but they were cut off by Kitty and Emmett calling them for dinner. They ate in awkward silence until Kitty brought up Alicia and her desire to have grandchildren. This led to even more awkwardness, then Dixon talking about his plans to run for mayor and his plan to shut down Crisis One if he were elected. He and Travis argued about it while Kitty tried to get them all to eat cake and Emmett told Travis it wasn't worth it. During this argument, Dixon accused Travis of taking Emmett off his path and making him gay. ''("[[Alone in the Dark]]")'' Not long after his birthday, Dixon held a press conference during which he announced his candidacy for mayor. In his speech, he promised to clean up Seattle. That same day, he also visited the scene of a fire, where his friend, [[Mr. Phillips|Mr. Phillips']] building was in flames. When firefighters discovered that there were several women trapped inside the building and Mr. Phillips hadn't said anything about it, they rescued them. Dixon said that the women would have their opportunity to tell their story and so would Mr. Phillips, telling the firefighters not to jump to conclusions. Dixon then spoke privately to Mr. Phillips, assuring him they'd take care of it. ''("[[Death and the Maiden]]")'' He is married to [[Kitty Dixon]]. His son, Emmett, was a firefighter. ''("[[House Where Nobody Lives]]")'' He told Sullivan that Emmett is not a natural talent, but he's a hard worker. ''("[[Satellite of Love]]")'' After Emmett came out to him, he refused to speak to him, though he outed him publicly to push his own agenda at Sullivan's hearing. ''("[[We Are Family]]")'' [[Gary (Bad Guy)|Gary]] He is friends with Gary. When Gary started a new business, Dixon promised to take care of the permits. ''("[[Bad Guy]]")'' He was the fire chief for [[Seattle Fire Department]]. Prior to this, he was a police officer. His time as fire chief ended when he was arrested for fraud and extortion. ''("[[Louder Than a Bomb]]")'' After the charges against him were dropped, he accepted a position as Deputy Chief of Operations for the Seattle Metropolitan Police Department. ''("[[We Are Family]]")'' *Both [[Dean Miller]] and [[Eva Vasquez]] said he looks like a sex offender.[[Indoor Fireworks]], x (S) *He likes his steak well-done.[[Alone in the Dark]], x *He and his wife live at Garrett and nd.[[Dancing With Our Hands Tied]], x (S) {{GalleryLink}} {{Michael Dixon Appearances}} {{Scrollbox}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Dixon, Michael}} [[Category:Characters]] [[Category:S Characters]] [[Category:S S Characters]] [[Category:S S Characters]] [[Category:S S Characters]] [[Category:S S Characters]] [[Category:Police Officers]]

'''Michelle Alvarez''' is Andy's cousin.



Wanting to form a relationship with what family she had left, Andy met them at a park to have a barbecue. They updated her on their lives and their extended family's lives. They also told Andy that they'd mildly stalked her throughout her life, attending her fire academy graduation and salsa competitions. They hadn't kept in touch because the last time they saw each other, Michelle had told Andy about seeing her mom after Andy believed her mother was dead. Over the course of the day, the family caught up and expressed regrets for how things had gone. At the end of the day, they decided they needed to continue to meet up. ''("[[Wild World]]")''


When Carina set up a drive-through COVID testing site sponsored by the [[Catherine Fox Foundation]] at the station, Johnny, Sandra, and Michelle came, using it as an excuse to meet Robert, whom they hadn't met despite having regular meetings with Andy in the park. They chatted jovially with Robert while he did their swabs. ''("[[Save Yourself]]")''


Following the death of George Floyd, Michelle attended a protest at Seattle Center. ''("[[Comfortably Numb]]")''


When Andy got her own place following her divorce, Michelle planned to come over and hang out. Andy invited Vic to this celebration as well, as Theo had asked her to keep an eye on Vic. This celebration ended up being moved to [[Dean's Houseboat]], which had recently been sold, because Vic wanted to have one last time to say goodbye. They had dinner in the empty houseboat and Vic decided not to wait for the surgical abortion and instead to use the pill so it would be over sooner. ''("[[Searching for the Ghost]]")''



She has a girlfriend. ''("[[Wild World]]")''

She seems to have ended this relationship, as when she came to the station for COVID testing, she expressed interest in Maya and asked if she was still dating [[Carina DeLuca|the Italian]]. ''("[[Save Yourself]]")''


Her relationship with her parents is slightly strained by their refusal to accept her sexual orientation and her girlfriend.

She was very close to her cousin, Andy, when they were children, calling each other sister-cousins because they were so close. They were unable to be together for several years because Andy's mother left and Michelle and her parents were unwilling to lie to Andy about what happened. When they reunited as adults, they said it was as if no time had passed.


*She and her family have barbecues in the park every weekend.<ref>[[Wild World]], x (S)</ref>

'''Mila''' is the daughter of [[Elliot (The Dark Night)|Elliot]].


After the power went out in the building with her father, who was on life-support, Mila was left to do CPR on him while calling out for help. When station  arrived at the building to look for [[Penelope Hayes]], who was missing, she called out for their help and they found her and her father. They hooked up a generator to restore power to his machines and he quickly stabilized and then woke up, but asked why she didn't just let him die. She said he had terminal lung cancer and didn't want to die in a hospital, which is why he had all his machines set up at home. While talking to him, Ben suspected he might want a DNR and suggested it to him as an option, though Mila said he wasn't at that point yet and hadn't asked her to sign one as his power of attorney. Later, when they discovered a gas leak, they had to prepare him to be evacuated, which meant he'd have to be taken to the hospital, which he didn't want. The evacuation was then hastened when a resident lighting a cigarette sparked a fire. Elliot decided that since he didn't want to go to the hospital, he needed Mila to sign the DNR, which she did after he told her he wanted to die outside, watching the stars with her. They took Elliot outside and set out a blanket so he could lie on the ground with Mila. The firefighters also lay in the grass. When Elliot stopped responding, Ben checked on him and saw he had no pulse.



She was very close with her father. As he was an astronomer, they used to spend nights out in the backyard, looking up at the stars.


*While her father was in treatment for his cancer, he would make up scenarios for worse ways to die than the one that was killing him.
*She and her father lived in apartment .

'''Milo''' is a kid who accidentally shot Ryan in the chest.


Milo's mother, Ruby, was washing dishes at her house when she dropped a glass and cut herself on it trying to catch it. She started bleeding profusely and her cries drew the attention of Andy and Ryan, who were nearby. They tended to Ruby and when they learned she couldn't afford an ambulance ride, Ryan called Pruitt to take her to the hospital off the books. Ryan and Andy stayed behind to watch her two children for her. Ryan played good guys and bad guys with her Milo. Later, they were surprised when Milo found a gun in the apartment and pointed it at them as if they were still playing. He then fired the gun, which hit Ryan. ''("[[Indoor Fireworks]]")''

Milo was hurt and scared by the gun kicking back at him. He cried as Andy tended to Ryan. After the paramedics arrived, Andy went over to Milo and held him while they took Ryan away. ''("[[Eulogy]]")''



His mother is raising him and his sibling alone. Their father is not allowed within  yards of them and doesn't help support them.

'''Molly''' was a young worker who was trapped in a skyscraper that was on fire.


Molly was the fire evacuation captain for her office, on the th floor of the skyscraper. When Vic and Maya arrived to do crowd control on the floor, Molly updated them on what had happened and offered her help. She watched the stairwell to make sure no one tried to leave. When [[Pete Sorenson]] tried to leave, Molly stopped him despite him being her boss.

When the need to evacuate became urgent, Molly started to lead the first group down the vented stairs. However, when the fire went between the panes of glass on the windows and caused an explosion, they panicked and started to run down the stairs, trampling Molly. She lay in the stairway alone until she was found by Ben, who was dragging an injured Travis down the stairs. She had a collapsed lung and Travis told Ben to get her down to triage or she would die. ''("[[Not Your Hero]]")''

Ben continued to drag Molly down the stairs. When she suddenly stopped breathing, he had to use the needle from an Epipen to re-inflate her collapsed lung. He then carried her the rest of the way down so he wouldn't jostle the needle. Once he got outside, her mother ran up to the gurney she was on and Molly told her how happy she was to get to see her mom again. She was then put in the aid car and rushed to the hospital, where she was taken into surgery. Due to the severity of her crush injuries and the delay in treatment, she did not survive the surgery. ''("[[No Recovery]]")''



While she was trapped inside the building, her mother was outside in the front of the building texting Molly.


She worked at the Kaplan & Reed Law Offices. She made copies and got coffee.


*She could name every state capital.<ref>[[No Recovery]], x (S)</ref>

'''Mr. Phillips''' is the landlord of a building that caught on fire.


Mr. Phillips owned a building in which he operated a sweatshop, using the labor of twelve Thai women he held captive there. He took their passports and threatened them to keep them from trying to leave. When the building caught fire, he came to the scene. He was worried about his property being damaged, but omitted that there were people still trapped inside the building. When his security guard, [[Pablo]], told the firefighters about the women and the women were rescued, Mr. Phillips refused to admit to any wrongdoing. He then asked [[Michael Dixon]] what would happen and Dixon assured him they'd take care of it.



He and [[Michael Dixon]] are friends.


He is a landlord and property developer.

He has at least three children with [[Mrs. Warren]]: [[Ben Warren|Ben]], [[Rosalind Warren|Rosalind]], and another daughter.

'''Mrs. Monroe''' is the mother of [[Danny Monroe]].


Mrs. Monroe's son, Danny, and his friends, [[Ben Warren|Ben]] and [[Michael (Indoor Fireworks)|Michael]], decided to take Danny's father's car for a little joyride. They decided to drive the car quickly and stand in the backseat to get extra thrill. Danny's friends noticed he never let them drive and so never stood in the back himself, so Ben dared him to. However, when he did so, the car crashed and threw him out, causing a head injury that left him in an unconscious state. Ben visited him often, causing her to ask Ben how long he was going to sit there. She also told him never to do anything like this to his own mother. 



She is married to Danny's father.


Her son sustained a very serious head injury when he was a teenager.

'''Mrs. Warren''' is the late mother of [[Ben Warren|Ben]] and [[Rosalind Warren]].



Mrs. Warren married [[Mr. Warren]] and they had three kids together. When Ben was three years old, Ben called his mother into his room because he thought the Sandman was in his closet. That was the first time she saw his scared face. As a young boy, Ben told his mother he wanted to become the first Black President.


At some point, she got sick. She fought hard to stay alive for her children but ended up passing away at a relatively young age.


While anesthetised to undergo an orchiectomy, Ben had vivid dreams about the surgery. He was awake and envisioned himself being the surgeon with [[Joey Phillips]] assisting him, all the while another Ben functioned as the anesthesiologist. Since the surgical duo did not want to remove his testicle and opted to remove his gallbladder instead, Mrs. Warren appeared and told Ben he was being foolish due to being scared. She told him to listen to his momma and cut out the cancer, so he could stay alive for his boys and his wife, just like she had done. Ben then realized that George Floyd had called out this to mother because he knew he was going to die. Mrs. Warren told Ben she was there for him and his sister. They shared a hug. Mrs. Warren then instructed Surgeon Ben to hand over the scalpel to was brave enough to cut. Joey then stepped up to the table and started the procedure while Mrs. Warren talked to distract Ben. She said he wanted to become President to fix what others couldn't, something he could still do this very day. Mrs. Warren then held out a bassin for Joey to drop the cancerous testicle in. She showed it to Ben and told him that that was not what made him a man; it would only have made him a dead man. She then proudly told her son that he did it.



Mrs. Warren and her husband had three kids: Ben, Rosalind, and an unnamed daughter.


*She is the third parent to a main character to make their first appearance post-mortem, the first one being [[Gail Webber]] and the second one being [[Lucia DeLuca]].

'''Ms. Debbie''' is a woman whose adult daughter had a psychiatric episode and locked them both in a bedroom together.


Debbie was living in apartment with her daughter, Alysha, who was her caregiver as she has multiple sclerosis. When Alysha started having psychiatric symptoms, including hearing voices, Debbie was concerned, but hung up every time she called  before summoning help as previous police responses when neighbors called  had involved them assuming Alysha was using drugs when she wasn't. After they didn't leave the apartment for three days, their landlord, [[Luis]], called for a welfare check. Crisis One responded and Luis let them in the apartment, where Alysha had locked herself and her mother in the bedroom. They asked Debbie to open the door but she was unable to because of her condition. Alysha was tying the bedsheets together to make a sail so they could sail out the window.

Dean wanted to break the door in to get into the room, but Emmett cautioned against it as it would escalate the situation. Alysha believed someone was coming to hurt them and wanted to keep her mother safe. Emmett told Vic and Dean to validate her fears and concerns, as he was taught in his training. Vic began speaking to Alysha, following Emmett's advice to validate her. She asked Alysha to tell her about the people who were coming. Alysha said they were trying to hurt her and her mom. Emmett finally had the idea to use Debbie's medication as an excuse for Alysha to open the door. She did so reluctantly, and they forced their way into the room where Dean restrained her. They talked to her and tried to explain what they were doing. When she resisted restraint, her mother talked her into allowing them to sedate her instead. Once she was sedated, they carried her and her mother out. They put them into aid cars and explained that Alysha would be admitted for a -hour hold and would get the help she needed to stabilize her and start treatment. He also told her they had services available to help Debbie. Debbie thanked them for treating her and her daughter like human beings.



Her daughter, Alysha, is her primary caregiver.


*She and her daughter live in the Chatham Building.

'''Myles Anthony Trudeau''' is a young man who needed the help of Crisis One when his routine was disrupted.


Myles was riding the bus to his friend Trevor's house when he fell asleep on the bus. When the bus got to its last stop, the bus driver tried to wake him, but he panicked and ended up cutting himself on the back of a seat. The driver called the police, but Crisis One responded to the call. Jack boarded the bus and began talking to Myles, establishing what had happened. Myles explained his routine. Jack then had the idea to show Myles how to clean and bandage his own hand and then drove him to his friend's house, where he was meant to be having dinner.



He has a friend named Trevor whose mother makes enchiladas for them every Thursday.


He is a bagger at a grocery store. He works Mondays, Tuesdays, and Fridays. He once won the store contest for bagging the best and fastest.


*He attends a socialization club on Wednesdays.

'''Nancy''' is a woman who came to the station in labor.


Nancy and her husband, Wayne, were expecting a baby, so they went to the fire station to have a car seat installed. Ben installed it for them. A few days later, they went on a walk to relieve some cramping she was having. While they were walking, she went into labor, so they stopped at the station for help. Carina and Ben helped her inside the building and then out to the barn, but the aid car was still out, so they laid Nancy on the floor of the barn. Carina examined her and  determined that the baby was in a breech position. Despite this, Carina was able to coach her through labor. While she gave birth, Wayne collapsed due to cardiac arrest. While Ben tended to him, Carina kept Nancy focused on her labor. She gave birth soon afterward, then delivered the placenta. There was some bleeding, so Carina did fundal massage, which was successful in stopping the bleeding.

Ben, Andy, and Dean did CPR at the station and then loaded him in the ambulance. Ben stayed behind to help Carina with Nancy while Andy and Dean took Wayne to the hospital. At the hospital, a nurse told them there weren't any beds, forcing them to continue CPR in the aid car while they waited for a bed to become available. They finally got a pulse back just as a bed became available. Dean accompanied Wayne inside to the cath lab while Andy returned to the station. Later, Dean came back to the station and told Nancy that Wayne was stable as they loaded her into the aid car to take her to the hospital.



She is married to [[Wayne]].


*Her original birth plan was to have a home birth, but then her doula had a mental breakdown and had to move.

'''Nari Montgomery''' is the mother of [[Travis Montgomery]].



In , Nari's son, Travis, became engaged to [[Michael Cooper Williams|Michael]]. Nari and her husband were not pleased by this, as they were ashamed that their son was gay. His father wanted them to elope, believing a public wedding was putting them too much on display, but Travis disagreed. Nari agreed to read a poem she'd written at the wedding, but on the day of the wedding, neither she nor her husband showed up. She read the poem to them privately, but Travis said it wasn't enough and it was too late.


Years later, when there was a blizzard in Seattle, Nari called Travis at work and told him to eat some soup to stay warm. He quickly ended the call to deal with other problems at the station, but when she called back the next morning, he told her he could use some of that soup. ''("[[Ice Ice Baby]]")''


During the covid- pandemic, Travis delivered groceries and supplies to her house. ''("[[Nothing Seems the Same]]")''

Despite these deliveries, Nari decided to go to the grocery store, telling Travis that if Paul could golf, she could go shopping. She was unaware that he wasn't actually golfing, but meeting up with men for sex. She offered to box up some spicy tofu for him if he wanted to come get some. He later decided to do this. ''("[[Don't Look Back in Anger]]")''

After Paul told her his golfing buddy's wife had tested positive, Nari went with him to the drive-thru testing at the station. When Travis saw them, he had them park and come inside. After getting his mother settled in, he privately questioned his father about his real exposure, knowing it hadn't happened while golfing. Travis then tested both of his parents and sent them home. ''("[[Save Yourself]]")''

As she was leaving the grocery store one day, a maskless woman blamed her for the pandemic and spat on her. Nari then went out to her car and frantically cleaned herself with a wipe, then cried. ''("[[Get Up, Stand Up (Station )|Get Up, Stand Up]]")''


Nari and Paul came to station  on Thanksgiving to share their Thanksgiving meal. As they shared what they were thankful for while setting up the tables, Travis pushed Paul until he finally came out to Nari and confessed his affair. Nari left the room after hearing his confession.

When Travis followed her, she said she wished Travis hadn't pushed Paul because she enjoyed their life as it was. She then went to the kitchen where she insisted Jack let her help cook. While they were cooking, Nari smelled smoke and discovered that the turkey was on fire in the oven as someone had set the oven to clean instead of bake. Travis had to use the jaws of life to open the oven to Maya could put out the fire. Luckily, Station  brought over a whole meal including a turkey.


In light of Paul's actions, Nari decided to move out of their shared home. She told him over breakfast, though she admitted he didn't seem to believe she was serious, and began packing her things while he was gone. Travis came over while she was packing and they ended up talking about Nari's decision to side with her husband instead of defending Travis against him when he was a child. Nari ultimately apologized and admitted she was wrong for allowing Paul to treat Travis the way he had. ''("[[A House Is Not a Home]]")''



She has been married to [[Paul Montgomery]] for  years. When she learned he was gay and had been having an affair with another man, she packed her things and moved out. ''("[[A House Is Not a Home]]")''


She was ashamed that her son was gay. She ended up refusing to attend his wedding when he got married, but privately celebrated with him and Michael.

She is from Seoul, but her father was a diplomat, so she lived in many places. ''("[[In My Tree]]")''

'''Natalie Forrester''' is a woman who came into the ER after an apartment fire.


Natalie was evacuated from her apartment building when there was a fire. While waiting outside the building, she collapsed and was taken to the hospital. She coded in the ER, but they were able to resuscitate. When she regained consciousness, she was worried about her son, Max, who has anxiety and likes to know what's coming and what to expect. However, when he came in so she could talk to him, she coded again and had to be rushed into surgery. There was damage to her heart that indicated a recent heart attack that hadn't been treated, likely because she thought it was just heartburn. Maggie placed an LVAD to take the pressure off her heart, but because of the severe damage she saw, she told Natalie's husband, Evan, that it was unlikely that Natalie would ever wake up. Despite this, Evan persistently refused to tell Max that his mom was dying and instead lied to him that everything would be okay. When Evan went to Natalie's room to say goodbye to her, he left Max with Andrew because he didn't want Max to see his mom like that. Andrew took Max up to the roof to talk to him about how sometimes people don't know how to tell other people bad news. He worried Max, who thought it meant that his mom was dead already, and he took off and then left the hospital on his own. ''("[[Momma Knows Best]]")''

The police were called to track Max down and [[Ryan Tanner]] found him walking alongside the street by himself. He called out to Max, but Max started running and fell into a manhole down into the sewer, where he was swept away. [[SFD Station ]] was called to coordinate a rescue effort. Evan asked to come along and help. They almost had him at one drain pipe, but because of an oxygen tank malfunction, Maya wasn't able to get down the sewer in time. Andy jumped down impulsively, but she wasn't able to get a proper hold on Max and he was swept away again. The last place where they had a chance to catch up to him turned out to have a very small opening, too small for an adult, so they were forced to lower a loop down to Max so he could be pulled up on his own. However, Max refused to trust his father, who had told him to let go of where he was holding and grab the loop. Evan then confessed to Max that his mother was dying and apologized for not telling him before. Max then grabbed the loop and was lifted to safety. Evan then took Max to his mother's hospital room, where he lay with his mom to say goodbye. ''("[[Under the Surface]]")''



She is married to [[Evan Forrester]].


Her son, Max, has severe anxiety. When she was in the hospital, he ran away.


*She was  at the time of her hospitalization.

'''Natasha Ross''' is the Fire Chief for the [[Seattle Fire Department]].



Ross in the Marines. In , she was doing a tour of duty in Iraq, where she met and worked alongside [[Robert Sullivan]], a scout sniper. As they waited for their target to appear, they talked, getting to know each other to pass the time. While he dreamed of a simple life after his service, she said she wanted to stay in the military forever. As she said this, their target appeared. Ross ordered the shot, but Sullivan didn't take it because the target's children were present. His hesitation cost them the shot, which upset Ross. Later that night, they got another shot at it. In order to convince him to take the shot, Ross told Sullivan all the things she wanted to do after leaving the military, which she couldn't do until he took the shot. After some hesitation, he fired. After they were extracted, they shared a moment together in a tent and agreed to enjoy each other's company more. The two of them then started kissing. ''("[[Cold Blue Steel and Sweet Fire]]")''


Upon her arrive in Seattle to take on the job of fire chief, Ross learned that her predecessor, [[Fire Chief McCallister]], had left his desk so unorganized it took her days to sort all the paperwork out. Once that was done, she started visiting stations to meet the firefighters serving under her. On 
one such day, she visited station  and , introducing herself and meeting them. She then went with station  to a scene, where a car had gone over the side of a cliff. Andy Herrera tried to cede command to Ross, but she said she was just observing and told Andy to keep command. When the call was over, she returned to station  with the team, where she said she'd noted amongst everything else in the derelict paperwork a long-overdue promotion. Overriding Beckett, she then promoted Robert Sullivan to lieutenant of station . ''("[[Started from the Bottom]]")''


Ross came to the K fundraiser. After the event was over, she gave a speech about the clinic. Then she flirted with Sullivan while posing for pictures with him. ''("[[Searching for the Ghost]]")''


Ross came to station  on the day the clinic first opened. She posed for pictures with Jack and told him it needed to be a success at it was the first thing she approved as Chief. When she overheard Travis struggling to communicate with a patient, [[Jae-Jin Park]], who didn't speak English, she stepped in and asked him in Korean what was wrong, then translated his reply for Travis. She noted that he had edema in his legs like her father had when he had stage  cancer. While they tried to decide what to do next, Jae-Jin's son, [[Justin Park]], came in and explained to them that they knew he had cancer, but hadn't told him because it was inoperable and they wanted to enjoy the time they had left with him and take trips. They knew that if he knew he had cancer, he would hide away from them to avoid feeling like a burden. Ross and Travis watched as Justin led his father out of the station. ''("[[In My Tree]]")''


Andy approached Ross and told her that she wanted to be back at , because it was her home and her team. She talked about the problems that  had while she talked, which solved a problem for Ross, as she'd been trying to decide which station to close to balance the budget. ''("[[In My Tree]]")''

After a pep talk from Sullivan, Ross visited  on the next shift and told them the station was being closed. She also said they would receive their reassignments or severances within the week. The same day, she met with Maya and told her that she wouldn't be reinstating Maya as captain of , because the department relied on a chain of command to keep people safe and she had ignored a direct order from her superior. Maya tried to defend her decision and told Ross her demotion was more about her supporting her team's involvement in Black Lives Matter than that one call, but Ross shut it down and said it was a problem that she didn't understand that she'd done something wrong.

After Beckett refused his offers to help with his alcohol abuse, Sullivan went to Ross and told her that he had a drinking problem. She thanked him for letting her know. ''("[[Cold Blue Steel and Sweet Fire]]")''

Ross came to the closing of , where she told Andy she was doing everything she could to make sure Andy landed back at , though she couldn't make any promises. From there, she went to , where she told Beckett he'd have to submit to a test of his alcohol level because someone had accused him of drinking, possibly while on the job. She then informed the team that he would be out until further notice and Sullivan would act as captain in his absence. ''("[[Alone in the Dark]]")''


In the aftermath of Andy's arrest, Ross met with her. Since he had to stop by station , she said they could talk in the car on the way. Andy thought she would be receiving her re-assignment, but Ross told her she would be suspended in accordance with department policy to suspend any firefighter charged with a felony. On their way to the , a call came on the radio for a scene involving multiple stations, meaning Ross needed to make an appearance. At the scene, she told Andy she had to stay in the car because she was a civilian.

When she learned that the fire was in a sweatshop where twelve undocumented Thai women were being held hostage, she called an immigration lawyer she knew to meet the women at the hospital to help them get S-visas. Travis was frustrated by this, saying it wasn't enough, that not enough was in their purview. She told him either to put himself into a position where he could change things or stop talking about it. Otherwise, his ranting was pointless. When Sullivan tried to speak to her about Beckett, saying him being captain was a flaw in the symptom, she told him she didn't ask him and requested that he not speak to her about any firefighters. If he needed to report something, she told him to go through proper channels. ''("[[Death and the Maiden]]")''


In preparation for a meeting with the board, Ross came to the clinic and took some pictures. She also asked Maya, Carina, and Ben to go over the med station with her so she would be able to talk about the program appropriately. During this time, she was also brusque with Sullivan, brushing off his offer to help. ''("[[The Road You Didn't Take]]")''


Ross came to the scene as they were finishing a call involving radioactive material being spilled onto the street near a school bus full of children. While she was checking how the call had gone, Travis said he was going to run for mayor and asked for her support. She said she couldn't endorse him as fire chief, but she would personally. From the scene, she went to the station, where Ben and Bailey were having a party for Pru. Her presence aroused Maya's suspicion, as she knew that Ross and Ben weren't especially close. Maya later left the party to confront Ross and Sullivan, saying she knew they were sleeping together and saying if Ross didn't give her her job back, she was going to report them. When Jack abruptly quit, Ross gave Andy the open lieutenant position at . ''("[[Crawl Out Through the Fallout]]")''



During her time in the Marines, she was involved with [[Robert Sullivan]]. When she became the fire chief for Seattle Fire Department, they rekindled this relationship. ''("[[The Little Things You Do Together]]")''

The day the clinic opened, Sullivan asked Ross out on a date, but she declined, saying she wanted to lie low for a while so they didn't get discovered. ''("[[In My Tree]]")''

After telling Sullivan that he needed to start reporting things through proper channels instead of by texting or calling her, Ross came to Sullivan's place and the two of them had sex. ''("[[The Road You Didn't Take]]")''

The two of them continued hooking up after this and she came to Pru's party at the station, despite barely knowing Ben. This aroused suspicion from Maya, who confronted Ross and Sullivan at the party, saying she knew they were sleeping together and saying if she didn't get her job back, she would be reporting them. ''("[[Crawl Out Through the Fallout]]")''


Her mother is from Seoul. Her father died of cancer. ''("[[In My Tree]]")''


She is the fire chief at the [[Seattle Fire Department]]. Prior to this, she was deputy fire chief in San Diego for five years and battalion chief for ten years before that.


*She served in the Marine Corps.
*She speaks Korean.<ref>[[In My Tree]], x (S)</ref>
*She has protein shakes for breakfast.<ref>[[The Road You Didn't Take]], x (S)</ref>
*She has a neighbor named Mrs. Parker who spies on her.<ref>[[Crawl Out Through the Fallout]], x (S)</ref>

'''Nate''' is one of the motorcyclists who was hit by a drunk driver.


Nate, his wife, and some of their friends were out riding their motorcycles when a drunk truck driver swerved and hit them. Lisa was thrown off the bike into a tree while Nate was pinned underneath it. When station  arrived, they stepped in to work on Nate and the others. They quickly figured out that his wife was dead, but didn't tell him that. He told them he couldn't feel his arms or legs, which he believed to be due to shock. Later, Nate coded. Jack started chest compressions, but was forced to stop when Andy told him it wasn't doing any good as Nate was already gone.



He was married to Lisa for twenty years prior to them both dying. She did not enjoy riding motorcycles.


He and his friends liked to ride motorcycles together one weekend a month.

'''Neil''' was one of the passengers on the train with a bird flu outbreak.


Neil had just returned from Bashran when he boarded a subway train. The train stalled, injuring some of the passengers, including Neil. Maya and Jack responded to the call and started treating the patients. However, they quickly discovered that [[Will (Crazy Train)|Will]], a young passenger, had symptoms of avian flu. And Neil, who'd been on the same flight as Will, had them as well. They called in the CDC and announced the situation to the other passengers, who were worried. When Neil started to struggle to breathe and collapsed on the floor, Sarla, a passenger with a crush on him, helped treat him, using her past experience as a lifeguard. When the ambu bag she was using wasn't working to get air to his lungs, she abandoned in and gave breaths directly with her mouth. He started breathing again and shortly afterward, the CDC arrived and everyone was evacuated and decontaminated.



Every day, Neil rides the same subway train as [[Sarla]]. Despite her being attracted to him, she never made a move.

'''Nicole''' is Dean's ex-girlfriend and Maya's ex-girlfriend.



Nikki went on a date with Dean that was set up by their parents. She was late to the date because of a client, but once she arrived, she suggested to Dean that they just get it over with. The conversation flowed easily, but Nikki left abruptly after thanking him for making the date painless. However, after working a shift, Dean decided to give Nikki a call as he really liked her. ''("[[Friendly Fire]]")''


After Ripley's funeral, the firefighters went to the bar to have drinks and celebrate his life. However, Dean realized that he'd accidentally scheduled his date with Nikki during that same time, so the others were surprised when she showed up. ''("[[For Whom the Bell Tolls]]")''


After fighting the wildfire in California, Dean suggested that Jack and Maya come have brunch with him and Nikki. Nikki and Maya were both shocked to see each other as they had previously dated. ''("[[Into the Wildfire]]")''



[[Dean Miller]]
Her first date with Dean was set up by his mother and her father. ''("[[Friendly Fire]]")'' It is unclear why the relationship ended, only that according to Maya, Nicole leaves a trail of "broken hearts" around her.

[[Maya Bishop]]
She has a romantic history with Maya. The circumstances of the relationship and breakup are largely unknown. ''("[[Into the Wildfire]]")''


She's a graphic designer, which is disappointing to her parents.


*She has a law degree.<ref>[[Friendly Fire]], x (S)</ref>
*She went to Harvard for three years, where she graduated summa cum laude, broke the women's tennis record, and became unbeatable at Quarters.<ref>[[For Whom the Bell Tolls]], x (S)</ref>

'''Norton''' is a homeowner who attended a political event for the Northeast Seattle Homeowner's Association.


During a political event for the Northeast Seattle Homeowner's Association, Norton talked to [[Michael Dixon]], who promised him a seat on the school board. Shortly after that, a tornado alarm sounded and [[Travis Montgomery]] directed everyone to go inside to take shelter.

After the tornado passed, they went outside to find [[Hallie]] had landed nearby in her car. Travis examined her and asked Norton to bring whatever tools he had. Norton brought back his toolbox and first aid kit and promised Travis his vote.

'''Officer Roscoe''' is one of the officers who came to investigate Andy's assault.


When [[Carina DeLuca|Carina]] called the police to report that [[Andy Herrera|Andy]] had been assaulted, Roscoe and Williams came to the station to interview her. They asked her if she'd been drinking. She said she had, but the attack had sobered up. When Andy started to struggle with the details of the assault, she asked if she was allowed to have an advocate with her. When they said she was, she said she should have been told that at the start and asked Ben to be with her. When Ben there with her, Andy told them everything she remembered. When she finished, Roscoe and Williams tried to leave, but Ben stopped them, saying Andy had the right to have evidence collected from her body to assist in the case. When Andy agreed to the collection, Ben said they had to stay and wait for the kit to be completed so they could take it with them.


He is a police officer with the Seattle Metropolitan Police Department.

'''Oliver''' is the estranged husband of [[Audrey (Hot Box)|Audrey]].


Oliver found Audrey, his estranged wife, burning mementos of their life together, which upset him. They started to fight over it and walked away from the fireplace, which then sparked and started a fire on the carpet. Oliver then called the police because he believed Audrey was burning things that belonged to him. Audrey insisted that she hadn't and offered to show them, but when she went into the garage and tried to give the firefighters access, she ended up trapped inside with them while Oliver was outside. While they tried to free the trapped people, Oliver had a panic attack over Audrey being trapped and had to be given oxygen. After she was freed, he was relieved. He said he thought seeing all their stuff go up in flames was the perfect way to rip off the bandage. She showed him the one photo she was able to save from the garage.



He is married to [[Audrey (Hot Box)|Audrey]], but they were separated. They got married in March .
