'''Pablo''' is a security guard who was rescued from a building that was on fire.


Pablo was working security at a building owned by [[Mr. Phillips]] when it caught fire. He was rescued by firefighters, who asked if there was anyone else in the building.t He tried to tell them something, bu Mr. Phillips, the owner of the building, approached, so Table didn't finish what he was saying. When the firefighters noticed this, they sent Mr. Phillips away and asked Pablo again. He told them there was a hidden room on the second floor with people inside. He guided them on how to find it and with his help, they rescued twelve Thai women Mr. Phillips had trafficked to the US and was holding captive.


He worked security in a building owned by [[Mr. Phillips]].

'''Pam''' is the sister of [[Rodney]] and daughter of Mike.


Pam came into the ER after her father, Mike, was seriously injured and her brother, [[Rodney]], was burned when a propane taken exploded while Rodney's fianc\ue, [[Jim]], was cooking. She was upset with Jim, saying he almost killed their father.

When they were told Mike was taken to ICU while he waited to recover enough to have a second surgery, Pam pressured Rodney, who sent Jim home, saying all he could think when he looked at Jim was that Jim killed his dad. However, when they were later told that Mike would be okay, Rodney called Jim.



When her father was injured, she pressured her brother, Rodney, to break things off with his fianc\ue, Jim.

'''Parker Lowther''' is a member of the Fire Commission, the panel which decided Sullivan's fate.


Parker was one of the members of the fire commission who were interviewing witnesses in order to determine if Robert Sullivan would be allowed to remain a firefighter. He first interviewed, [[Emmett Dixon]], who revealed that Ben Warren knew about Sullivan's overdose for a while before he reported the missing drugs from the PRT. Next, Richard Webber spoke about Sullivan's sobriety and recovery.

After that, Michael Dixon came in and testified. He claimed that he was conducting an internal investigation, which is why he didn't report their actions immediately. He insinuated that it may have been going on much longer than it actually was. He also implied that drug use may have factored into Sullivan's decision-making at multiple incidents, including the one where Pruitt Herrera died. He also invoked his son's homosexuality and suggested that Sullivan used that as leverage to keep him quiet.

Ben testified next, explaining his decision to sign off on a false inventory under pressure from Sullivan. They asked why the PRT should be allowed to go back out on the street when this happened. Ben said it would probably happen again because of the system being set up to create narcotic dependency. The commission decided to shut down the PRT immediately before the hearing was even concluded.

Finally, Sullivan himself spoke and apologized for what he'd done. While he was speaking, the other members of station  came in and each of them gave a statement on his behalf, despite him saying he didn't want them to speak. Ultimately, the commission decided he could remain a firefighter, but they stripped him off his rank.


He works for the Fire Commission of Seattle.

'''Parker Sylvana Sherwood''' is the daughter of [[Hannah Sherwood]].


Parker's mom, Hannah, was doing dishes when her wedding ring fell down into the disposal. She impulsively reached for it and got her hand stuck in the garbage disposal. She called for help and Ben, Travis, and Dean responded to the call. Parker showed them the way to where Hannah was stuck and then tried to leave, appearing indifferent to her mother's problem. Travis, who had the most experience with the situation, began taking the disposal apart from below while Dean and Ben talked to her and gave her pain medication. Her daughter watched them work and continued to look disinterested in her mother's condition. When Hannah noticed the tattoo on Parker's arm, she nearly pulled her hand out, but they stopped her. Once Travis finished taking apart the disposal, Hannah was able to remove her hand. Then they bandaged her up and told her to follow up with the hospital. Despite her detached attitude during the ordeal, Parker hugged her mom.



She likes a boy named Billy and had his name tattooed on her forearm.


One of her moms is in the Army and is deployed. Since she missed her mom, she took it out on her other mom.


*She and her family live at  Cedar Drive.

'''Pat Aquino''' was the captain of [[SFD Station ]] until its closure.



Pat led his team as they worked at the Phoenix Fair, handing out water and providing a cooling shelter to make sure no one got overheated. When [[Will]], a fairgoer who was high on mushrooms, stole station 's engine and caused it to be tipped on its side, blocking an intersection, Pat sent two of his firefighters, Theo and Andy, to help them free Will. Later, when the engine caught fire, he and his team worked to put it out. He also consoled Andy, as he knew the engine was important to her, as it was dedicated in memory of her father. ''("[[Phoenix from the Flame]]")''


Pat led his team to a house with a fire in the basement when they were called to back up station . When they arrived, they learned they were going to do a surrounded and drown to prevent anyone else from entering the house, as five firefighters had already passed out after going inside. ''("[[Can't Feel My Face]]")''


On the day station  received their new engine, Aquino approved Andy and Theo going there to participate in the push-in. Later, he oversaw a call where  and  responded to a multi-car accident. He called Andy to go take a break and cool off and then called her back in a few minutes later. ''("[[Too Darn Hot]]")''


In order to expand Crisis One to the entire SFD, Dean arranged for Diane to train them all in conflict resolution and how to deal with a variety of scenarios they might see. For the first scenario, she asked Andy and Sullivan to play a married couple with a domestic dispute. She was unaware they were separated. She played the responder in the scenario. When Sullivan had to leave to respond to a call, Theo took his place and the scenario continued. Vic swapped in as the responder, but this ended with her and Theo flirting. Dean suggested he pick the pairings to avoid interpersonal relationships, which Diane agreed to. Next, he had Jack and Maddox play co-workers, the latter of whom had locked himself in the conference room. Dean played the responder. When Maddox got very hammy, Dean accused him of not taking it seriously, so Diane called for them to take a break. For another scenario, Aquino was having a crisis and Ben played the responder and was able to talk him through it. They continued their training and at the end of the day, Diane felt they were prepared to work with the program. ''("[[% or Nothing]]")''


A gas main exploded about half a mile from station . After some time at the scene, station  called for backup and station  was sent to help them. After [[Fire Chief McCallister]] joined the scene, command of the scene was shifted to him and Aquino and Beckett began assisting with evacuations. While checking a house, Aquino was blown back when he opened the door to a house full of gas, as Beckett had been unable to warn him in time. He had a penetrating wound to his abdomen, but he was conscious after the explosion. He was loaded onto a gurney and into an aid car. ''("[[Things We Lost in the Fire (Station )|Things We Lost in the Fire]]")''

At the hospital, he was taken to surgery after x-rays revealed an open-book pelvic fracture along with the penetrating abdominal wound and facial burns. After surgery, Link said he'd need a few months of physical therapy, but he'd be okay. ''("[[Bottle Up and Explode!]]")''

While he was recovering, Andy served as acting captain of . After Christmas, he was home and working on physical therapy. ''("[[Started from the Bottom]]")''


With his recovery progressing faster than they expected, Aquino came to the station for a visit and said he'd be returning to work in about six weeks. ''("[[In My Tree]]")''

Before he could return to work, Ross decided to close station  to help balance the budget. Aquino came to take pictures with the team one last time and then was presented with the flag. While the rest of the team went out for drinks, he went home to his wife. ''("[[Alone in the Dark]]")''



He is married. ''("[[Phoenix from the Flame]]")''


He has a friendly rivalry with [[Sean Beckett|Captain Sean Beckett]]. ''("[[% or Nothing]]")''


He is the fire captain of [[SFD Station ]] of the [[Seattle Fire Department]].


*He wears a black wedding ring.<ref>[[Phoenix from the Flame]], x (S)</ref>
*He loses to [[Sean Beckett]] at Football Squares every year.<ref>[[% or Nothing]], x (S)</ref>
*He is Filipino.<ref>[[Things We Lost in the Fire (Station )|Things We Lost in the Fire]], x (S)</ref>

'''Paul''' is a father who had to be rescued from a corn maze when it was caught on fire.


Paul was at the Halloween carnival with his wife, [[Lisa (Demons)|Lisa]], and his son, [[Aiden]]. His son was scared to go into the haunted corn maze, but Paul talked him into it. While they were in the maze, some people nearby fighting with torches sent a spark into the corn maze, igniting it. Paul tried to get himself and Aiden out, despite having burns on his legs, but ended up going in the wrong direction. [[Maya Bishop|Maya]] had climbed the Ferris wheel and saw them, so she climbed down and entered the maze to find them. She tried to get them out herself, but wasn't able to lift Paul to get him out. Paul begged Maya to leave him and get Aiden out, but she refused to leave him. She had them cover their mouths, then put her jacket over them and used the fire extinguisher she had brought in to push back the flames until it ran out, leaving them trapped. Finally, [[Theo Ruiz|Theo]] found them and helped Maya carry Paul to safety while Aiden walked out ahead of them. Paul was then put on a gurney to be treated.



He is married to [[Lisa (Demons)|Lisa]].


He says his son is his favorite person in the whole world.


*He dressed as a mailbox and his son was the letter carrier.
*According to his wife, he has a bad sense of direction.

'''Paul Montgomery''' is the father of [[Travis Montgomery]].



In , Paul's son, Travis, became engaged to [[Michael Cooper Williams|Michael]]. He and his wife were not pleased by this, as they were ashamed that their son was gay. Paul wanted them to elope, believing a public wedding was putting them too much on display, but Travis disagreed. Nari agreed to read a poem she'd written at the wedding, but on the day of the wedding, neither she nor her husband showed up. She read the poem to them privately, but Travis said it wasn't enough and it was too late. ''("[[Ice Ice Baby]]")''


During the covid- pandemic, Travis delivered groceries and supplies to his parents' house. During this time, Travis was also shocked to find his father on a dating app for men. His profile picture showed Paul wearing nothing but chinos and a belt that Travis had gifted him, captioned with the phrase "Let me be your daddy." ''("[[Nothing Seems the Same]]")''

Despite the pandemic, Paul kept finding men to hook up with. He would tell his wife he was golfing when he was meeting them. His son, realizing what he was doing, confronted him, saying he knew about his profile. Paul denied it and Travis let it go, saying he was too tired to have the conversation. ''("[[Don't Look Back in Anger]]")''

Later, Paul came to the station to drop off a tin of cookies Nari had made for Travis. He also asked Travis to come over and help them install security on their computer as someone had hacked his Facebook and stolen his picture and he worried where it would end up. Travis knew he was lying to try to save face, but he had to leave on a call, so he simply gave the cookies back to Paul and said maybe they'd help him wash down the shame. ''("[[Learning to Fly]]")''

When the wife of man Paul was sleeping with, whom he claimed to Nari was his golfing buddy, tested positive for COVID, Paul and Nari came to the station to get tested for COVID during the COVID testing event. When Travis learned what had happened, he had them come inside, where he questioned his father about his exposure. His father still refused to admit what had really happened. After they were tested, Travis went to see them to their car. After his mom got in, he spoke to his dad about how it made him feel to be rejected when he came out and how much it would have helped him to have his father validate how he was feeling instead of rejecting him. ''("[[Save Yourself]]")''


Paul and Nari came to station  for Thanksgiving. Throughout the day, Paul received several messages Travis knew to be from Kyle. Travis deduced that he was planning to meet up with Kyle at some point during the day. While sharing what they were thankful for, Travis made several pointed comments to Paul, leading to him coming out and confessing his affair to Nari, who left the room.

Later, Paul admitted to Travis that he felt free because Nari knew. But he decided not to leave to meet up with Kyle because he loves Nari and wanted to show her that. As they ate dinner, Travis told Paul he knew the pain he was feeling and assured him it would get better. ''("[[Little Girl Blue]]")''


Paul came home one day to find that Nari had packed her things and was moving out. The two of them hugged. ''("[[A House Is Not a Home]]")''



[[Nari Montgomery]]
He has been married to [[Nari Montgomery]] for  years. He is secretly attracted to men and uses a gay dating app.

Months after falling in love with a man, he remained married to Nari. ''("[[Can't Feel My Face]]")''

Kyle
During the pandemic, Paul began hooking up with men under the guise of playing golf. When Travis asked him about it after he was exposed to COVID through this, he said it was one consistent man. ''("[[Save Yourself]]")''

Paul later told Travis that he was in love with that man, the first time he'd ever truly been in love in his life. ''("[[Forever and Ever, Amen]]")''

A year later, the affair continued. Paul went on a trip to San Diego with Kyle. As a cover, he told Nari he was going to a conference. ''("[[% or Nothing]]")''


Repressing his own sexuality led him to disapprove of Travis coming out as gay. He told Travis he was ashamed of him and refused to attend Travis and Michael's wedding.


*He was  years old when he first said he was in love.<ref>[[Forever and Ever, Amen]], x</ref>
*[[Travis Montgomery|Travis]] found out he was gay initially through a dating app for men to meet other men.<ref>[[Nothing Seems the Same]], x (S)</ref>

'''Peggy Knox''' is a woman who came into the hospital in advanced labor.



Peggy had planned to have a home water birth, but she panicked during labor and came to the hospital. Despite the hack, she was in such advanced labor that the hospital had to take her in. She wanted painkillers, but because of the hack, they didn't have access to any of that, so Carina suggested that her partner, Dayna, initiate orgasm to relieve some of her pain. After that suggestion, Peggy refused to listen to her and when the power went out for a minute, Peggy decided to try to leave. However, Arizona examined her and determined the baby was already crowning, so Arizona coached her through pushing and her baby was born. ''("[[Out of Nowhere]]")''


Dayna had an inconclusive mammogram and was referred to [[Scott Hanson]] for a second opinion. He diagnosed her with stage II breast cancer and started her on chemotherapy. He also promised her she'd get through it. After her second round, she projectile vomited in the car, causing her wife to serve and hit a tree. She was taken to the ER, where they did a CT scan that didn't show any evidence of cancer, raising suspicion. After scheduling a fake appointment where she, too, was diagnosed with cancer, Arizona, along with Owen, decided they needed to stop Hanson. While Owen confronted him and called the police, Arizona showed Dayna and Peggy Dayna's real scans and told her she didn't actually have cancer, which they both celebrated. ''("[[Hold Back the River]]")''


To express their gratitude, Peggy and Dayna gave Arizona some cookies. They later paged her because they realized they had used peanut butter with marijuana left over from Dayna's chemotherapy. ''("[[Judgment Day]]")''


Peggy, Dayna, and Rose were out for a walk when Rose started fussing because she didn't want to be in the stroller, so Peggy took her out, but she refused to walk, so Dayna had to carry her. While they were walking, Dayna tripped when Peggy tried to blow Rose's nose, but couldn't break her fall because she was holding Rose, so Peggy reached out to cradle Rose's head so it wouldn't hit the ground, leading to Dayna injuring her face and Peggy her hand. They walked to station , where Carina recognized them, as she'd delivered their daughter. Thanks to the supplies that had arrived for the clinic, Carina and Ben were able to treat them at the station. Because of the location of their injuries, Ben suspected that Peggy had hit Dayna, but this was quickly put to rest when they independently gave the same story of what had happened. After they were treated, they had to fill out of a lot of paperwork, but they were grateful to avoid the ER. Before they left, Carina shared that she and Maya were looking at their options and asked if they'd used anonymous donor. They shared that they had and said there were pros and cons of using an anonymous versus a known donor. ''("[[Searching for the Ghost]]")''


Peggy and Dayna volunteered to help at the Dean Miller Memorial Clinic. They sat at the registration desk to check patients in. They recognized Jack as a former employee of the station, but decided not to pry about that. They gave him his paperwork. Next, they checked in [[Brooke]], who said it stung when she peed. Peggy said she had been there and slipped a pamphlet about STIs on top of Brooke's paperwork. They later led Brooke to a room and share their experience getting chlamydia in college until Carina interrupted them and politely sent them to sort inventory instead. When Brooke got her results, they eavesdropped and celebrated when her tests were negative. ''("[[Pick Up The Pieces]]")''



She is married to [[Dayna Rutledge]]. They've been married for seven years. ''("[[Searching for the Ghost]]")''


She and Dayna have a daughter together named Rose. She was conceived using sperm from an anonymous donor. ''("[[Searching for the Ghost]]")''


She and her wife are friends with [[Carina DeLuca]]. ''("[[Pick Up The Pieces]]")''

'''Penelope''' is a bridal shop owner.


Penelope was overseeing [[Shauna|Shauna's]] search for her wedding dress when Shauna passed out. When help arrived, they learned there was a carbon monoxide leak in the store, so they told Penelope to open all the windows and evacuate until the gas company cleared the building. However, she ignored this instruction and when there was later an explosion in the shop, she was injured. Andy and Jack entered the shop and put out the fire. Then they followed the sound of Penelope coughing to find her and carry her out. They then resuscitated her with some difficulty.


She owns and operates a bridal shop,  named Penny's Bridal Shop.

'''Penelope Hayes''' is a girl with asthma who went missing during a power outage.


Penny was playing hide and seek with her brother, Xander, when she went missing. After looking for her for over an hour, Xander called the police because the power went out. Since she had asthma, she was considered at high risk. Station  responded to the call and formed teams to look for her. Xander said she liked to hide basically everywhere in the building, meaning she could have been anywhere. After a long search, Andy, Kat, and Jenna found Penny trapped in a washer in the basement. Andy wasn't able to get the washer open, so she called for backup. However, they had discovered a gas leak in the building and were evacuating. Sullivan came to the basement to help Andy and they sent everyone else out. They were able to free Penny and brought her out of the building, where she was resuscitated with difficulty before being sent to the hospital.



Penny went missing while her brother was babysitting her for the first time ever. After she was found and resuscitated, she said they'd never let him babysit again.


*She was six years old at the time of her disappearance.
*Her asthma is set off by being scared.
*She's about  feet tall and  pounds.

'''Penelope Tillerman''' is the daughter of [[Terrence Tillerman]].


Penelope and her family were headed to their grandma's for a Christmas celebration. On the way, they put in a last-minute grocery order, but accidentally put in their home address for delivery. Not wanting them to go without their eggnog, Terrence drove back to the house to retrieve it, but ended up pinned between his car and another that was parked in the driveway.

As firefighters freed him and moved him into the PRT for treatment, Penelope and her siblings arrived and embraced their mother. Maya then told them the sirens on the PRT meant that Terrence was alive as he was transported to the hospital. At the hospital, Terrence was taken into surgery and aftward, the whole family was in his room singing Christmas carols.



She lives with her parents and two siblings. Their grandma lives on the other side of town.


*She and her family live at  Christopher Court.

'''Pete Sorenson''' is an employee of Kaplan & Reed Law Offices who tried to leave against instructions.


When the skyscraper his office is located in caught fire, Pete tried to leave through the stairs despite being told not to. He tried to convince them to let him go, that it'd be better than staying in a burning building, but one of his employees, [[Molly]], told him he needed to stay put because he'd die before he got to the bottom floor if he tried to leave.


He works at Kaplan & Reed Law Offices.

'''Petra Lau''' is [[JJ Lau|JJ's]] mother and [[Pruitt Arike Miller|Pru's]] grandmother.


Petra and her husband, Henry, flew from Hong Kong to Seattle to meet their granddaughter, Pru, and her father, Dean. Upon their arrival in Seattle, they pledged their support for Dean suing over his wrongful arrest, which they'd seen on video. They also pledged their support for Pru. They had looked up Dean and his parents to know who Pru had in her corner and arranged to meet Dean's parents at his houseboat to get to know each other. After the dinner, they expressed desire to continue to visit Pru and get to know her.



She is married to [[Henry Lau]].


She and her husband were both dismayed at how their daughter turned out, including her leaving her daughter shortly after birth. Despite this, they had a strong desire to be in Pru's life and help support her.


She and her husband are the owners of Lau Central Pacific Holdings, a private equity firm.

'''Phillip''' is the husband of [[Lanie]].


Phillip's wife, Lanie, had a heart condition that was inherited by her son. Arizona did fetal surgery on him to fix his heart and then monitored the pregnancy and delivery. She had a difficult and painful labor, but gave birth to a healthy son after only three pushes.



He is married to [[Lanie]].


His son had fetal surgery to correct his heart defect and was later born healthy. They named him Gryffin after Gryffindor.


*His son weighed five pounds and fourteen ounces at birth.

'''Phillip Dang''' is the Immigration officer who interviewed [[Carina DeLuca]] for her green card.


Dang called Carina back into his office to interview her about her marriage and life in Seattle in order to establish if she would or would not get a green card, allowing her to stay and work in the US indefinitely. When the interview first started, Maya tried answering some questions, but he said he needed Carina to answer. He asked about how they met and why they only decided to get married when her visa was expiring. He also asked about Maya's job and her demotion, which she attributed to sexism and possible homophobia. After many hours of questions, Maya became frustrated and became giving sarcastic questions over Carina's objections. Carina insisted that Maya was kidding and gave her real answers. Finally, Dang congratulated Carina and said she had a green card.



He is married. He said that Maya and Carina's bickering reminded him of himself and his wife.


He is an immigration officer for the United States Citizenship and Immigration Services.

'''Piper''' is a woman who was caught in a sinkhole.


Piper's best friend, [[Finley]], told her she'd gotten a job in New York and was thinking about taking it. Finley believed Piper wasn't supportive because she wasn't excited. Piper was really worried because she was in love with Finley and hadn't told her. She later went to go back to Finley's home to tell her, but fell into a pothole while crossing the street and became stuck. The firefighters arrived and blocked traffic while they figured out how to free her. Her leg was trapped and scratched, so they began to ship away at the concrete around her leg. While they were working, Finley came to the scene, worried about Piper. Piper confessed her love and the two shared a kiss. Then Piper said her leg was starting to feel tight, so they quickly pulled her out and put her in an ambulance.



She had a crush on her best friend, Finley. When Finley told her she was considering a move to New York, Piper decided to confess her feelings. This was temporarily stalled when she fell into a pothole, but when Finley came, she confessed her feelings and the two shared a kiss.


*She used to live near Finley. After she moved, she still came back every morning for coffee and a walk with Finley.

'''Principal Linsley''' is the principal of the Stratford Middle School, which had a false fire alarm.


Principal Linsley greeted the firefighters when they arrived at the middle school where she's the principal. She was certain it was a false alarm and wanted to help them get the kids back into the classrooms as quickly as possible. They quickly confirmed that someone had pulled the alarm.

Inside the school, her daughter, Ava, was in labor, which is why her friend, Tuck, had pulled the alarm. She labored and gave birth with Ben and Vic's help. After the baby was born, Linsley came in. Her daughter asked her not to be mad, but she just was glad that Ava was okay.



Her daughter, Ava, feels that her mother pays attention to every kid at school except her. Her mother didn't notice that she was pregnant and didn't find out until she'd given birth.


She is the principal of the Stratford Middle School.

'''Pruitt Arike Miller''' is the daughter of [[Dean Miller]] and [[JJ Lau]]. After Dean's death, she was adopted by [[Ben Warren]] and [[Miranda Bailey]].



Around eight months after one final hookup before committing to a time of celibacy, JJ came to Dean and told him she was pregnant. ''("[[House Where Nobody Lives]]")''

JJ spent the final weeks of the pregnancy at Dean's houseboat. ''("[[Into the Woods]]")''

During a serious blizzard, JJ was at the station with Dean when she went into labor. Maya called Carina, who advised over the phone how to handle the labor, since they were unable to get to the hospital for the delivery. JJ was upset with this, saying she wanted an epidural to handle the pain. Maya told her that Carina had suggested masturbating in order to progress the labor and help with the pain and JJ did so happily. Not long after that, labor progressed and she gave birth. ''("[[Ice Ice Baby]]")''

When she was less than a week old, she still didn't have a name. Dean and JJ learned they had different ideas of how to parent. After a few days, JJ packed her things and left the baby with Dean, saying she'd never intended to stay and just wanted to give Dean the chance to keep her if he wanted. She told Dean to give her a good name and a good life before leaving. ''("[[Satellite of Love]]")''

With JJ gone, Dean struggled to take care of the baby. When Pruitt came over to help, he tried to reassure Dean that he would be okay, but quickly discovered that Dean wasn't sure he was going to keep her. After they spent the day talking, with Pruitt helping with the baby, Dean decided to keep her and named her Pruitt Arike Miller, after Pruitt. Soon after, Vic also moved in and agreed to take shifts with Dean to care for Pru. ''("[[Born to Run]]")''

During the Covid- pandemic, her aunt Yemi started living with her and took care of her. ''("[[Wild World]]")''


After her father died, Andy, who had been staying with them, brought her to the hospital to go with Ben and Bailey, since Ben had agreed to take her if anything happened to Dean. ''("[[Bottle Up and Explode!]]")''


On Thanksgiving, Ben brought Pru to the station for the station's meal. When he had to go out on a call, he left her with Maya, who struggled as she hadn't spent much time with children. While Maya was watching her, Pru said she needed to potty, so Maya picked her up to take her, but Pru pooped in her diaper before they got anywhere. Carina then came in and took Pru from Maya and changed her diaper and her socks. Pru then spent some time coloring in the barn while the tables were being set up. When her grandfather arrived to take her, Bailey talked him into staying for dinner. He did so, but as soon as dinner was over, he took Pru with him, calling her Arike, which he said was her true name. ''("[[Little Girl Blue]]")''


Pru remained with her dad's parents while Ben and Bailey explored their legal avenues. Dean's parents remained insistent that she would be living with them. However, one night, when Pru woke up crying for Bailey, they called her and had her help get Pru to sleep. ''("[[A House Is Not a Home]]")''


About a week before Christmas, Ifeya allowed Bailey to take Pru to the station for a visit. ''("[[All I Want for Christmas is You]]")''

Anna, Pru's nanny, later dropped her off for a visit with Ben and Bailey on the same day they were meeting with Ifeya and Bill to discuss their custody arrangement. She said they'd been held up at a medical appointment and asked her to drop Pru off. When the Millers arrived, they told Ben and Bailey they'd decided to let her live with them, with caveats. They eventually worked things out. ''("[[Cold Blue Steel and Sweet Fire]]")''


After Bailey took a few vacation days, she returned to work with Pru, but then had to put Pru in daycare when she discovered several surgeries had had to be cancelled or postponed. ''("[[I'll Cover You]]")''


Ben and Bailey threw a party for Pru at the station. At the party, Ben gave a speech about how being a dad, especially to Pru, had helped him learn to stop taking so many risks at work. ''("[[Crawl Out Through the Fallout]]")''


In the wake of the surgical residency program being shut down, Pru helped Bailey erase surgeries off the surgical board. Then Bailey quit and she and Pru went home to bake cookies. ''("[[You Are the Blood]]")''


Bailey took Pru to the park to have a play date with [[Luna Ashton|Luna]]. ''("[[Wasn't Expecting That]]")''


Joey brought Pru to the station for the Halloween open house. She was originally supposed to come as a firefighter, but changed her mind and came as Megan Rapinoe instead. At the party, she saw and hugged Jack. ''("[[Demons]]")'' From there, she went to the hospital to trick or treat there, despite already being tired. Bailey changed her into an Ewok costume and took her around. Afterward, she fell asleep in her stroller as Bailey packed up to go home. ''("[[Haunted]]")''



When she was less than a week old, her mother left her with her father, saying she couldn't be a good mom. She told Dean to have their daughter look her up when she was a teenager if she wanted. ''("[[Satellite of Love]]")''


*During her pregnancy, her mother craved strawberry ice cream.<ref>[[House Where Nobody Lives]], x (S)</ref>
*She was named after [[Pruitt Herrera]].<ref>[[Born to Run]], x (S)</ref>
*Arike comes from the Yoruba origin and it means "The cherished one".<ref>[[Something About What Happens When We Talk]], x (S)</ref>
*She can't eat orange foods after dark or she vomits all night.<ref>[[Wild World]], x (S)</ref>
*Her grandmother sometimes watches her while her father works.<ref>[[Can't Feel My Face]], x (S)</ref>
*She went to Sunny Friends Daycare.<ref>[[Things We Lost in the Fire (Station )|Things We Lost in the Fire]], x (S)</ref>
*When she's with the Millers, [[Anna (Season )|Anna]] is her part-time nanny.<ref>[[The Little Things You Do Together]], x (S)</ref>

[[SFD Station ]] |first appearance = '''[[Station |S]]:''' [[Stuck]] |last appearance='''[[Station |S]]:''' [[Wild World]] |only appearance = '''[[Grey's Anatomy|GA]]:''' [[Let's All Go to the Bar]] |count = |seasons = *'''[[Station |S]]:''' [[Season (Station )|]], [[Season (Station )|]], [[Season (Station )|]], and [[Season (Station )|]] *'''[[Grey's Anatomy|GA]]:''' [[Season (Grey's Anatomy)|]] |portrayed by = [[Miguel Sandoval]] }} {{Quote|Sometimes I wonder if I did my daughter a disservice. Maybe I should have pushed her to do things outside the station growing up. I wonder about that sometimes. But, as a kid, she never wanted to spend time anyplace else. She always knew that this is what she wanted, and there was no talking her out of it, ever. There wasn't much talking her out of anything, actually.|Pruitt Herrera}} '''Pruitt Herrera''' was the former Captain of [[SFD Station |Station ]] of the [[Seattle Fire Department]] and the father of [[Andy Herrera]]. There was a windstorm in , during which Pruitt boarded up the Tanners' windows.[[Weather the Storm]], x (S) After the / terrorist attack, Pruitt went to New York to help out. He only came home when Andy flew to New York and demanded that he come home.[[Stuck]], x (S) Pruitt responded to the scene when [[Claire Sullivan]] was involved in a car accident. He was upset with [[Lucas Ripley|Ripley]] and [[Robert Sullivan|Sullivan]] for not arriving promptly when their station was the first called out.[[Do a Little Harm...]], x (S) Ben joined the station as the newest recruit, while his wife still wasn't on board with his decision. During a training exercise, Ben ran off after finding out that Bailey had had a heart attack. He then called Pruitt to let him know he was quitting his job in order not to cause Bailey more stress. However, Bailey talked to him about doing what makes you happy and convinced him to call his boss back and reverse the decision.[[(Don't Fear) the Reaper]], x [[Tiffany (Stuck)|Tiffany's]] house caught on fire when her laptop cord sparked on her bed while she was in the bathroom. Pruitt's team responded to the fire. He sent Maya and Andy in to do search and rescue while Dean, Jack, and Travis put out the fire. Maya and Andy quickly found Tiffany and brought her outside, where she said Charlie was still inside. With the fire extinguished, they searched for Charlie and quickly found a puppy. Dean carried Charlie out and handed him over to a grateful Tiffany.[[Stuck]], x (S) While fighting an apartment fire, Jack and Pruitt got separated when Jack entered a kid's room to look for a child. When he came back out, he couldn't find Pruitt because of the smoke. He had to tell Andy he couldn't find her dad and she and Maya came to help look for him. They found him on the floor, unconscious and pulseless. They tried to take him out, but they noticed the fire was choking, so they couldn't go out of the apartment. Once Andy got a pulse on her father, they strapped him to Jack and the four of them jumped out the window onto landing pads. Pruitt was then taken to [[Grey Sloan Memorial Hospital]], where he had surgery and then was diagnosed with mesothelioma. He knew he had to step down as Captain immediately. He said Jack could be in charge until they filled the job. When Andy protested that, he promoted her to lieutenant and said they could share the responsibilities until a new captain was officially chosen.[[Stuck]], x (S) Once Pruitt was released from the hospital, Ryan came to pick him up after seeing that Andy was busy with a call. He tried to take Pruitt home, but Pruitt insisted on going to the station instead, where he congratulated the team on a successful rescue and making the news.[[Invisible to Me]], x (S) From there, Ryan took him home, where he checked the news for the fire the team was called to next.[[Contain the Flame]], x (S) Pruitt told Andy of his intent to find a desk job somewhere. She didn't like the idea because she wanted him at home healing. Despite this, he went behind her back and Jack hired him to work reception at Station .[[Contain the Flame]], x (S) After Pruitt overheard Travis and Dean talking about Dean trying to get with JJ, Dean decided to go back to Pruitt for advice. Pruitt suggested he just go to JJ if he wanted her. He suggested Dean go get a new incident report from her because hers had been damaged and when Dean pointed out that it hadn't, Pruitt spilled juice on it.[[Reignited]], x (S) While looking for some paperwork, he saw Jack and Andy in an intense moment and realized they'd been sleeping together.[[Reignited]], x (S) He confronted the two of them and told them they had to tell the team or he would tell them himself.[[Shock to the System (S)|Shock to the System]], x (S) Ben brought his wife over to visit and she was surprised to see Pruitt at the station instead of at home. After the team was called out, she talked to him about letting his body heal, but he tried to say that he was better off helping people at the station than sitting at home.[[Shock to the System (S)|Shock to the System]], x (S) Pruitt got sick at work, which was noticed by Dean Miller, though Pruitt brushed it off when Dean asked about it. Later, he told Dean he'd decided to go home and rest and asked him not to say anything to anyone else about what had happened. Dean agreed. Instead of going home, Pruitt went to the hospital, where he asked them to page Bailey.[[Stronger Together]], x (S) He asked Bailey to give him medicine to help him get through his work, but she insisted on a full exam first. He decided it wasn't that bad and left the hospital. Later, at the station, Dean and Ben sat Pruitt down and told him they'd both noticed he was sick and knew he needed medical attention. He tried to refuse, but when he nearly collapsed, Andy took him to the hospital, despite his objection that she needed to stay at the station. At the hospital, tests showed he wasn't responding to his treatment anymore. Bailey suggested adding a new agent. Pruitt agreed to it. Andy wanted to be there for her father, but he said she didn't have to do that. She revealed to him that she'd promised her mother she'd look out for him. Suddenly, he started crashing. Bailey stabilized him and determined he'd had an allergic reaction to the new agent. Despite this, she wanted to continue the treatment as planned. He told her he wanted his daughter kept up to date and involved in all his treatment from that point on.[[Let It Burn]], x (S) Insistent that his opinion should have weight in the decision of who should run the department, Pruitt was interviewed by Ripley in his hospital room while he received chemo. At the end of the interview, Pruitt said he wouldn't recommend either of them for the Captain position.[[Every Second Counts]], x (S) When Pruitt learned from Vic that Andy and others were trapped in a garage that was heating up, he remembered a time when he'd lost part of his team when a similar thing happened. He came down to the scene and coached Andy to fight and figure out a way out from the inside. It helped and Andy and the others were able to use a water heater to escape. Later, while they were at the bar celebrating, Pruitt confessed that he hadn't backed either Andy or Jack for Captain, which upset Andy.[[Hot Box]], x (S) While the firefighters battled a skyscraper fire, Pruitt called Ryan because he was having trouble breathing and didn't want to pull an aid car away from the skyscraper. Ryan showed up just after Bailey arrived because she was worried about him having missed his scheduled appointment. They found Pruitt not breathing and pulseless. Bailey started CPR and Ryan went to get his car so they could get him to the hospital.[[Not Your Hero]], x (S) Pruitt was rushed to the hospital, where he was quickly stabilized. They discovered that a clot was the reason why he couldn't breathe. The chemo had caused the clot, but it was also working on the cancer, meaning that Pruitt might only be a few treatments away from remission.[[No Recovery]], x (S) Pruitt came into the station to do his laundry because his machine was broken. While he was there, he tried to talk to Sullivan about his future at the station, but Sullivan brushed him off and said to enjoy his retirement. While was there, Ben was called about getting information regarding the storm drains in Seattle, because [[Max Forrester]] was trapped and they were trying to rescue him. Pruitt, along with Travis, immediately stepped in to help make calls to get information. With their help, Max was successfully rescued.[[Under the Surface]], x (S) Sullivan called in Pruitt to help him mend things with the team. Pruitt suggested that Sullivan find the heart of the team and use that person to gain the respect of the others.[[Last Day on Earth]], x (S) After separating from Miranda, Ben wanted to feel a sense of togetherness, so he planned "Friendsgiving" with Jack at Dean's houseboat and invited the rest of the team. However, while they were still preparing the meal, the team was called away due to accidents from the windstorm. Greg, Ryan, Pruitt, and Grant surprised the team by bringing Friendsgiving to the station. Meal prep continued, but a call came in and Ben, Dean, Travis, Maya, Vic, and Ripley headed out to cover it, leaving Jack alone at the station with the civilians. They played poker and waited for the team to return. Pruitt noticed that Jack was struggling and didn't seem to be sleeping, so he asked Jack about it, but Jack angrily brushed him off.[[Weather the Storm]], x (S) While they ate, Pruitt stepped aside with Dean and asked him about Jack. He shared his concern and said it wouldn't resolve on its own. He then called the whole team out on not getting Jack help. With his help, they staged an intervention, which prompted Jack to spew vitriol at them. Ripley interrupted his ranting and said that they weren't grounded anymore and no one had heard from Andy and Sullivan for over an hour. He was called back to headquarters, so he left Pruitt to stand in as interim Captain and they went out to find Andy and Sullivan. With difficulty, they found them and rescued them, but not before Shannon died. Four months later, Pruitt presented Andy with a Medal of Valor. They then had a party in her honor.[[Crash and Burn]], x (S) While Sullivan was out recovering, Pruitt stepped up as Captain. When Sullivan was ready to return, Pruitt said he wasn't ready to step back until he felt Sullivan understood his role as Captain, not only making sure everything was clean and orderly, but in serving the community and looking after his team. He specifically asked Sullivan about a walk-in from the neighborhood who hadn't come in at all during his time as interim Captain.[[I Fought the Law]], x (S) Pruitt decided to sell his house and look for a condo to buy. After the house was listed, he got some offers, including an all-cash offer from someone who had a tiny puppy that he turned down because he thinks tiny puppies are weird. He also consulted with Ryan to look into the criminal backgrounds of all the people who had put in offers. He also confessed to Ryan that he felt he'd become too comfortable in the house and he wanted to move forward.[[Crazy Train]], x (S) After selling his house, Pruitt started packing things. When he ran across some things of Andy's, he brought them to her at the station, saying Reggie had told him it was easier to get rid of things before the move than to sort them while moving in.[[Baby Boom]], x (S) [[File:Sx-.jpg|thumb|Pruitt slut shames Andy.]] At some point, Pruitt found out that there was something going on between Andy and Sullivan. He came by her and Maya's apartment and yelled at her for sleeping with firefighters in her own station, which he deemed bad for the reputation of female firefighters. She assured him she hadn't slept with Robert but that it wasn't his business if she had. He disagreed and said her decisions reflect on his legacy. She then threw him out but he demanded she respect her father. She then left her own apartment instead. Maya then peaked out of her bedroom and told him it was late. He apologized for waking her and left.[[I Know This Bar]], x (S) [[File:x-.jpg|thumb|Bailey tells Pruitt he has scrotal lymphoma.]] When Pruitt began noticing symptoms again, he secretly admitted himself to the hospital under Bailey's care. He made her promise not to tell Ben. She told him she was finding out the baby's sex later that day and did an ultrasound, which revealed a mass that they took a biopsy of. She returned with the news that it was a scrotal lymphoma. He told her he wouldn't go through chemo again as it made him sicker than the cancer itself last time. She stressed that the cancer was very aggressive and that it would metastasize to his lungs in less than six months, giving him a limited life expectancy. He then pointed out that Bailey was bleeding. Carina came in and found she was having a miscarriage. Pruitt stayed with her to comfort her until Ben arrived. Pruitt went to drink at Joe's bar, where Ben joined him. Pruitt told him his late wife had had a miscarriage before Andy. Ben asked him why he was at the hospital. Pruitt stayed quiet and seconds later, a car crashed into the bar.[[Let's All Go to the Bar]], x [[File:Sx-.jpg|thumb|Pruitt tries to find a way out.]] Pruitt, Ben, Jackson, and Nico assessed the situation. Several of Grey Sloan's residents were seriously injured and needed medical attention. With the entrance blocked by debris, Nico and Pruitt unsuccessfully tried the back exit, which was blocked by a truck from the outside. He assisted the doctors in taking care of the residents and the driver and passenger in the car until Station cleared a way into the bar and freed everyone. Andy was surprised to see him and asked why he was there. He dodged and commented on the time it took them to get into the bar.[[I Know This Bar]], x (S) Headstrong and hard on the outside, Pruitt was actually caring when he showed it, especially around his daughter, Andy. [[Elena Herrera]] He was married to Andy's mother.[[Shock to the System (S)|Shock to the System]], x (S) [[Reggie]] Pruitt sold his house through a real estate agent named [[Reggie]]. During this process, they pursued a mutual attraction.[[Baby Boom]], x (S) [[Andy Herrera]] Pruitt was his daughter Andy's primary inspiration to become a firefighter. He also functions as her mentor. He taught her to run a hose when she was seven.[[You Really Got a Hold on Me]], x When Andy decided to move out and told him about it, he was upset at the change in their relationship.[[Under the Surface]], x (S) After Andy moved out, Pruitt struggled with remembering to shop for groceries and keeping a plant alive.[[Home To Hold Onto]], x (S) [[Jack Gibson]] He was Jack's mentor. [[Dean Miller]] Dean named his daughter [[Pruitt Arike Miller]] after Pruitt Herrera.[[Born to Run]], x (S) Andy told Diane Lewis that Miller was her father's favorite.[[% or Nothing]], x (S) Pruitt was the Captain of [[SFD Station |Station ]] of the [[Seattle Fire Department]] until his cancer diagnosis, after which he had to step down. While recovering, he agreed to be a temporary receptionist at Station , often answering calls and fetching papers from the Captain's office.[[Contain the Flame]], x (S) *He is the first character of Station to be mentioned on Grey's Anatomy.[[(Don't Fear) the Reaper]], x *He was at the time of his first cancer diagnosis.[[Stuck]], x (S) *He would get quiet when he was mad.[[Shock to the System (S)|Shock to the System]], x (S) *He and his daughter lived at [[Herrera House| Field Pine Place]] until he sold it to help pay for his medical treatment.[[Stronger Together]], x (S) *He would talk to telemarketers until they hung up on him.[[Lost and Found]], x (S) SxPruittHerrera.png SxPruittHerrera.png SxPruittHerrera.png SxPruittHerrera.png {{GalleryLink}} The following episodes are Pruitt-centric or are otherwise very informative about his life: *[[I'll Be Seeing You]] :'''Pruitt:''' You're both adults. You can technically do what you want. But it disturbs me that you never considered the consquences of your actions, what it would mean, not just to me, but to the station. If I had known about the two of you, I would've never put you both up for the captain position. You're trying to lead this station. This team puts their trust in you blindly. You don't deserve their trust if you can't be honest with them. {{Pruitt Herrera Appearances}} {{Scrollbox}} [[fr:Pruitt Herrera]] [[es:Pruitt Herrera]] [[de:Pruitt Herrera]] {{DEFAULTSORT:Herrera, Pruitt}} [[Category:Characters]] [[Category:GA Characters]] [[Category:GA S Characters]] [[Category:S Characters]] [[Category:S S Characters]] [[Category:S S Characters]] [[Category:S S Characters]] [[Category:S S Characters]] [[Category:Deceased Characters]] [[Category:Firefighters]] [[Category:Paramedics]] [[Category:Patients]] [[Category:Patients (ER)]] [[Category:Patients (General)]] [[Category:Patients (Oncology)]] [[Category:Patients (Urology)]]

'''Rachel Burke''' is a woman who was attacked by a bear while camping in the woods.


Rachel and her husband, Scott, were on a camping trip together. They had spent $, on equipment because Scott always wanted to try camping, though Rachel admitted she would have preferred to go to Italy. They saw the crew of station  as the walked through toward their own campsite. The next morning, the firefighters were awakened by screams coming from the Burkes' camp. He had been making coffee when a black bear attacked them, tearing off Scott's nose and severing an artery in Rachel's arm. The team put a tourniquet on Rachel's arm, packed Scott's face, and then carried them down to the parking lot, where the ambulance picked them up and took them to the hospital. The nose was later located and taken to the hospital so it could be reattached. ''("[[Into the Woods]]")''

At the hospital, Rachel and Scott both immediately went into surgery. Rachel's brachial artery was repaired and Scott's nose was temporarily attached to his arm, so that his face would have time to heal before it was reattached there. Rachel had to have a second surgery the next day to wash out her wounds to prevent infection. She was told she'd be okay after some rehab. Scott, on the other hand, coded after his surgery due to bleeding in his chest and wasn't able to be resuscitated. Rachel was devastated to learn he'd died and pushed Brian, her secret lover, away. ''("[[A Diagnosis]]")''



She was married to [[Scott Burke]] until his death. Despite this, she pursued a romantic relationship with [[Brian (A Diagnosis)|Brian]]. They had gone to high school together and reconnected online. She planned to tell Scott on the camping trip, but didn't get the chance when they were attacked by a bear. She was later devastated when Scott died and told Brian to leave. ''("[[A Diagnosis]]")''

'''Reese''' was one of the passengers on the train with a bird flu outbreak.


Reese was on a subway when the train stalled, which caused some injuries to people on the train. Jack and Maya responded to the call. While they were treating the minor injuries, they discovered that two of the passengers, [[Will (Crazy Train)|Will]] and [[Neil]], had come in from Bashran, where there was an outbreak of avian flu and and both were showing signs of infection. They contacted the CDC and announced to the passengers that no one would be able to leave until the CDC cleared them. Reese was irritated and threatened to sue them if they prevented him from leaving. He continued to try to rally the other passengers to his side. While they were distracted treating Will and Neil, Reese tried to leave the car, but a security guard, [[Kenneth]], stopped him using a taser. For unknown reasons, this caused Reese to have cardiac problems. Maya was able to find a fellow passenger's medication and use that to stabilize Reese until the CDC came and they were all evacuated and decontaminated.

'''Reggie''' is the real estate agent who sold Pruitt's house. They then became romantically involved.


When he decided to sell his house, [[Pruitt Herrera]] hired Reggie as his real estate agent. She helped his house sell quickly and gave him advice for packing and moving. ''("[[Baby Boom]]")''



While working with Pruitt on selling his house, they pursued a mutual attraction. ''("[[Baby Boom]]")'' Their relationship hit a slight snag when Pruitt mentioned wanting to watch sunsets with her from his condo. She said she wanted to do it from cruise ships or her son's house, not just from his condo. He was resistant to the idea of branching out like that, but eventually agreed to go. ''("[[When It Rains, It Pours!]]")''


She has a son who lives in Oregon. ''("[[When It Rains, It Pours!]]")''


She is a real estate agent.

'''Ricky''' is a factory worker who was caught in a fire.


Ricky was working at Sweet Ana's Candy Factory when a fire started. Ricky was able to get out, but when firefighters arrived, he advised them that his girlfriend, [[Stella]], was pregnant and still inside. He drew a map to show Beckett where the generator was so they could shut down power to the factory, making it easier to put out the fire. Then Maya took him over to the triage area and began treating his wounds. When he overheard on the radio that they were searching the wrong area for the generator, he told Maya that Beckett was reading the map upside down.

Once Stella was evacuated, Ricky ran to her and proposed. He then road with her in the aid car to the hospital.



He is engaged to [[Stella]].


He and his fianc\uee are expecting a baby.


He works on the distribution line at Sweet Ana's Candy Factory.

'''Rigo Vasquez''' was a firefighter at Station .



Captain Pruitt Herrera recruited Rigo out of junior college. Captain Herrera was there when Rigo's father passed. ''("[[Satellite of Love]]")''


While Andy was out on her mandatory week off, Rigo worked with A shift, though there was a lot of tension between him and the rest of the team. When they responded to a fire at Roger's Five and Dime, he jumped in without waiting for instructions, even as Ben was prepared to give some at the triage area. Later, when they went to celebrate at the bar, Rigo showed up looking for his wife. ''("[[Indoor Fireworks]]")''


Rigo was on Aid Car with Andy and they responded to a bridal shop, where [[Shauna]] had passed out and hit her head. They suspected carbon monoxide poisoning and tested the air to confirm it. They got Shauna out and her condition improved, but they couldn't take her to the hospital because Andy noticed smoke coming out of a manhole cover. When the rest of station  arrived to help, Rigo was upset to be pulled off aid car to evacuate the street. He saw a manhole cover and decided to pull it off over Jack's orders. Jack pulled him away just in time and then benched him for the rest of the call, saying he couldn't trust Rigo. ''("[[Eulogy]]")''


Rigo made several remarks during Maya's first day as captain, some indicating his distaste for having a female captain. Despite this, he followed orders and participated in the group workout and drills. ''("[[House Where Nobody Lives]]")''


Rigo brought his wife on the camping trip Maya had planned to build morale. He was annoyed at the mandated fun. When another couple out camping was attacked by a bear Rigo and the rest of the team stepped in to help. Rigo was suspicious when he saw Jack and Eva emerge from the woods at the same time, but didn't confront them on it because of the attack. He later helped carry [[Rachel Burke]] down out of the woods to the parking lot so she could be taken to the hospital. ''("[[Into the Woods]]")''


At some point, he went on a call with Andy where they had to save a woman, [[Kelly (Station )|Kelly]], who was choking in her backyard. When they arrived, Andy was quickly dibbled when she noticed a raccoon nearby and started freaking out. Rigo took over and did the Heimlich on Kelly, saving her life. Back in the Aid Car, he and Andy laughed about what had happened. ''("[[Something About What Happens When We Talk]]")''


After Rigo learned that Jack had slept with Eva, things became very tense between them. It came to a head during the blizzard when Rigo beat up Jack. Because of this, the rest of the team learned that Jack had slept with Eva, something they considered a huge betrayal. ''("[[Ice Ice Baby]]")''

Maya decided not to fire Jack because of what he'd done, but called the two of them into their office to apologize and assure her they could work together. Rigo was unable to apologize to Jack, but apologized to Maya for not waiting until he was off the clock to beat Jack up. They went out on a call soon afterward and while working together to put out some small fires in a food truck lot, Jack tried to stop Rigo from approaching a tank of liquid oxygen. Rigo ignored him and when Jack tried to pull him back, he dropped a fire extinguisher, which sparked an explosion that eviscerated Rigo. Ben stepped in from the PRT to operate on Rigo's abdomen and save his life. He was able to use REBOA to stabilize him and then he was driven to the hospital. ''("[[Satellite of Love]]")''

Eva was told he was stable after his surgery and he was later able to come off the ventilator. ''("[[Born to Run]]")'' Because he was responsible for Rigo's accident, [[Griffin Ford]] offered to cover all his medical expenses. ''("[[Life on Mars?]]")''


On the day of his discharge out of the hospital, Rigo threw a pulmonary embolism and died. ''("[[Poor Wandering One]]", "[[Give a Little Bit]]")''


After Pruitt's death, Andy dreamed that Rigo told her he never had a dad, especially one like hers. He also told Jack he wasn't a bad guy. Andy was confused as to why Jack was in her dream because he wasn't dead. He then told her they were all orphans. ''("[[Dream a Little Dream of Me]]")''


On Halloween, Jack hallucinated Rigo throughout the day. He imagined Rigo taunting him over his relationship with Eva and then Rigo telling him he wasn't at fault for Rigo's death. He also told Jack that he deserved love and happiness. When Jack went to the station to see Pru, Rigo nodded at him. ''("[[Demons]]")''



He was\uamarried to [[Eva Vasquez]]\uauntil his death.


He was a firefighter with [[SFD Station |Station ]]. When Andy was on leave for a week, he moved to A shift.


*He is the first member of [[SFD Station  |Station 's]] B-shift to play a prominent role in the series.
*He used to play basketball.<ref>[[Ice Ice Baby]], x (S)</ref>

{{Firefighter Infobox |name = Robert Sullivan |image = Sx-.jpg |status = Alive |alias = *Bobby *Sully *Montana *Bob *Fire Zaddy *Captain Fire Grinch |title = Lieutenant |marital = *[[Claire Sullivan]] \u ''(wife)'' *[[Andy Herrera]] ''(ex-wife)'' |parents = Parents \u |grandparents = Grandfather \u |other family = *[[Pruitt Herrera]] \u ''(father-in-law)'' *[[Elena Herrera]] ''(mother-in-law)'' |job = '''Current'''
