Mavis Private Client Fire Protection
United States Marine Corps |first appearance = *'''[[Station |S]]:''' [[No Recovery]] *'''[[Grey's Anatomy|GA]]:''' [[What I Did for Love]] |count = |seasons = *'''[[Grey's Anatomy|GA]]:''' [[Season (Grey's Anatomy)|]] and [[Season (Grey's Anatomy)|]] *'''[[Station |S]]:''' [[Season (Station )|]], [[Season (Station )|]], [[Season (Station )|]], [[Season (Station )|]], and [[Season (Station )|]] |portrayed by = [[Boris Kodjoe]] }} '''Robert Sullivan''' is the former Battalion Chief of the [[Seattle Fire Department]] and current lieutenant at [[SFD Station |Station ]]. He was married to [[Andy Herrera]]. Due to his parents' jobs, Robert was raised mostly by his German grandfather, who he was very close to until the age of . When he was , he learned that his grandfather had been a Nazi during WWII. His grandfather tried to justify his actions, and it quickly became clear to Robert that his grandfather's only regret was that Robert found out. He told Andy and Pruitt that he lived in that house for another six years, but that day was the last time he ever talked to his grandfather again. At the age of sixteen, Robert's parents died in a plane crash.[[Dream a Little Dream of Me]], x (S) He was a Marine and went on a tour to Iraq. He saw other Marines work with Belgian Malinois there, and is very scared of them.[[Ice Ice Baby]], x (S) On his wife, Claire's, birthday, Robert was with his friend, [[Lucas Ripley]], responded to a call about a car accident. When they arrived on the scene, Robert recognized his wife's car as one that was involved in the accident. They rushed to her aid, but despite their efforts, she died while Lucas was working on her. Robert blamed him and it ruined their friendship.[[Do a Little Harm...]], x (S) During Jack and Dean's training, they got into a fight and were sent to see Sullivan. He told them he didn't care if they liked each other, but he did care how well they did the job or they wouldn't make it through the academy.[[No Recovery]], x (S) After [[Pruitt Herrera]] was forced to step down due to his health, Robert was named the new captain of Station after a few months of selection. He said he wanted to start with uniform inspection, before the shift even started.[[No Recovery]], x (S) The team slowly adjusted to having Sullivan in charge. They were disturbed by the fact that he never shared meals with them and disliked that he was so strict about things such as missing buttons on uniforms. When they were called to help rescue [[Max Forrester]], he had Andy drive as they made their way to find him in the storm drain. He was angered when Andy impulsively jumped into the drain against his orders and told her to be silent for the rest of the call. They reached the final place where they could possibly find Max and found it to be a much smaller entrance than they expected. Andy suggested using the jackhammer to open it up, but they learned there was a gas line near it, which made it too risky. Out of options, Jack then suggested sending down a loop for Max to grab and wrap around himself. They lowered the loop, but Max was scared to grab it. With help him his Dad, they were able to convince him to grab the loop and he was lifted to safety.[[Under the Surface]], x (S) Station was called to the apartment of [[Evelyn]] after her downstairs neighbors were worried about her after her floor started collapsing into their apartment and she didn't answer her phone. When they heard creaking behind her door, they broke the lock, which showed that there were stacks of things filling her apartment, which was compromising the floor. They heard Evelyn calling out for help, but weren't able to get in because forcing the door open more could cause them to fall and cause more damage. Sullivan sent Dean to get support beams and Travis and Vic to evacuate the floor below them just in case. Evelyn said she had fallen and was having a hard time catching her breath. She'd recently had heart surgery. Andy wanted to wait for the structural engineers, but Sullivan said one person needed to go in. He wanted Ben to go in, but asked for Maya's input. Maya suggested sending in Andy instead, because she's lighter and has more experience. When Andy reached Evelyn and gave a report on her status, Ben talked her through doing draining the blood around Evelyn's heart. Andy then put her on the stretcher and got her out. The floor started to crack more as Andy went to leave and Sullivan pulled her to safety as the floor collapsed beneath her. Andy was upset to know that if she'd had her way and they waited for the engineers, Evelyn would have died.[[Home To Hold Onto]], x (S) Seeing that the whole team was good, but at the same things, Sullivan decided to assign each of them a specialty to learn. He assigned Dean to water rescue, Maya to incident operations, Vic to crisis management, Jack to tactical force training, Ben to hazmat training, Travis to urban rescue, and Andy to recruitment. He later explained to Andy, who disliked her assignment, that he picked her to do recruitment because she's the most passionate about the job and that shows when she talks to people about it.[[Lost and Found]], x (S) Station was called out to a structure fire. When they arrived, they started a perimeter sweep to see if anyone might be inside and prepared to start fighting the fire. When Maya learned that the hydrant was dry because the building was scheduled for demolition, she suggested that once they cleared the building, they could use the water in the engine to drown the surrounding buildings and let it burn. Jack then saw signs that there were squatters inside. Just then a kid came out of the building with [[Zoe]]. He was handed off to be seen and Zoe tried to re-enter the building. Andy stopped her, saying she needed to be treated, too, but Zoe said there were five more kids inside. They found [[Sean (Lost and Found)|Sean]] and he was evacuated and treated. Andy then noticed a sprinkler system and said they needed to locate the valve. Zoe thought she knew where it was and showed Andy the way to it. Andy reached the valve just as Travis and Ben noticed that what was coming out of the sprinklers was flammable. She didn't get the warning in time and turned on the sprinklers, which caused fire to engulf the building. Dean and Vic ended up trapped with two kids and Andy ended up trapped with Zoe as well. Vic and Dean shared their oxygen with the kids until an exit was made and they were able to evacuate. Ben, Travis, and Andy remained trapped. Water was then finally available and they doused the building as quickly as they could. Everyone was evacuated and treated for smoke inhalation.[[Lost and Found]], x (S) Sullivan oversaw a training given by station firefighters for police officers on the anniversary of his wife's death. During the training, he saw Maya and Jack joking around and called Maya out for making it a joke. They went back to the training, but when he felt she wasn't taking it seriously, he called her out again until Andy defended her. Ripley then put a stop to it and told Robert to go home for the rest of the shift.[[Do a Little Harm...]], x (S) In order to mend things with his team, Sullivan enlisted the help of Pruitt, who suggested he find the person who's the heart of the team and get their help with the rest of the team. Sullivan took this to be Andy and asked her to sit with him sometime when they weren't working and help him earn the team's respect.[[Last Day on Earth]], x (S) Sullivan took Pruitt's advice and approached Andy for help. They got a coffee and she suggested that he join them for meals and share about his life to bond with the team.[[Weather the Storm]], x (S) During the windstorm, the team was called in when B shift became stranded. At the station, they went over storm protocols and gathered extra supplies to be ready. Sullivan and Andy went on the first call out. They went to the scene, where they found a car that had been hit by another car that then drove off. Unbeknownst to Andy, it was on the same stretch of road where Sullivan's wife had died. In the car, they found [[Shannon (Weather the Storm)|Shannon]], who said she was trying to escape the storm when she was hit. Her leg was broken, so they splinted it, but because of the high winds, they had difficulty wrapping her leg, so they moved her into the Aid Car. As they worked, Shannon asked if one of them could get her purse out of her car, as it had a necklace her grandmother gave her. Sullivan retrieved it for her. They were able to stabilize her leg, but the radios weren't working because of the storm, so they were unable to get advice from dispatch on where to take her and Sullivan wanted to wait for the all clear before leaving. However, when they noticed the wind was starting to move the Aid Car, they knew they needed to get out of there. They tried, but the Aid Car was blown off the edge of a cliff.[[Weather the Storm]], x (S) Andy and Sullivan woke up in the aid car. Shannon was also awake, but Sullivan was trapped under the collapsed dashboard. Andy got him freed and he planned to go for help, but he wasn't able to move or feel his legs. Andy got him on a backboard and tried to reassure him as she treated both him and Shannon. She then put out a small fire on the Aid Car to keep them safer. Andy stayed in the back with them and continued to monitor them. Shannon coded, but Andy was able to resuscitate. After she was in sinus rhythm again, Andy decided she needed to leave the Aid Car to set off the flares. Only one was still viable, so she took it and left the rig. She made the difficult climb up and set out the flare. While Andy was on her way back, Shannon coded again. Despite risk of paralysis, Sullivan unstrapped himself from the backboard and tried to reach the defibrillator. When he couldn't, he attempted a precordial thump. When Andy returned, she started compressions, but she was unable to resuscitate and Shannon died. Soon after, they were found and rescued by the team. Four months later, he was still recovering and could only walk with the help of a cane. He left rehab for an hour to attend the party celebrating Andy's Medal of Valor.[[Crash and Burn]], x (S) After months of rehab, Sullivan was finally ready to go back to work. He met with Pruitt, who had acted as interim captain, and received reports from Pruitt. Pruitt criticized him for missing Jack's PTSD and not seeing that regular drop-ins weren't coming in anymore. This inspired Sullivan to take Ben and Jack for a wellness check on a drop-in Pruitt specifically mentioned. They went to his house and did an exam. He revealed that Sullivan was the reason he stopped checking in. His car was busted, leaving him unable to pick up his medications. Ben then heard regurgitation in his heart. He didn't want to go to the hospital, but he collapsed trying to fight them off. Sullivan distracted him with a game of chess as they worked to get him stable while they waited for an aid car. He stabilized, then checkmated Sullivan. After they sent him to the hospital, they remembered that he mentioned his car wasn't working, so they went to his garage and fixed it.[[I Fought the Law]], x (S) Ben, Dean, and Travis had planned to work together to repaint Travis's place. As they prepared to leave, Sullivan talked his way into an invitation to join them. With Sullivan there, they painted in virtual silence. When Sullivan started dancing while painting, they were disturbed, but he explained that when a month ago, you couldn't move your legs, you dance when a song comes on that makes you want to dance. The rest of them started to dance as well.[[Crazy Train]], x (S) One day, an RV crashed into the side of station . Andy was surprised to see a young girl climb out of the driver's seat. [[Ellie (Baby Boom)|Ellie]] said her mother was shaking and wouldn't stop, so she tried to hit the brake, but hit the accelerator instead. Maya and Ben found her mother inside still seizing. To prevent further damage to the building, Travis disconnected the fuel in the vehicle. Then they worked to expand the exit to get Ellie's mother out. They freed her, but struggled to get her to stop seizing. While they worked on her, Andy took Ellie to the conference room to talk to her and keep her calm. As her mom was ready to be moved, she said she didn't want to go to the hospital with her because she felt she was always messing things up. Shortly afterward, she collapsed from low blood sugar. She was given glucose and quickly woke up, but still worried about her mom having another seizure and her not being able to help. Andy then sent Ellie to the hospital to be with her mom, while they dealt with the damage to the station caused by the crash and subsequent explosion.[[Baby Boom]], x (S) When Ripley passed out on a sidewalk and was taken to the hospital, Sullivan, Ben, and Andy came to the hospital to check on his condition. Andy and Ben were surprised to learn that he'd been buying flowers for Vic when he passed out. After being banished from his room, they waited in the hospital waiting area. They were shocked when his lab results came back, showing his condition was much worse than previously believed and he had fled the hospital in search of Vic.[[What I Did for Love]], x After the ambulance accident, and his leg injury, Dr. Koracick informed him that he was going to have chronic pain. He refused surgery because it had a / chance of working and was $,. So he convinced Koracick to prescribe one more dose of opioids.[[Eulogy]], x (S) While Ben was checking the meds for the aid car, Sullivan offered to help. While he was checking the Fentanyl doses, he hides two in his pocket. Shortly after taking a dose, Robert became a little hyper. He told Ben that he was in the Marines which Ben didn't know. He also told him that he speaks six languages and listed them. He later fell asleep in his office. [[Claire Sullivan]] Robert was happily married until his wife\us death. She was involved in a car accident. Robert and Lucas were the first responders at the scene of her accident, but despite their efforts, she died. Since then, he changed into a completely different person and continues to blame himself for his wife\us death for being unable to save her.[[Do a Little Harm...]], x (S) Their first date was to a roller rink, because she loved roller skating.[[Crash and Burn]], x (S) [[Andy Herrera]] When they first met, Robert and Andy weren't on the best of terms, but two near-death experiences brought them together; surviving the Aid Car tumbling off a cliff[[Crash and Burn]], x, and a wave of fire in California. When they finally gave into the attraction between them, Sullivan suddenly stopped, which upset Andy, who didn't know he stopped because his leg had gone numb.[[Into the Wildfire]], x (S) After a little back and forth, they finally got together and told Pruitt they were a couple over lunch. They remained in a secret relationship and even got married in a small ceremony with only Pruitt attending, as his cancer was back and he was dying. After his death, falling through a roof he was venting, Sullivan took care of his wife while she grieved her father. He told her that both his parents were dead, and Andy replied that "we're all we have".[[Dream a Little Dream of Me]], x When Andy returned to work and Ben confronted Sullivan about the stolen drugs from the PRT car, Sullivan was forced to confess to both Ben and Dixon about his marriage. Later that night, they confessed their relationship at a party at the station, much to the surprise of their co-workers.[[The Ghosts That Haunt Me]], x Unfortunately, they separated for a while due to Sullivan\us status at a recovering addict. Amelia Shepherd suggested they take a -day break to help with his sobriety. Both Sullivan and Andy found it difficult to be apart, and almost slipped up more than once. Andy almost didn't attend Robert's court case regarding him stealing drugs from the PRT.[[We Are Family]], x After a discussion with his sponsor, Richard Webber, he decided to reconnect with his wife. He and Andy are seen dancing to music in the beanery and share a kiss. Later, they have sex on the floor of Sullivan's old office, which doesn't seem to bother him at all.[[Out of Control]], x When both Sullivan and Dean are arrested after rescuing two girls from inside a man's house[[Out of Control]], x, Andy is devastated. When Sullivan emerges from the police station, Andy can be seen running to hug her husband.[[Train in Vain]], x During grief counselling, Andy mentions how she fell in love with a Black man, and that she "takes on the pain he [Sullivan] doesn\ut allow himself to feel.\ud[[Get Up, Stand Up (Station )]], x Robert's parents were not part of his life very often. They worked a lot, which left him with his grandpa for the most part. He was close with his grandfather until he learned that his grandfather was a Nazi. After he found that out, he never spoke to his grandfather again. His parents both died when he was sixteen in a plane crash.[[No Days Off]], x (S) [[Lucas Ripley]] Robert has known Lucas for years since his earlier years as a firefighter. They were best friends until the death of his wife, which Robert blamed on Lucas.[[Do a Little Harm...]], x (S) Later they worked to reconcile with one another. When Lucas was on his deathbed, Robert offered to visit with him first, when Vic wasn't brave enough. Robert didn't want to say goodbye, so instead told him "we're good"[[Always Ready]] [[Maya Bishop]] Upon his appointment as Captain, Sullivan immediately indicated to Maya that he expected her to submit an application for lieutenant. When she said she had, he said he looked forward to reviewing it.[[Home To Hold Onto]], x (S) Later, at a [[Storage Unit Fire|fire at a storage unit]], Robert went against Captain Bishop's request for him to stay behind and take in charge outside the storage unit fire. He continued to put on his gear and did not answer her, going against protocol to go inside alone and save his wife. When he first became a firefighter, he had no desire to rise up in the ranks. He told Ripley that he did not want to sit around and push papers all day and wanted to be where the action was, saving lives. This changed when his wife died in a car accident. He was a lieutenant in Montana for while until Ripley persuaded him to move back to Seattle and become captain of Station . Robert was a Battalion Chief for the [[Seattle Fire Department]]. He oversaw about five fire stations, including [[SFD Station ]]. However after he overdosed on fentanyl and had a court case regarding whether or not he should be allowed to continue working for the SFD, he was demoted back to his original firefighter rank. After his demotion, he became eager to get back to where he was. He undermined Andy often as he was not used to being just a firefighter who wasn't in charge. He also questioned Maya a lot. After the news of the drug use, his team didn't trust him for a while. They tried to mask it by pretending to joke with him and calling him a probie. After Maya broke protocol, he attempted to save the house by going to the SFD board to plead for her. However, this led to Maya being demoted. This caused tension between him and the other members of Station . When his old Marine buddy became the new fire chief, she promoted him to lieutenant. He asked her not to as he finally regained the trust of his team. However, she said that she wanted to change the ways. The old fire chief had his people and she wanted her people. In the past, he was an instructor at the West Seattle Fire Academy. He moved to Montana to be a Captain after he lost his wife in Seattle. When he moved back to Seattle, he was appointed as the new captain of [[SFD Station |Station ]], replacing [[Pruitt Herrera]] when it was decided none of the Lieutenants would get the job. *He was a Marine who was stationed in Iraq. He is afraid of Belgian Malinois because they used that breed over there and he saw them do unspeakable things to other people.[[Ice Ice Baby]], x (S) *He speaks different languages: English, Spanish, French, Italian, Farsi, and German.[[Into the Woods]], x (S) *German is his first language [[Satellite of Love]], x (S) *He wasn't born in Seattle, but has lived there most of his adult life.[[Home To Hold Onto]], x (S) *One of his first assignments was incident operations.[[Lost and Found]], x (S) *He considers making smoothies to be a hobby.[[Crash and Burn]], x (S) *He was a scout sniper while stationed in Iraq.[[Poor Wandering One]], x (S) *He can salsa dance.[[Something About What Happens When We Talk]], x (S) *His grandfather was a Nazi.[[No Days Off]], x (S) *He was his high school's valedictorian.[[We Are Family]], x SxRobertSullivan.png SxRobertSullivan.png SxRobertSullivan.png SxRobertSullivan.png {{GalleryLink}} These episodes are Robert-centric or are otherwise very informative about his life: *[[Do a Little Harm...]] *[[Poor Wandering One]] *[[No Days Off]] *[[We Are Family]] {{Robert Sullivan Appearances}} {{Scrollbox}} [[de:Robert Sullivan]] [[es:Robert Sullivan]] {{DEFAULTSORT:Sullivan, Robert}} [[Category:Characters]] [[Category:GA Characters]] [[Category:GA S Characters]] [[Category:GA S Characters]] [[Category:S Characters]] [[Category:S S Characters]] [[Category:S S Characters]] [[Category:S S Characters]] [[Category:S S Characters]] [[Category:S S Characters]] [[Category:Firefighters]] [[Category:S Rescuees]] [[Category:Patients]] [[Category:Patients (Neuro)]] [[Category:Patients (Psych)]]

'''Robyn Tillerman''' is a relative of [[Terrence Tillerman]].


Robyn drove Terrence and Delilah's kids back to their house when they learned that Terrence had been pinned between two cars in the driveway. They arrived just after Terrence had been extracted and moved into the PRT for field surgery before being transported to the hospital, where he had additional surgery and was stable in his ICU room.



She's a member of the Tillerman family.

Rocco came to the hospital with his friend, Tuck, on a day when school was closed. They hadn't been signed up for Science Camp because Ben forgot, so Maggie offered to do a science camp at the hospital for them. She took them to an empty lab and impressed them with a science experiment.



He and [[William George Bailey Jones|Tuck]] are friends.

'''Rodney''' came into the ER with a burn on his arm after a propane tank exploded.


Rodney's fianc\ue, [[Jim]], was cooking using a chicken fryer when the propane tank exploded, severely injuring Rodney's father, Mike, and burning Rodney's arm. Mike was taken to the ER by ambulance and Rodney, Jim, and Rodney's sister, [[Pam]], came in soon after to have Rodney's arm treated. Ben examined Rodney's arm and said he'd need to learn to replace the dressings while his burn healed. Jim agreed to learn how to do that.

While they waited to hear about Mike, Jim repeatedly offered to help, including offering to get food for Rodney and Pam when they didn't want to leave. However, Rodney, under pressure from Pam, told Jim to leave, saying that all he could think when he looked at Jim was that he almost killed his dad.

Later, when the heard that their dad was going to be okay, Rodney went to call Jim, because he said Jim loved Mike.



He is engaged to [[Jim]].


When their father was injured, his sister pressured him to break things off with Jim, whom she blamed for the accident.

'''Rory Tillerman''' is the son of [[Terrence Tillerman]].


Rory and his family were headed to their grandma's for a Christmas celebration. On the way, they put in a last-minute grocery order, but accidentally put in their home address for delivery. Not wanting them to go without their eggnog, Terrence drove back to the house to retrieve it, but ended up pinned between his car and another that was parked in the driveway.

As firefighters freed him and moved him into the PRT for treatment, Rory and his siblings arrived and embraced their mother. Maya then told them the sirens on the PRT meant that Terrence was alive as he was transported to the hospital. At the hospital, Terrence was taken into surgery and aftward, the whole family was in his room singing Christmas carols.



He lives with his parents and two siblings. Their grandma lives on the other side of town.


*He and his family live at  Christopher Court.
*He likes sports.

'''Rosalind Warren''' is the sister of [[Ben Warren]].



Rosalind says she knew from the age of five that she was a girl. Despite this, she continued to live her life as a boy into adulthood, when she finally decided she wanted to live her life as her true self and be happy.


Rosalind went with her brother, Ben, after their father died to spread his ashes at a place where they frequently camped together, at his request.


After his ashes were spread, Rosalind and Ben raced back up a hill. At the top of the hill, Rosalind was winded and eventually collapsed. She was rushed to the ER, where she refused to cooperate with the doctors, insisting that she was fine despite evidence to the contrary. A test revealed an enlarged spleen, which had to be removed, so [[Meredith Grey|Meredith]] scheduled surgery to do that, but Meredith was also concerned about Rosalind's hormones levels because she appeared male, but had the hormone levels of a young woman. She eventually admitted that she was starting to take hormones to live life as a woman.

While waiting for her surgery, Rosalind started to cough up blood from a bleeding esophagus, which was caused by the off-shelf hormones she'd been taking. She was rushed into surgery to repair the bleeding and remove her spleen. After her surgery, her brother continued to reject her as a woman, asking why she didn't tell him sooner, as they've been close since they were kids. She tried to explain, but Ben stormed out.

[[Miranda Bailey|Bailey]] brought [[Jackson Avery]] in for a plastics consult. Jackson introduced himself and asked for her name, saying he didn't figure she was sticking with Curtis. She told him she had chosen Rosalind and Jackson asked if he could call her that and then explained to her the steps for a healthy transition, saying the off-shelf hormones were done and anything she puts into her body is approved and regulated by the hospital from now on. And he also told her it was time to start seeing a therapist again. ''("[[The Great Pretender]]")''


When an earthquake struck Seattle, Ben was initially reluctant to call his sister because they still hadn't spoken after she came out to him. However, after spending the day working with [[Jackson Avery]], Ben called Rosalind, who had a bookshelf fall at her home, but was okay. ''("[[I Feel the Earth Move]]")''


At the start of the COVID- pandemic, Rosalind came to live at her brother's house to watch their sons while Ben and Bailey both quarantined due to their work. Both boys enjoyed this change and wanted Rosalind to continue to stay with them. Rosalind brought them down to the hospital one evening to clap for the healthcare workers at the hospital along with the firefighters of station . ''("[[Nothing Seems the Same]]")'' ''("[[All Tomorrow's Parties]]")'' 

When Bailey's mother died, Rosalind was there when Ben broke the news to Tuck. She helped Ben to understand that him lashing out at Ben wasn't personal and was merely an artifact of his grief. She encouraged Ben to help him process his grief and talk about his feelings, unlike how he had dealt with his grief when his own mother died when he was a little older than Tuck. ''("[[Out of Control]]")''


After the death of George Floyd, protests cropped around the country, including many in Seattle. Joey and Tuck asked Ben if they could join the protests, saying they wanted to march for themselves and for Rosalind. Rosalind said she'd take the lead from Ben. Ben finally agreed and they marched along the rest of Station . ''("[[Get Up, Stand Up (Station )|Get Up, Stand Up]]")''


Rosalind attended the party Ben and Bailey threw at the station for Pru. ''("[[Crawl Out Through the Fallout]]")''



[[Ben Warren]]
Rosalind is close to her brother, Ben. They shared a room for most of their lives, even into adulthood. Their relationship was strained when Rosalind came out to Ben as transgender. However, they have since rekindled their relationship and Rosalind even lived with Ben for a while. 

[[Miranda Bailey]]
Rosalind gets along well with her sister-in-law, Miranda, who in turn says that Rosalind is a sweetheart. When Miranda learned that Rosalind was transgender, she took the news in stride and supported Rosalind and tried to encourage Ben to be accepting and loving.


*She was  at the time of her splenectomy.

'''Rose''' is a child who was born at Grey Sloan Memorial who later came to the station with her moms.



Her moms planned for her to be born at home in a kiddie pool. However, during labor, her mom, [[Peggy Knox]], panicked, so they moved to the hospital for the birth. The hospital had been hacked, meaning they didn't have access to the painkillers she wanted and she didn't react well when Carina suggested that Dayna stimulate her to climax to relieve her pain. As her labor progressed, she tried to leave the hospital, only to be stopped and told she was crowning. They had her lean over a gurney in the hospital, where she pushed and Rose was born. ''("[[Out of Nowhere]]")''


Rose returned to the hospital with her moms when they were in a car accident. Dayna had had her second chemotherapy session after being fraudulently diagnosed with cancer and vomited in the car, causing Peggy to swerve and hit a tree. The airbags except Dayna's all deployed, so Rose was uninjured. ''("[[Hold Back the River]]")''


Rose was on a walk with her moms near station , when she started fussing because she wanted to get out of the stroller. Once she was out, she refused to talk, so Dayna carried her. Dayna then tripped, but was unable to break her fall because she was carrying Rose, so Peggy reached out her hand to cradle Rose's head, resulting in Dayna injuring her face while Peggy hurt her hand. They walked into the station, where they were both treated while Rose got a firefighter bear to keep her calm and occupied. ''("[[Searching for the Ghost]]")''


*She was the first baby delivered by [[Carina DeLuca]] at [[Grey Sloan Memorial Hospital]].<ref>[[Out of Nowhere]], x (GA)</ref>
*According to her moms, she's very stubborn.<ref>[[Searching for the Ghost]], x (S)</ref>

'''Ruby''' is a woman who cut herself while doing dishes and had to be taken to the hospital.


Ruby was washing dishes at her house when she dropped a glass and cut herself on it trying to catch it. She started bleeding profusely and her cries drew the attention of Andy and Ryan, who were nearby. They tended to Ruby and when they learned she couldn't afford an ambulance ride, Ryan called Pruitt to take her to the hospital off the books. Ryan and Andy stayed behind to watch her two children for her. Ryan played good guys and bad guys with her son [[Milo (Indoor Fireworks)|Milo]]. Later, they were surprised when Milo found a gun in the apartment and pointed it at them as if they were still playing. He then fired the gun, which hit Ryan.



She has two children and struggles to make ends meet. She says their dad is a deadbeat and isn't allowed within  yards of them.

'''Ruth''' is a woman who was rescued after saving her grandchildren during a house fire.


Ruth's son, Jimmy, had been sent out to get supplies for her to make pies. Instead, he sat in the driveway for two hours when the carport collapsed on his car due to the wind storm. His wife, Mary, finally spotted him and called for help. Station  arrived on foot after trees blocked their way and worked to free Jimmy. Mary was irritated at him for running away instead of helping her deal with his mother, Ruth, whom she felt was undermining her parenting. This was affirmed when they heard her over the radio responding immediately when they cried, instead of letting them cry it out. Mary went back inside for her safety while they continued to try to free Jimmy.

However, a spark started a fire in their house. When the team noticed, they jumped into action to rescue the family and put the fire out. Maya had to run back to the truck to get supplies. She sent Ben and Travis in to get Ruth, Mary, and the babies out while Dean and   finished getting Jimmy out. Travis and Ben found Mary trying to go upstairs after the babies, so Travis pulled her out while Ben went upstairs to get the babies. He found Ruth in their nursery holding both of them to her chest. He took the babies from her and told her to follow right behind him. Once the babies were out, Mary and Travis took them to check them over and Ben realized that Ruth hadn't followed him out. Even though Travis warned him to wait for oxygen, Ben took a deep breath and ran back into the house after Ruth. He got to the room, but before he could get her out, the doorway became blocked with flames, trapping them inside. He radioed out with his situation and then waited with Ruth for help.

When Maya returned, she and Vic came inside and carried Ruth out with them right after Ben. Then they were able to focus on putting the house fire out. When Ruth was brought over, Jimmy was concerned about her, but Mary pushed him back, saying Ruth needed air and not to aggravate her.



She and her daughter-in-law often butted heads over care of her grandchildren. After Ruth saved them during a house fire, Mary immediately stood by Ruth, grateful for her help.

'''Ryan Tanner''' was a police officer who often worked closely with the firefighters of [[SFD Station ]] and was childhood best friends with [[Andy Herrera]]. He died after accidentally being shot by a young child who found his mother's gun.



When they were twelve, [[Andy Herrera|Andy]] had the idea to hot wire her father's car.<ref>[[Contain the Flame]], x (S)</ref>

When [[Pruitt Herrera|Pruitt]] went to New York after / to help, Ryan stole his father\us credit card to buy Andy a ticket to get her to New York so she could bring him back home.

On the day of Andy's graduation from the fire academy, Ryan was arrested. He was given one phone call and used it to call Pruitt, who came to bail him out and understood why he hadn't called his father instead.<ref>[[No Recovery]], x (S)</ref>


Ryan responded to a call about an apartment fire. When he responded, he parked his squad car in front of a fire hydrant, so when the SFD responded, Andy used the fire engine to push it out of the way, angering Ryan. When Pruitt collapsed during the fire and Andy started crying worried about him, Ryan was able to get her to calm down. Later, Ryan came over to check on Andy and they had sex.

The next day, Ryan, [[Jack Gibson|Jack]], and [[Andy Herrera|Andy]] freed [[Becca]], who was trapped between two buildings. He also told Andy they didn't have to talk about the sex and they were good.<ref>[[Stuck]], x (S)</ref>

Ryan was the police response to a fire alarm pulled at Stratford Middle School.<ref>[[Invisible to Me]], x (S)</ref>

When Andy was working on an overturned tanker, Ryan went to pick up Pruitt to take him home, but Pruitt insisted on going to the station instead.<ref>[[Invisible to Me]], x (S)</ref>

Ryan then took Pruitt home. After he dropped Pruitt off, he was summarily dismissed.<ref>[[Contain the Flame]], x (S)</ref>

When he arrested Maya's brother, Mason, for shoplifting art supplies, he called her to see him. Maya later opened up to Ryan about how Mason got shafted by their parents because he wasn't the prospect that she was. He agreed to keep an eye out for Mason while he was doing his patrols.<ref>[[Reignited]], x (S)</ref>

Ryan and the other officers helped the SWAT team with a raid to take down a drug dealer. Maya and Andy provided an Aid Car backup just in case anyone got hurt. When an officer was shot, they called in the car after the arrests had been made.<ref>[[Shock to the System (S)|Shock to the System]], x (S)</ref>

When Andy had to go through The Incinerator, Ryan gave her a good luck charm they'd passed back and forth as kids. At the end of the day, she returned it and told him it hadn't gone well.<ref>[[Stronger Together]], x (S)</ref>

When the police and fire departments had to work together for a disaster-preparedness drill, Jack developed a plan. Ryan didn't like the plan and saw many issues with it.<ref>[[Let It Burn]], x (S)</ref>

A fire started at Flanner's restaurant and quickly spread to the rest of the strip mall. The police department was called to respond. Ryan rushed in to help evacuate, despite not wearing turnout gear. They evacuated all the survivors they could quickly while Maya, Dean, Vic, and Travis set up the lines to douse the fire. Once the structure became too unstable to continue, they prepared to start the water and ended evacuations. They then noticed a woman on the balcony holding a baby. Jack took the ladder from the engine over to her, but it took time and so Ryan asked the woman to toss down her baby, so she'd be ready to jump to Jack when he got close enough. After some hesitation, she tossed down her baby and he caught it. Then she was able to jump onto the ladder with Jack and was taken safely to the ground. Ryan and Jack shook hands and each agreed the other had done good work.<ref>[[Let It Burn]], x (S)</ref>

Ryan and [[Karen Reis]] responded to a  call from [[Oliver (Hot Box)|Oliver]], who complained that his wife, [[Audrey (Hot Box)|Audrey]], had started a fire to burn his stuff. After Station  arrived to deal with the fire, Ryan, Karen, Audrey, and some of the firefighters ended up trapped in the garage due to Audrey's advanced security system. With the fire in the house, the garage started to heat up. They searched for anything they could use to try to free themselves. They found a toolkit, which Karen used to pick the lock on the trunk of the car and retrieve a jack. They tried to use the jack to lift the garage door, but it wouldn't budge. As the temperature climbed, Ryan decided to hot wire the car and try to use it as a battering ram. Jack said it was a bad idea, but Ryan started it anyway. Andy was able to stop him before he moved the car. Jack had the idea to use the motor from the internal door to get access to the house. It didn't work and they started to wear out. When Pruitt arrived and gave Andy a pep talk, she used the last of her energy to think of a plan. She saw the water heater and decided they could use the pilot light to create an explosion. They siphoned gas from the car and rigged the water heater up to explode and propel itself through the garage door. It worked and once they were free, they were all cooled down and rehydrated.<ref>[[Hot Box]], x (S)</ref>


Ryan and other cops went over to the skyscraper fire and stepped in to help out. He was eventually sent out by Ripley, who didn't want anyone in the building for too long. He went from there to Station  to pick up Pruitt, who was having trouble breathing. He found Bailey there, also looking for Pruitt. They found Pruitt not breathing and pulseless. Bailey started CPR and Ryan drove his car as close in as he could to get Pruitt out.<ref>[[Not Your Hero]], x (S)</ref>

Ryan and Bailey got Pruitt to the hospital, where she immediately started tending to him. He was quickly stabilized. A clot had gotten to his heart, which is why he was having trouble breathing. Ryan also learned that this was a good thing. The chemo caused the clot, but it was also working on the cancer. He was only a few treatments away from remission.<ref>[[No Recovery]], x (S)</ref>

When [[Max Forrester]] disappeared from Grey Sloan Memorial, Ryan and the SMPD were called out to find him. Ryan and [[Brit Logue]] spotted Max walking along the street and called out to him. This spooked Max, who then ran into a storm drain and got swept away. Ryan called it in as a Search and Rescue. He then helped the firefighters' efforts to find and recover Max.<ref>[[Under the Surface]], x (S)</ref>

In order to foster cooperation between the fire department and police department, Sullivan sent Jack on a ride-along with Ryan. Ryan told Jack he wasn't allowed to leave the squad car for any reason because he was a civilian. They were on traffic duty. They first pulled over [[Vince (Home To Hold Onto)|Vince]], who was speeding to get home because he had burned himself on hot coffee and wasn't wearing pants or underwear. Jack used the megaphone to ask Vince about his burn and then advised him that he'd need medical attention and offered a police escort to the hospital. After that was complete, Ryan pulled over [[Gregory Dougal]], who was also speeding. He said he was on the way to a birthday party with his daughter, [[Lindy Dougal|Lindy]]. Ryan said he'd be right back and went back to the squad car. He immediately radioed in to say he suspected a child abduction. Jack was shocked that Ryan had figured that out based just on the traffic stop. Ryan pointed out what he'd seen and confirmed that there was an Amber alert out for Lindy, who was the subject of a custody dispute. They waited for backup, but when Gregory clearly became restless, Ryan went over to the car and calmly told him not to do what he was planning because it wouldn't end well for him. He was able to talk Gregory into surrendering. Jack sat with Lindy until her mom came. The mom thanked him, even though he tried to tell her that Ryan was actually the hero. When Jack told Ryan about that, he said he's used to it because cops aren't seen as the heroes like firefighters are.<ref>[[Home To Hold Onto]], x (S)</ref>


At a bust, Ryan noticed a familiar cigar burning on the poker table. He then went to find his father, Greg, whom he suspected was nearby. He found Greg hiding and Greg, surprised to see him, immediately said he'd give them whatever information he had in order to make a deal. Ryan said they weren't after him and he'd just have to give a statement. After giving his statement, he asked Ryan for a ride. Ryan tried to decline, but ended up taking Greg to his next call, where he left Greg in the back seat while he interviewed someone who claimed to have been robbed. Greg told Ryan that the guy hadn't been robbed and explained why. Ryan then revealed he knew the whole time, because Greg had taught him to think like a criminal his whole life. At the end of the day, Greg told Ryan that he wanted to grow a relationship with Ryan, but Ryan said he didn't need one or want one.<ref>[[Lost and Found]], x (S)</ref>

The firefighters of station  held a training session for the police officers, teaching them first aid and CPR. Ryan ended up in Andy and Vic's group. Andy showed him how to do compressions and set him up on a dummy, telling him to do compressions until it beeped back to life. He did many compressions, before stopping and saying the dummy must be broken because Andy wouldn't let him stop.<ref>[[Do a Little Harm...]], x (S)</ref>

His father said he wanted to meet with Ryan and Ryan asked Andy to meet with him. They met at a coffee shop, but after  minutes, his dad hadn't shown up, so Ryan decided to leave because he said he was tired of waiting for his father. Later, Greg showed up at the station injured looking for Pruitt. He told Ryan and Andy that he got in the middle of a fight when he tried to help a kid and his phone was broken. Ryan didn't believe him. <ref>[[Last Day on Earth]], x (S)</ref>

While at Friendsgiving with his father, Ryan found out there was a warrant for Greg's arrest. The FBI was involved in the case as well. He went to Pruitt with the information, but Pruitt said he wouldn't tell anyone if he just wanted to enjoy the day with his father. When the firefighters were called away due to the windstorm, Greg had the idea for the rest of them to bring Friendsgiving to the station. While they waited for the others to return, they played cards and reminisced. At the end of the day, Ryan went to Greg and showed him the warrant. Then he said he could arrest Greg and take him in or Greg could leave, no questions asked, but Ryan would never see him again.<ref>[[Weather the Storm]], x (S)</ref>

Greg told Ryan to turn him in and Ryan agreed, but said they were still grounded because of the storm, so they went back to the party. Ryan kept putting off arresting Greg, even as Greg told him to do it.<ref>[[Crash and Burn]], x (S)</ref>

Four months later, Ryan attended the ceremony where Andy was awarded a medal of valor. When she ran out of the room abruptly without a word, he knew she felt guilty and didn't feel she deserved an award. Later that day, at the party celebrating Andy's medal, the two of them had sex.<ref>[[Crash and Burn]], x (S)</ref>

Ryan was surprised when he saw Greg, as Greg was supposed to disappear. He gave Ryan the key to a storage locker, saying he wants him to have it. Ryan then went to [[Seattle Presbyterian Hospital]], where [[Margaret Chen]] was waiting to be arrested after escaping custody. Margaret asked Andy for just a few minutes to say goodbye to her son, who was having surgery and worried he'd die without getting to see her again. Ryan agreed and took her inside to see her son. Then he arrested her and brought her out of the hospital. He then went to the storage locker, where he found a large amount of money, which Greg swore was clean. He told Ryan to use it for the mortgage.<ref>[[I Fought the Law]], x (S)</ref>


When Pruitt put his house on the market, he immediately started getting offers. He enlisted Ryan's help to look into all the potential buyers' criminal histories. He also confessed to Ryan that he felt he'd become too comfortable in the house and he wanted to move forward.<ref>[[Crazy Train]], x (S)</ref>


At the scene of a call, Maya asked him if he would be over later for a booty call with Andy. As there was some awkward chatter, with Ryan saying that wasn't sure yet, Maya stressed that booty calls could be just that. After Maya walked off, Ryan told Andy he might be over but she said she might be busy that night. That night, as the women headed to a bar, they ran into Ryan, who introduced his colleague [[Jenna Matson]] to Andy as his friend.<ref>[[Baby Boom]], x (S)</ref>

Before work, Ryan sought out Ben at the station to inquire about getting EMT-certified like Jenna. Since Ben was swamped, he directed Ryan to Andy. At work, Jenna told Ryan that she was free after shift. As he expressed interest in a second date, Pruitt came bursting in to talk to Ryan about Andy, whom Pruitt assumed had come to Ryan to talk about her catching her father with [[Reggie]]. Ryan said he hadn't had any contact with Andy at all recently. While out at a scene, Jenna questioned if Ryan's long history with Andy was what made him hesitant to go on another date with her. She made it clear her invitation for the date didn't stand if Andy was still a thing for him. He told her she wasn't. He then approached Andy, who was surprised that he finally wanted to get his EMT-certificate per Jenna's suggestion despite Andy having told him to get it about a hundred times before. Ryan told Andy that they had to stop sleeping together since he was going on a second date with Jenna. She understood and wished him good luck. Ryan and Jenna went to have dinner at a restaurant and they had a nice time.<ref>[[When It Rains, It Pours!]], x (S)</ref>

Ryan and Jenna responded to a call of kid gone missing in his building in the middle of a black-out. They met up with the crew from Station . Per [[Kathleen Noonan|Kathleen's]] suggestion, the police officers each paired up with a firefighter to search the building. Jack picked Ryan, who feared things would get tense between Andy and Jenna. Andy and Jenna found the kid stuck in the industrial washer in the basement. Ryan and Jack fetched the extraction tools. Ryan then aided in the building's evacuation. After the call, Kathleen and Ryan joined the crew for drinks. Ryan was surprised to see that Andy and Kathleen actually got along really well. Jack wished him good luck with that.<ref>[[The Dark Night]], x (S)</ref>

At a scene, Andy overheard how Ryan defended her father when his new EMT colleague was disrespectful to him. Andy later thanked him for that.<ref>[[Friendly Fire]], x (S)</ref>

After a coffee plant fire, Station  responded to a call about a civilian climbing up on a cell tower. Ryan met the crew at the scene. Vic climbed the tower to talk the civilian into coming down with her. On the ground, Andy arrived to inform Vic that [[Lucas Ripley]] had been exposed to a potent toxin at the coffee plant fire. While Ryan thought it was too perilous to switch Vic out, Robert overruled him and the crew enacted the switch. After Andy successfully got the woman down, Ryan joined the firefighters at the hospital, where they all waited outside as Vic spent time with Ripley in his dying moments. While they were waiting, Ryan noticed how Andy held Robert's hand to comfort him. Ryan immediately figured out that Andy had feelings for him. He asked Maya how long that had been going on but Maya told him it was new to her too.<ref>[[Always Ready]], x (S)</ref>


With a wildfire raging in Los Angeles, Ryan dropped off supplies at the station as a contribution to the Seattle Fire Department's efforts to support LAFD. He informed Andy that the day after Ripley's funeral, he would move to San Diego for a few months with Jenna as they had both been accepted into a tactical paramedic program. She told him she was happy for him and he replied he was happy for her and Sullivan, too, having seen them holding hands after Ripley's death. She claimed there was nothing going on and left for a call on the aid car. After the funeral, Ryan hung out at the wake with the firefighters. He complimented Robert on his moving eulogy and they played shuffleboard together.<ref>[[For Whom the Bell Tolls]], x (S)</ref> 

On the morning of his departure, Ryan called Pruitt to come collect Travis from jail after his bar brawl with [[Jeremy Heffington]]. Pruitt took advantage of his leaving to hitch a ride for Travis and himself to Los Angeles, following the crew of Station , which had been deployed to aid in battling the wildfires. As they neared the city, Ryan confessed being anxious over approaching a wildfire with all his possessions in his car. As Ryan said he'd be gone for a while if the training went well, Pruitt grunted, which Travis translated to Pruitt telling him he would miss him. The three of them arrived at the basecamp and found out that Station  was isolated in a neighborhood. While looking for their badges, Pruitt found Ryan's bag with the money he had been given by his father. He advised Ryan not to let his father's bad decisions ruin his life and throw the money away, figuring he would be arrested if he used it. Ryan aided in saving the crew by boasting the communication system, which he had read up in preparation for his training. With Andy safe back at the tent, she said goodbye to him, wondering what life would be like without having him around the corner. He pointed out she had moved on a while ago. She told him to be safe, after which he left. Once he was by himself, he went to burn the money but decided against it at the last moment, taking it with him to San Diego.<ref>[[Into the Wildfire]], x (S)</ref>

At one point, Pruitt paid Ryan a surprise visit to tell him something. Over drinks and Pruitt's medical marijuana, Pruitt revealed that he had cancer and that he was not going to have chemo, because chances were it wouldn't work and he didn't want to die while sick from the chemo. They laughed about it while high. Later, Pruitt said that he was going to die soon and he needed for Ryan to take care of Andy since Ryan would be the only one she would have left. Ryan agreed to his request. Pruitt said he couldn't tell Andy yet because she would harass him for not getting chemo. Ryan reminded Pruitt that he had a girlfriend and Andy had her own romantic issues going on. Pruitt told Ryan to always the girl how he felt so he wouldn't end up with regrets.<ref>[[Eulogy]], x (S)</ref>

[[File:Sx-.jpg|thumb|Ryan returns to Seattle.]]
Two weeks later, Ryan showed up on Andy's doorstep as a surprise but his welcome was cut short when a neighbor started screaming. He and Andy ran over to the apartment. [[Milo (Indoor Fireworks)|Milo]] let them in and they found his mother, [[Ruby (Indoor Fireworks)|Ruby]], bleeding in the kitchen whilst holding her baby. Ruby had cut her wrist on a broken wine glass while doing the dishes. While Andy had her lie down, Ryan took the baby and tried to reach  but they kept putting him on hold. Ruby was also afraid she couldn't afford the ambulance ride. Andy then had Ryan call her father, whom she assured Ruby would keep it off the books. Pruitt and his partner came to fetch Ruby. Ryan distracted Milo by playing cops and robbers with him. Ryan assured Pruitt he was staying out of trouble and they agreed to meet up for beers later. Ryan and Andy stayed behind in the apartment to watch the kids when Pruitt took Ruby to the hospital. Once they were gone, Ryan asked about her fight with her father. Ryan handed Milo to play with his badge. He then talked about Pruitt being his hero, which caused Andy to open up. She told him her father had basically called her a slut for getting involved with Sullivan. Later, while Milo was watching cartoons, Andy inquired about his return to Seattle. He said Jenna had cheated on him to hurt him, as he had admitted the day before that he was still in love with his ex, Andy. Andy didn't know how to respond. However, Milo appeared with his mother's gun aimed at them. He was still playing cops and robbers, unaware of the real danger. Ryan jumped in front of Andy as Milo fired the gun at her. Andy quickly put the gun away and called . Since she was put on hold too, she called Pruitt while applying pressure to the wound and begged her father to come back.<ref>[[Indoor Fireworks]], x (S)</ref>

Pruitt and his partner came to load up Ryan. The monitor showed that he was flatlining. They rushed him to the hospital, where he passed away.<ref>[[Eulogy]], x (S)</ref>


[[File:Sx-.jpg|thumb|Ryan and Andy watch planes in her dream.]]
Whilst mourning her father, Andy had a series of lively dreams. In one of them, she relived a childhood memory with Ryan of them lying on top of his car to watch planes. In the dream, Ryan told Andy that people are sad to say goodbye when planes with loved ones take off, but that there are also happy people at arrivals waiting for their loved ones. The two of them then waved at the planes. Andy then saw that her hand was covered in blood, like when she was trying to save Ryan. She turned toward him and he told her he was okay. They shared a kiss and she told him she had never wanted to live without him.<ref>[[Dream a Little Dream of Me]], x (S)</ref>





[[Andy Herrera]]
He went to prom with [[Andy Herrera]]. As adults, after she found out her father had cancer, they had sex when he came to her house to check on her.<ref>[[Stuck]], x (S)</ref>

After learning that Pruitt still saw him as the kid who stole Pruitt's car, Ryan went to Andy to make sure she knew that he wasn't a kid anymore.<ref>[[Contain the Flame]], x (S)</ref>

Before The Incinerator, Ryan gave Andy a good luck charm, a small world that they'd passed back and forth as kids when either of them was going through something hard.<ref>[[Stronger Together]], x (S)</ref>

After the strip mall fire, Ryan came to Andy, pumped about what he'd done. He was exhilarated and he and Andy started kissing and undressing each other.<ref>[[Let It Burn]], x (S)</ref>

They continued having sex regularly in the mornings.<ref>[[Every Second Counts]], x (S)</ref> However, when Andy learned that Ryan deliberately didn't tell her that her dad was in trouble during the skyscraper fire, she ended things with him, saying they always ended up in the same pattern of him protecting her when she didn't need it.<ref>[[No Recovery]], x (S)</ref>

Months later, after she received a Medal of Valor for her actions during the windstorm, she and Ryan hooked up at her party.<ref>[[Crash and Burn]], x (S)</ref> They continued hooking up, but Andy stopped any conversation of their status.<ref>[[I Fought the Law]], x (S)</ref> Later, after hearing Pruitt talk about getting too comfortable and wanting to move forward instead of backward, he asked Andy if he was just a security blanket for her.<ref>[[Crazy Train]], x (S)</ref>

[[Jenna Matson]]
After wondering if he was just Andy's security blanket, Ryan starting seeing Jenna, a fellow officer.<ref>[[Baby Boom]], x (S)</ref> After some time, Jenna told him she was cheating on him. Ryan claims she intentionally wanted to hurt him.<ref>[[Indoor Fireworks]], x (S)</ref>


He has a rocky relationship with his father, [[Greg Tanner|Greg]].


[[Jack Gibson]]
After Jack went on a ride-along with him, they buried the hatchet and went to Dean's after work to share a drink and hang out.<ref>[[Home To Hold Onto]], x (S)</ref>





He was a police officer with the Seattle Police Department.


*His parents lived next door to Andy and Pruitt Herrera.<ref>[[Stuck]], x (S)</ref>
*He spent time in juvie as a kid.<ref>[[Stronger Together]], x (S)</ref>
*He took his coffee with one sugar.<ref>[[Last Day on Earth]], x (S)</ref>

'''Sam''' is a woman who was impaled on a tree while skydiving.


Sam was skydiving, something she did often in an attempt to work up the courage to take her shot at becoming a journalist, when something went wrong with her parachute and she landed in a tree, where she was impaled on some branches. A bystander called and station  arrived. While they prepared to go up into the tree to help her, Sam regained consciousness and began to panic. Andy talked to her from the ground, trying to calm her. She sent Theo and Maddox up to start cutting the branches so they could get Sam out of the tree. While they worked, Maddox dropped his saw, which made Sam panic. Andy decided to go up the ladder so she could talk to Sam face-to-face. She talked to Sam until they had cut all the branches. As they loaded her onto the stretcher, she coded and Andy started compressions, which she continued as they got her to the ground and into the aid car. Despite their best efforts, Sam died.


She was a waitress. She wanted to be a journalist, but could never work up the courage.

{{Character Family Infobox |image = SxSandraAlvarez.png |name = Sandra Alvarez |status = Alive |marital = [[Johnny Alvarez]] ''(husband)'' |children = [[Michelle Alvarez]] |parents = Margarita |siblings = [[Elena Herrera]] |other family = *[[Andy Herrera]] ''(niece)'' *[[Pruitt Herrera]] \u ''(brother-in-law)'' |first appearance = [[Bad Guy]] ''(voice only)''
[[Louder Than a Bomb]] |count = |seasons = '''[[Station |S]]:''' [[Season (Station )|]], [[Season (Station )|]], and [[Season (Station )|]] |portrayed by = [[Laura Ceron]] }} '''Sandra Alvarez''' is Andy's aunt. When Sandra's daughter, Michelle, and her sister's daughter, Andy, were young, they were very close. ''("[[Bad Guy]]")'' One day, a fire started at Sandra's house. Pruitt and the rest of station responded to the call and quickly put out the fire. ''("[[Louder Than a Bomb]]")'' Andy came home from school one day with a skinned knee because a boy in her class was harassing her. Johnny said it was because he liked her, but Elena snapped at him not to tell her daughter that. Sandra tried to defend Johnny, saying that's just what people said, but Elena was firm that she didn't want her daughter getting that message. Sandra was horrified when Elena said to hit him back the next time he harassed her. ''("[[When the Party's Over]]")'' After Pruitt died, Andy was going through his things when she started to remember how close their family was. She called Sandra, but didn't get an answer. She continued to call Sandra until Sandra finally called back and said she was on her way to Seattle and wanted to see Andy in person to talk to her. Andy went to meet up with Sandra and was surprised to learn that her mother, whom she believed to be dead, was actually alive. ''("[[Louder Than a Bomb]]")'' Andy quickly started having a panic attack at the realization. When she had calmed down somewhat, Sandra begged her to hear her mother out. Instead, she ran outside and started hyperventilating again. Sandra expressed regret for not having told Andy sooner. She encouraged Andy to listen to Elena, which she did. After listening to Elena's explanation for why she left, Andy left, telling Elena to have Sandra call her, as she'd tried to maintain a relationship with Andy while Elena hadn't. Sandra later virtually attended Pruitt's funeral. ''("[[Nothing Seems the Same]]")'' Wanting to form a relationship with what family she had left, Andy met them at a park to have a barbecue. They updated her on their lives and their extended family's lives. They also told Andy that they'd mildly stalked her throughout her life, attending her fire academy graduation and salsa competitions. They hadn't kept in touch because the last time they saw each other, Michelle had told Andy about seeing her mom after Andy believed her mother was dead. Over the course of the day, the family caught up and expressed regrets for how things had gone. At the end of the day, they decided they needed to continue to meet up. ''("[[Wild World]]")'' When Carina set up a drive-through COVID testing site sponsored by the [[Catherine Fox Foundation]] at the station, Johnny, Sandra, and Michelle came, using it as an excuse to meet Robert, whom they hadn't met despite having regular meetings with Andy in the park. They chatted jovially with Robert while he did their swabs. ''("[[Save Yourself]]")'' She is married to [[Johnny Alvarez]]. She was very close to her sister and her sister's family when their daughters were young. Her relationship with her daughter was somewhat strained when her daughter came out. Over time, she got more used to the idea, but still thought her daughter might end up straight after all.''("[[Wild World]]")'' *She lived at Briyton Commons in Seattle.[[Bad Guy]], x (S) *Her phone number is --.[[Bad Guy]], x (S) *She and her family have barbecues in the park every weekend.[[Wild World]], x (S) SxSandraAlvarez.png|[[Louder Than a Bomb]] SxSandraAlvarez.png|[[Nothing Seems the Same]] SxSandraAlvarez.png|[[Wild World]] SxSandraAlvarez.png|[[Save Yourself]] Sx-.jpg Sx-.jpg Sx-.jpg Sx-.jpg {{Sandra Alvarez Appearances}} {{Scrollbox}} [[de:Sandra Alvarez]] {{DEFAULTSORT:Alvarez, Sandra}} [[Category:Characters]] [[Category:S Characters]] [[Category:S S Characters]] [[Category:S S Characters]] [[Category:S S Characters]] [[Category:S Rescuees]]

'''Sarah''' is the sister of [[Joey Phillips]].



While out patrolling, Jack and Ben noticed Sarah, standing in an alley with blood on her clothes. Jack got out and tried to follow her, but she ran away without saying anything, leaving behind her stuffed bear. Jack saw her again at the homeless camp and she told him that they told her not to get help, but her brother was dying. She led them to [[Joey Phillips]], who was injured when he fell through a floor in an old warehouse while looking for a place for them to sleep because Sarah's always cold. They noted that his collarbone was fractured and he was altered. They prepared to take him to the hospital, but he objected, as did the other kids. Sarah said some of them were bio siblings and some were foster. They ran away when their foster dad got arrested and if the state found them, they'd be split up. Joey was keeping them together. They had to intubate Joey and then they took him to the hospital. Jack instructed the other kids how to get to Grey Sloan Memorial and told them to meet Joey there. They ran to the hospital alongside the ambulance and when they got there, they ran inside and sat together in the waiting room for news about Joey. ''("[[House Where Nobody Lives]]")''

They were later taken by social workers. ''("[[Save the Last Dance for Me]]")''

When Joey refused to do his physical therapy because he felt guilty for being safe and warm while he didn't know the same was true for his siblings, Bailey made some calls and arranged for them to come to the hospital to have pizza and play video games with him. They all assured Joey they were happy and safe in their new foster homes. ''("[[A Diagnosis]]")''


As a surprise for Joey, Ben arranged for Sarah, Ernie, and Frank to come to the push-in for the new engine. He hadn't seen them in months, but knew Sarah and Frank were with a family outside the city. ''("[[Too Darn Hot]]")''



Her birth mother died. Afterward, she spent time in foster care. At some point, she ended up in a house with [[Joey Phillips]], [[Frank]], and [[Ernie (House Where Nobody Lives)|Ernie]]. When their foster father was arrested, they ran away together and started living on the streets. They were split up again when Joey was hospitalized and social services was called for the other three.

After they were separate, Sarah ended up in a foster home where she had her own room with a purple bed. ''("[[A Diagnosis]]")''

'''Sarla''' was one of the passengers on the train with a bird flu outbreak.


Sarla was on a subway when the train stalled. Some of the passengers were injured, so Maya and Jack were called in to treat them. Soon after arriving, they discovered that [[Will (Crazy Train)|Will]] and [[Neil]], who had just gotten off a flight from Bashran, had signs of avian flu. They called in the CDC and announced the situation to the passengers. While they waited for the CDC to arrive, Neil and Will both declined, as well as another passenger, [[Reese]], who was hit by a taser and had a cardiac episode. Because they were both occupied, Maya and Jack asked the passengers for help and Sarla ended up using an ambu bag to keep Neil breathing. When she saw that it wasn't giving him air, she removed the bag and gave him breaths directly with her mouth. He started breathing again and the CDC arrived and were able to evacuate and decontaminate all the passengers.



Every day, Sarla rides the same subway train as [[Neil]]. Despite her being attracted to him, she never made a move.


*She used to be a lifeguard.

'''Sasha Bennett''' is a woman who came into the station with an earring stuck in her ear.



Sasha came into the station because she had fallen asleep wearing diamond earrings and woke up with it wrapped in her hair. She worried about breaking the earrings if she tried to pull it out herself, so she went to fire station , where Dean was able to remove it. He then disinfected the wound and told her to keep doing that for a few days. As she left, she spotted the firefighter calendars and bought one. When she handed over the money, she also gave Dean her number. ''("[[The Ghosts That Haunt Me]]")''


At the onset of the Covid- pandemic, Sasha offered to stay with Dean and help him care for Pru, a situation Dean spent some time debating. ''("[[Nothing Seems the Same]]")''

Soon afterward, the two of them broke up. ''("[[Wild World]]")''



She started seeing Dean after meeting him at the station when he removed an earring from her ear. ''("[[Louder Than a Bomb]]")''


She has a set of diamond earrings that belonged to her grandmother. ''("[[The Ghosts That Haunt Me]]")''

'''Scott Burke''' is a man who was attacked by a bear while camping.


Scott and his wife, Rachel, were on a camping trip together. They had spent $, on equipment because Scott always wanted to try camping, though Rachel admitted she would have preferred to go to Italy. They saw the crew of station  as the walked through toward their own campsite. The next morning, the firefighters were awakened by screams coming from the Burkes' camp. He had been making coffee when a black bear attacked them, tearing off Scott's nose and severing an artery in Rachel's arm. The team put a tourniquet on Rachel's arm, packed Scott's face, and then carried them down to the parking lot, where the ambulance picked them up and took them to the hospital. The nose was later located and taken to the hospital so it could be reattached. ''("[[Into the Woods]]")''

At the hospital, Rachel and Scott both immediately went into surgery. Rachel's brachial artery was repaired and Scott's nose was temporarily attached to his arm, so that his face would have time to heal before it was reattached there. Rachel had to have a second surgery the next day to wash out her wounds to prevent infection. She was told she'd be okay after some rehab. Scott, on the other hand, coded after his surgery due to bleeding in his chest and was able to be resuscitated. Rachel was devastated to learn he'd died and pushed Brian, her secret lover, away. ''("[[A Diagnosis]]")''



He was married to [[Rachel Burke]] until his death. He was unaware that she was cheating on him for some time with [[Brian (A Diagnosis)|Brian]].

'''Scott Hanson''' is a doctor who was telling patients they had cancer when they didn't.


After hearing about questionable medical practices from Dr. Hanson, Arizona and Owen posed as a married couple and went to his office to check it out. He did an ultrasound of Arizona's breasts and showed her on the monitor where there was a lesion. Panicked, they rushed back to Grey Sloan where a second ultrasound showed no lesion and no concern. He had faked the ultrasound image in her case as well as others and then subjected them to chemotherapy just to pocket the extra money. Owen went back to his office and got a bag of chemo drugs ready to injected into Scott, but stopped as police arrived and told Scott he had called them.


He's an [[Attending|attending]] [[Oncology|oncologist]]. He used his influence to give many patients false cancer diagnoses so he could make money off the chemotherapy they didn't need.


*He had a five-star Yelp rating.
*He's not a member of the American Society of Clinical Oncology.

'''Sean''' is a kid who was stuck in a building after it caught fire.


Sean was asleep when the building he was squatting in caught on fire. By the time he was awakened, the building was engulfed in flames and he was having trouble breathing. He was found by Jack and then evacuated. Jack tried to treat his burns, but he resisted and said he didn't need any help. Jack then talked him through how to treat his own burns and gave him supplies. He was preparing to show him how to wrap his own bandages when he was called back into the building. He told Sean he'd be right back, but when he returned, Sean was gone and an EMT said he'd left right after Jack did despite their attempts to help him.



Sean, [[Brian (Lost and Found)|Brian]], [[Tori (Lost and Found)|Tori]], and [[Zoe]] became close as they all squatted in a building together while experiencing homelessness. Zoe was upset to know that the police would separate them after the fire.
