'''Sean Beckett''' is the fire captain who replaced Maya as captain of station .



After Maya was relieved of her duties, Beckett was sent to station  to replace her. Despite this change in leadership, Maya reflexively tried to act as captain on multiple occasions, which irritated Beckett. About ten months after this change, station  worked the Phoenix Fair, handing out water and providing cooling shelter for anyone who needed it to avoid overheating. As they worked, he was condescending to Maya and made sexist remarks about her.

When [[Will]], who was high on mushrooms, climbed into the fire engine and drove off in a misguided attempt to get his injured friend help, Maya pointed out that Beckett had failed to secure it when they arrived to avoid that. Shortly after he took off, Will drove into an intersection, where the engine was t-boned by a delivery van and tipped on its side, blocking traffic on all sides. The firefighters immediately stepped in to free Will, which required them to remove the windshield. When Andy came over to help them, she noticed that the engine was leaking fuel out into the road. However, Beckett said they couldn't deal with that as the foam required to neutralize it was on the engine. After they had pulled Will out of the engine to safety, Beckett ordered Maya and Andy to climb the engine to retrieve the foam, which was in a compartment that was jammed shut. As they worked to get it, a parade, which included fire jugglers, approached. Sullivan tried to get them to stop, but one of the jugglers dropped his torch, igniting the fuel and forcing Andy and Maya to jump to safety. They then watched helplessly as the engine went up in flames. The other members of station  arrived soon after and Andy helped them put the fire out. The team was upset by the loss of their engine, but back at the station, Beckett called them to line up and told them it was a win because there was no loss of life and they should celebrate that. ''("[[Phoenix from the Flame]]")''


Station  was called out to a house fire. When they arrived, Beckett sent Travis, Jack, and Sullivan into the basement to get water on the fire while Ben and Maya went to cut a ventilation hole above it. When Travis, Jack, and Sullivan stopped responding on the radio, Ben and Maya went to them and found them passed out on the floor. Ben and Maya soon passed out themselves, just as Sullivan was waking up. Sullivan got them out one at a time. Station  arrived as backup and Beckett ordered a surround and drown to put out the fire. He also said anyone who'd been inside the house needed to go to the hospital to be cleared before going home.

The next morning, Beckett came to [[Emerald City Bar]] to celebrate the call with his team, but met Andy Herrera outside and ended up leaving with her instead. ''("[[Can't Feel My Face]]")''


As a historic heat wave swept through Seattle, Beckett prepared the team for the push-in for their new engine. He assigned Maya to speak at the public debut, with the reasoning that it would prove they "have girls here." When Maya gave a quick speech, he rushed her along and people started to surround the engine to push it in. However, the first few people to touch the engine burned their hands as the engine's metal had warmed significantly in the heat. They quickly cancelled the push-in and brought everyone inside the firehouse, where they began treating people for overheating and dehydration.

Later, station  responded to a call where three cars were crashed together after the head caused the road to swell and break. Beckett oversaw as the trapped passengers were extracted from their vehicles and taken to the hospital for evaluation. When a call came asking if the Crisis One personnel were available, Beckett said they weren't as he said the car accident was an all hands situation. ''("[[Too Darn Hot]]")''


In order to expand Crisis One to the entire SFD, Dean arranged for Diane to train them all in conflict resolution and how to deal with a variety of scenarios they might see. For the first scenario, she asked Andy and Sullivan to play a married couple with a domestic dispute. She was unaware they were separated. She played the responder in the scenario. When Sullivan had to leave to respond to a call, Theo took his place and the scenario continued. Vic swapped in as the responder, but this ended with her and Theo flirting. Dean suggested he pick the pairings to avoid interpersonal relationships, which Diane agreed to. Next, he had Jack and Maddox play co-workers, the latter of whom had locked himself in the conference room. Dean played the responder. When Maddox got very hammy, Dean accused him of not taking it seriously, so Diane called for them to take a break. For another scenario, Aquino was having a crisis and Ben played the responder and was able to talk him through it. They continued their training and at the end of the day, Diane felt they were prepared to work with the program. ''("[[% or Nothing]]")''


Shortly after an explosion shook station , they were called to a nearby street where there was ruin. Beckett sent the team to set up triage and begin evacuation while he spoke with [[Larry (Season )|Larry]], a landscaper who was digging when he hit the gas main and caused the explosion. Since the gas was still flowing and feeding the fires, Beckett called for backup, which station  provided. Once some houses were evacuated, they started fighting the fires. Vic was spraying a house from above using the ladder when she was electrocuted by a downed power line. Dean rushed up to her and was able to get her breathing again. Sullivan then asked Beckett if he could try shutting off the valve to cut the gas supply as emergency response wouldn't be able to get there for a while. Beckett initially refused, but when Maya assured him they could do it safely, he let them try, but warned them not to use any heroics. They reported back that the valve had signs of corrosion, so the risk might still be present. By that point, [[Fire Chief McCallister]] had arrived and Beckett handed over command of the scene and joined the evacuation efforts. As they approached a house at the front, Dean warned that the house might be full of gas. Beckett tried to warn Aquino, but he wasn't fast enough and an explosion threw them all back, seriously injuring Aquino and killing Dean. ''("[[Things We Lost in the Fire (Station )|Things We Lost in the Fire]]")''


On Thanksgiving, Beckett stayed mostly away from the rest of the team. When he came into the beanery after a small fire set off the sprinklers, he slipped and fell on the water.

Later, while the rest of the station shared their thanksgiving meal, Andy brought him a piece of pie and asked why he wasn't joining them. He told her he didn't want to intrude on their thing and said if he'd died in the explosion, the only people who would have cared were the other firefighters, but they would have been too busy mourning the guy they actually liked. He then asked Andy again to take her out for a drink. She said things were still messy with Sullivan and it wasn't a good idea. ''("[[Little Girl Blue]]")''

At the end of a shift, which included fighting a large house fire, Beckett awkwardly told Maya, Ben, and Travis that he understood they were missing some of their friends and he hoped they would return soon. ''("[[A House Is Not a Home]]")''


When station  responded to a call to find [[Terrence Tillerman]] trapped between two vehicles in his driveway, Beckett supervised as they assessed Terrence's condition and then stabilized the vehicles so they wouldn't move. When Ben determined that Terrence would die before they could get him to the hospital once they moved the car pinning him, Ben asked Beckett to see if the new fire chief would authorize them to use the PRT, as it was the only way to save his life. He made some calls and finally got use of the PRT authorized after Ben had already called Andy to bring it. Once it arrived, Carina helped prepare it and then they moved the car and freed Terrence. Once he was stabilized in the PRT, they took him to the hospital. Bailey later informed the team that he had lived. ''("[[All I Want for Christmas is You]]")''


After settling in, [[Natasha Ross]], the new fire chief, came to visit station . She met some of the firefighters and then told Beckett that she'd been brought in to right some wrongs. She told him he'd evaded demotion a few times. She said that was fine because she believed in second chances, but advised him he'd already gotten his. She decided to stay at  for the day, accompanying them out on a call, where Andy Herrera took charge as they retrieved a car that had gone over a cliff. During this call, Ben defied Beckett and Andy's orders to go down alone to the car where Owen was trapped. When they returned to the station, Beckett ordered Ben to desk duty until he'd completed three sessions of therapy with [[Diane Lewis]]. He then watched as Ross promoted Sullivan, a promotion she said was long overdue. ''("[[Started from the Bottom]]")''


Beckett accompanied his team to a call at a house known to local kids as the Hackett Murder house, where it was rumored that the mother killed her own children. Despite Sullivan suggesting they get USAR to stabilize the house before entry, Beckett sent his team in to retrieve two lost filmmakers, [[Tobias]] and [[Cory]]. When Maya and Sullivan brought Tobias out, they radioed for Theo and Travis, but got no response. Beckett was unaware they were not reachable by radio. [[Hattie]], who had called them in, told them there was a trap door in the house. Maya and Sullivan searched and found it. Maya then used her axe to break it open and they rescued Travis and Theo, plus Cory, who had also become trapped in there. Back at the station, while Beckett was sleeping, Sullivan came into his office and found a bottle of alcohol hidden in his files. ''("[[Searching for the Ghost]]")''


While leaving a liquor store after buying a large amount of alcohol, Sean ran into [[Natasha Ross]] and [[Robert Sullivan]], who were on a date. Later, after a call, Sean suggested he and Sullivan established a truce because neither of them could prove the other was doing anything wrong. ''("[[The Little Things You Do Together]]")''

On the day the Dean Miller Memorial Clinic opened, Beckett gave a lackluster speech to start the day before moving to his office. Sullivan found him in the beanery and told him about an AA meeting at a nearby church. When Beckett refused, Sullivan later went to Beckett's office and shared his own overdose experience, which he called the lowest point of his addiction. ''("[[In My Tree]]")''

When Beckett didn't come to the AA meeting, Sullivan asked him about it and Beckett said he was going to go to the meeting, but then he got drunk instead. That shift, station  was called to a fire at a candy factory. Beckett gave orders when they arrived and got a map of the factory from an employee named [[Ricky (Season )|Ricky]], which he used to guide the firefighters to cut power to the factory. When they couldn't find the generator using his directors, Ricky told Maya that he was reading the map upside down. Maya told Beckett this and he redirected the firefighters inside. Finally, everyone was evacuated and the fire was extinguished. ''("[[Cold Blue Steel and Sweet Fire]]")''

After Sullivan reported his alcoholism to Ross, she and [[Captain Henderson]], a representative from the Professional Standards Unit, came to station  to ask him about some recent calls, such as the gas main explosion, the [[Phoenix Fair]], and the candy factory fire, and test him to see if he had been drinking that day. She then told him about the accusations against him and said he'd have to submit a urine sample. He was then ordered to go home until the results came out. He said he was happy to give the urine, but said he'd wait in his office instead of going home. Ross said he wouldn't be allowed to leave, even to go on calls. His team went on one call without him, to a parking garage fire. When they returned, he told them his test had come back clear, but he was angry that someone had reported him. He ordered his entire team to run intervals until someone confessed to being behind the accusation, despite it being past midnight and then not having eaten their dinner. They ran until Vic vomited and Sullivan admitted that he was the one who had reported him. Beckett then sent them all to shower. ''("[[Alone in the Dark]]")''


When Beckett learned that Maya, Vic, and Sullivan had taken the aid car to find and treat [[Jeremy Benanti]], whom Andy had punched in self-defense after he assaulted her, he joined them at the scene and told them they needed to wait for backup as they shouldn't treat him. Because his condition was critical, they defied his order and once they got a pulse back on Jeremy, they took him to the hospital, where he died despite their best efforts.

When two detectives came to the station to talk to Andy, he said that two other officers had already spoken to her. However, he then realized they were not from SVU and were instead homicide detectives investigating Andy as a suspect. When they became aggressive with Andy, she said any additional questions could be directed at her lawyer. Beckett then ordered him out of the station, saying if they wanted to talk to the paramedics, they could make a formal request to the department.

The next morning, Beckett told Sullivan he was planing to target Sullivan for his insubordination and warned Sullivan to be prepared. ''("[[When the Party's Over]]")''


Beckett led his team to the scene of a building fire. After their arrival, he talked to [[Captain Khalidi]], whose team was already on the scene. Khalidi told him they needed help with search and rescue, so Beckett sent his team in for that. When Travis told him that the inside of the building looked like a sweatshop and [[Pablo]], a security guard they'd rescued from inside, had stopped talking when the building owner approached, Beckett forced the owner to step away so they could talk to Pablo without him hearing. Pablo told them there was a hidden room on the second floor where some women were trapped. He guided them to the room and they rescued twelve women with his help. This sparked an argument between the firefighters, [[Michael Dixon]], and the owner of the building as to what happened. When the fire was extinguished, Khalidi thanked Beckett for his help and Beckett said it was all Travis. ''("[[Death and the Maiden]]")''


During a clinic day, Beckett talked to Ross. The cleared the air over the accusation that he'd been drinking on the job and bonded over their shared dislike of [[Michael Dixon]]. ''("[[The Road You Didn't Take]]")''


Station  got called out to a scene where a truck driver transporting cesium- crashed and the cesium spilled out onto the road. A school bus was also involved in the crash. Beckett had his team use dosimeters to mark the safe zone while they waited for HAZMAT. Before HAZMAT arrived, the driver of the truck decided that since he was already exposed, he would clean up the cesium and move it far enough away that they could get the children out of the bus. During this call, Beckett struggled to remain focused and as they rode back to the station, he told Sullivan he was going to get sober and might need some rehab to help with that. ''("[[Crawl Out Through the Fallout]]")''



Ex-Wife
He is divorced. ''("[[Can't Feel My Face]]")'' His ex-wife lives in Florida. ''("[[Little Girl Blue]]")''

[[Andy Herrera]]
He met Andy outside [[Emerald City Bar]] following a difficult call. They flirted for a few minutes before leaving together and having sex. ''("[[Can't Feel My Face]]")''


His parents are dead and his brother is an alcoholic who doesn't take his calls. ''("[[Little Girl Blue]]")''


He and [[Diane Lewis]] know each other from the fire academy.


He is a fire captain for the [[Seattle Fire Department]]. He was assigned to station  following the demotion of [[Maya Bishop]].


*He beats [[Pat Aquino]] at Football Squares every year and is said to be a sore winner.<ref name="% or Nothing">[[% or Nothing]], x (S)</ref>
*According to [[Diane Lewis|Diane]], he was nicknamed "Last Place" at the fire academy under then-Chief Cummings.<ref name="% or Nothing" />
*Despite appearing in every episode of season five, he was credited as a guest star throughout.

'''Seth''' was the on-again, off-again boyfriend of [[JJ Lau]].


Seth was at JJ's house and they were trying to have sex, but they were interrupted by the smoke detector in her house, which kept beeping. JJ said she'd changed the battery the day before, but it wouldn't stop beeping. To get it to stop, Seth took a baseball bat and hit it, breaking it, but stopping the beeping. ''("[[Invisible to Me]]")''

Later, when she discovered their building was on fire, JJ tried to call Seth to let him know, as she believed he was at work. However, Dean discovered him still in the building, trapped in his apartment by a fallen shelf. Dean pulled him out, but he later died of smoke inhalation. ''("[[Contain the Flame]]")''



He was romantically involved with [[JJ Lau]]. She described him as her sometimes-boyfriend.

'''Shannon''' was a woman who was in a car accident during the wind storm.


On her birthday, Shannon was having brunch with her boyfriend. When she started to suspect he was going to dump her, she left abruptly. While she was driving, she was in a car accident due to the wind storm. Sullivan and Andy arrived to help her. They splinted her broken leg and then got her into the Aid Car. They noticed her leg was swelling and diagnosed compartment syndrome. They had to do a fasciotomy to relieve the pressure in the back of the car. Then they waited for dispatch to say it was safe to go somewhere. The wind started to blow the aid car across the road, leading them to see that it wasn't safe to stay there. They decided to leave, but the aid car was blown over the edge of a cliff. ''("[[Weather the Storm]]")''

Shannon was conscious during the fall. Believing they might die, she asked who would identify her body. If it was her grammy, she wanted to be wearing the necklace that her grammy got her, hoping it would help soften the blow. Andy assured her she wasn't going to die, but Shannon coded. Andy was able to resuscitate her and then left to set a flare so they could be located. Before Andy could get back, Shannon coded again and when Andy got back, she was unable to resuscitate her. Remembering Shannon's wish, Andy put the necklace on her neck. ''("[[Crash and Burn]]")''



She had a boyfriend, but she caught wind that he was going to break up with her on her birthday.''("[[Weather the Storm]]")''


She had a necklace which belonged to her grandmother that was extremely important to her. She asked Sullivan to retrieve it after the crash.''("[[Weather the Storm]]")'' When she worried she was going to die, she said she wanted to be wearing the necklace, in case her grandmother had to identify her. When she did die, Andy found the necklace in her bag and put it on her neck. ''("[[Crash and Burn]]")''

'''Shauna''' is a woman who passed out while trying on wedding dresses.


Shauna was looking at wedding dresses with her estranged father when she passed out and hit her head. Andy and Rigo arrived and quickly confirmed a carbon monoxide leak in the store. They took Shauna out to the aid car, but their departure was delayed when Andy noticed smoke coming out of a manhole. Shauna realized she'd left her purse in the shop, so Martin went back to get it, over Andy's objection that he stay in the aid car, and was hit in the chest when the manhole cover was blown into the air. They got him into the ambulance, where they noted severe blunt trauma to his chest. They worked on him and when the rest of the team arrived, Travis and Ben took over. They tried to get Martin to the hospital, but they hit serious traffic and had to pull over to work on him. Unfortunately, he died of his injuries.



She is engaged.


Shauna was extranged from her father after he was absent for much of her childhood. When she was getting married, he begged to be involved and offered to cover wedding costs. On the day they went to pick out her dress, Martin died, causing Shauna to regret not forgiving him sooner.


*She once passed out during a choir practice in fourth grade.
*She was  years old at the time of her father's death.

'''Shawn''' is a man who was in an accident when his car was hit by a tanker truck.


Shawn was driving and talking to his mother on the phone when he was in a car accident. He was trapped in his car as the doors were damaged from the impact. They quickly pried the doors open and got him out and onto a gurney so he could be taken to the hospital.



He had a new boyfriend, whom his mother wanted him to invite to dinner.


He was talking to his mother when he was in an accident. He hung up on her when the firefighters arrived, but then worried that would be the last time he spoke to her.

{{Firefighter Infobox |image = SxSnuffySouza.png |name = Snuffy Souza |status = Alive |grandchildren = grandchildren |job = Firefighter |workplace = '''Former'''
[[Seattle Fire Department]] |first appearance = [[I'll Be Seeing You]] |last appearance = [[When the Party's Over]] |count = |seasons = '''[[Station |S]]:''' [[Season (Station )|]], [[Season (Station )|]], and [[Season (Station )|]] |portrayed by = [[Peter Onorati]] }} '''Snuffy Souza''' is a retired firefighter who worked with Pruitt. When Andy was a child, her aunt's house caught on fire. Snuffy and the rest of station responded to the call. They quickly put out the fire. ''("[[Louder Than a Bomb]]")'' When Andy was harassed by a boy at school, Elena arranged for her to start training with Snuffy, an MMA fighter. He taught her how to punch and helped her build strength. These lessons continued through Andy's high school years. ''("[[When the Party's Over]]")'' After Andy was told her mother had died and had to stop seeing her aunt, uncle, and cousin to keep the truth away from her, she was on the couch at the station one day very sad. Snuffy came in and cheered her up, putting on salsa music and dancing to it poorly, prompting her to start dancing herself, telling him she knows she's better than he is. ''("[[Wild World]]")'' Snuffy, [[Captain Lawrence]], and [[Charlie Irwin]] came to Station with Pruitt to tell stories to the current team and play cards. When part of the team was called out to free people trapped in a storage unit, they grabbed the radio and listened to see how well trained the team was. They discussed every call any of them made, as the call progressed from trapped civilians to a fire. When they heard over the radio that several firefighters became trapped in the storage facility and were running out of air, Pruitt abruptly got up and left. They continued to listen to the radio and heard that Pruitt was going up to ventilate the roof, knowing that once he did, he would fall into the fire. Lawrence told Irwin to prepare to sound the bells. Irwin pointed out that Pruitt was retired, but Lawrence countered that dying ventilating a roof sure sounds like firefighting. Irwin sounded the bells. ''("[[I'll Be Seeing You]]")'' After Pruitt died, Andy was looking through her things and wondered if her parents were truly happy together and if her father was good to her mother. She called Snuffy to ask him about this, but he advised her to stop looking into it and let her father rest in peace. ''("[[Bad Guy]]")'' Snuffy attended Pruitt's funeral, which was streamed online due to safety regulations concerning the coronavirus pandemic. ''("[[Nothing Seems the Same]]")'' He has eleven grandchildren. He says they keep him young and the little one likes to put pony tails in his hair. He was a firefighter with the Seattle Fire Department. He worked with Pruitt when Pruitt was a rookie. '''Stella''' is a worked at a candy factory that caught on fire.


Stella was working at Sweet Ana's Candy Factory when a fire started. She was hit in the face with sugar, which burned her eyes and blinded her, leaving her unable to find her way out. When firefighters arrived and began attacking the fire, they found Stella and got her out to safety. Once she was outside the building, they rinsed the sugar out of her eyes and moved to take her to the hospital. However, her boyfriend, [[Ricky (Season )|Ricky]], stopped and proposed. After she accepted, the firefighters said they needed to get to the hospital, but he could go with her, which he did.



She is engaged to [[Ricky (Season )|Ricky]].


She and her fianc\ue are expecting a baby.


She works at Sweet Ana's Candy Factory.

'''Steve Charnofsky''' is one of the motorcyclists who was hit by a drunk truck driver.


Steve and eight of his friends were riding their motorcycles when a drunk driver swerved and hit them all with his truck. Station  responded to the call. Since Steve was away from the group in the street, it was a while before they found him. He gave them a report on [[Nate (Born to Run)|Nate]], who was nearby, saying his breaths were getting shallower. Ben and Claudia arrived shortly afterward and examined Steve, who appeared to be stable. However, shortly afterward, Steve started to decline, showing signs of imminent brain death. Ben moved him back to the PRT, where despite his best efforts, he was unable to save Steve. While looking for someone to call about him, Ben discovered he was an organ donor, so he kept Steve on the vent and rushed him to the hospital, where his organs were recovered and saved seven other lives.



His ex-wife hated that he rode motorcycles and was always sending him links about what could go wrong.


He and several of his friends like to ride motorcycles one weekend a month.


He was a plastic surgeon until his death.


*He always wanted to join Doctors Without Borders.

'''Steve Duncan''' is the taxi driver who drove [[Mindy Wallace]] to the hospital when she was in labor.


Steve came to Mindy's house when she called for a taxi while she was in labor. He told her to get in the front seat of his taxi so she would be more comfortable and drove her to the hospital. On the way, he started a video chat with the hospital because he was sure she was close to having the baby. When they were just a couple blocks away from the hospital, they were hit by another car. Steve said his head hurt, but otherwise, he was more worried about Mindy.

In the ER, Steve waited for a head CT. He also tried to keep tabs on Mindy and her progress. He said he wanted to see it through because he felt emotionally involved. While he waited, he was in a bed next to [[Garth Jones]]. He noticed that Garth was breathing oddly and called for a doctor to look at it.

He was discharged while Mindy's case was still unknown and he was disappointed by that. However, Ben informed him that Garth had a collapsed lung and Steve had saved his life.



He has at least two children. He was excited to go home and tell them he'd been a hero that day.


He is a taxi driver.

'''Steven Garcia''' is a child whose house caught on fire.


Steven was asleep in her house when a fire started. His mother woke up and immediately went to Steven and his sister, Erica, sitting with them on a bed until they were found and rescued by firefighters. They were taken outside, where they were given oxygen while firefighters continued to search for their family members and put out the fire.



He and four generations of his family quarantined together during the [[COVID- Pandemic]].


He is friends with his neighbor, [[Zaza Delgado]].

'''Susan''' is a woman who was injured when a party bus she was on crashed.


Susan, [[Mary (Every Second Counts)|Mary]], and [[Carla]] rented a party bus with their friends for a Mom's Day Out. Their driver was overtired and drove the wrong way up an off-ramp and crashed. The women were all ejected from the bus. Mary had an injury to her leg, while Susan was impaled on a piece of the bus and Carla was trapped under the bus. The driver was dead on arrival. Station , on their way to the hospital with another patient, stopped to help. They cut the bar that was impaling Susan and then lifted the bus off Carla to free her. They set up a nearby triage, where they treated Mary and the other six women. Mary had an open fracture to her leg and they struggled, but eventually stopped the bleeding. Once Carla was pulled out from under the bus, she crashed, but they were able to resuscitate her. All the women were then taken to the hospital.



She has a daughter named Isabella who plays hockey well enough to get a scholarship. She's the one who drives Isabella to hockey practice.


She is close friends with [[Mary (Every Second Counts)|Mary]] and [[Carla]]. She and Carla are said to be like oil and vinegar, with Mary being the glue that holds them together.


*Blood makes her queasy.

'''Sylvia''' is a patient who was pregnant with a breech fetus.


Sylvia was pregnant. They had determined that the fetus was in a breech position, but Sylvia hoped to have a vaginal birth, so Carina coached Jo through a forward somersault technique to rotate the fetus into a head down position. When Jo started, Sylvia cried out in pain, so Jo stopped. Carina said she was doing it correctly and reminded Sylvia that it would be uncomfortable but she needed to do it if she wanted a vaginal birth. Jo tried again, but stopped again when Sylvia cried out. When Link knocked on the door, Carina suggested they take a break.

In the promotional photos, he can be seen talking to\ua[[Izzie Stevens]]. Seeing that Izzie was treating a pregnant HIV-positive patient in that episode, she was most likely asking him if the virus would be transferred to the baby, as this was worrying the parents.


Dr. Thomas is the\ua[[Attending#Department Head|Head]]\uaof\ua[[Obstetrics and Gynecology]]\uaat\ua[[Seattle Grace Hospital]].

*Additionally, Dr. Thomas is the only [[Attending#Department Head|head attending]] who has the department head title embroidered on his lab coat and have the title on the second line of his ID badge.
*With the introduction of\ua[[Kate Lachman|Dr. Kate Lachman]], it is confirmed that he no longer holds the position.

'''Tamil''' is the boyfriend of [[Dara Agate]].


Tamil and his girlfriend, Dara, were having sex when they used Tamil's father's handcuffs and couldn't detach themselves from each other. They walked down to station , seeking help. Ben scared them a little, then called for bolt cutters to fire them. Before he could free them, Dara collapsed into a seizure. Ben gave her a sedative, which was ineffective, then moved her into the PRT, where he was able to stop her seizures with difficulty. When she was stable, they asked her if she had epilepsy. She said she did and admitted that she took her bracelet off when she was with Tamil because she didn't want to think she was sick. Tamil told her that he didn't care and asked her not to do anything like that ever again because it scared him.



He is dating [[Dara Agate]].


His father is a cop.


*He has athlete's foot.

'''Ted''' is a man who was beating his wife.


Ted was living with his new wife, Inara, and her son, Marcus. Marcus witnessed Ted hitting his mother and turned the burners on to fill the house with gas. Then his mother called  to report a gas leak. The firefighters responded to the calls, which happened three times in a single week. During the third call, they became suspicious that something more serious was going on, especially after Jack saw Inara signing to Marcus that daddy had calmed down. Jack separated Marcus and Inara from Ted and used sign language to learn the truth about what was happening, including that Inara didn't have anywhere else to take Marcus. She also said she'd called the police the first time it happened, but Ted convinced them she was overreacting and he'd locked her in a closet for eleven hours that night. Once he knew the truth, Jack helped Dean stall Ted while Inara went inside and packed a bag. Then they lied to Ted and said it was safe for him to stay in the house but not for Marcus and Inara to stay with him. While he was disputing this, they noticed flames in a room in the house. The fire was quickly extinguished and Ted believed that Marcus started it. When the firefighters witnessed him grabbing Marcus and yelling at him, they pulled him away. Jack then took Inara and Marcus to [[Marsha Smith|Marsha's]] house instead of to the hospital as he'd told Ted, freeing them from him.



He was married to [[Inara]]. They divorced because he was abusive toward her and her son.

He later went to New York with another woman. ''("[[Forever and Ever, Amen]]")''


He disliked his stepson, Marcus, and did not learned sign language to communicate with him.


He is some kind of teacher.


*He lives at  Bryn Mawr Court.

'''Ted Conlin''' is the captain of station .


Ted and his team responded to a fire at a coffee processing plant. They tagged out Sullivan and Andy, who had come upon the fire while doing hydrant checks. Station , under Conlin's guidance, worked on the fire. However, the situation escalated and they had to call station  back to help. After a flashover caused an explosion, Conlin went in with members of station  to retrieve the members of his team still inside the building. They located and evacuated nine of the ten quickly, but, believing the tenth was still inside, Conlin refused to leave. He then was trapped by falling debris before being informed that the team member he was after was already out and on his way to the hospital. Conlin ordered that no one else enter the building, giving himself up for lost. However, Ripley superseded his command and went in after him, though he refused any assistance. Ripley located Conlin with some assistance from Sullivan and brought out Conlin. They were then able to drown the building and put out the fire. He then agreed to get drinks with Sullivan and Ripley and said the first round would be on him. ''("[[Friendly Fire]]")''

After Ripley was discovered to have been exposed to hydrofluoric acid during the coffee plant fire, Conlin was also tested and came up positive. ''("[[Always Ready]]")''



He has a cousin who worked under Sullivan in Montana.


He is the captain of station  of the [[Seattle Fire Department]].


*He plays on his station's softball team.

'''Tenney''' was one of the passengers on the train with a bird flu outbreak.


Tenney was on a subway when the train stalled, causing some injuries to the passengers. Maya and Jack responded to the call and went through each car, tending to the passengers along the way. Tenney immediately started to worry when she saw that [[Will (Crazy Train)|Will]] was coughing and appeared to be sick. When the put out a request for all the passengers to allow Maya to check on what medications they were carrying, Tenney pulled out a large bag with multiple pill bottles in it. Because Maya wasn't able to go through all the medications before being called to tend to someone else, she had Tenney gather them up into her bag and show them to her one at a time until she found one she could use to treat [[Reese]].


*She was  years old at the time of the subway incident.

'''Terrence Tillerman''' is a man who ended up pinned between two cars.


Terrence, his wife, and his three children had gone to their family's house to celebrate Christmas a bit early. On their way, they ordered some last-minute groceries. Upon arrival, Terrence realized he'd put in their home address accidentally, so he got in his car and drove back to pick them up, not wanting his kids to do without their eggnog. He saw that the delivery driver had left the groceries on the driveway, so he parked his car at the top and got out to retrieve them. While he was doing that, his car rolled forward, pinning him between his car and another car that was in the driveway.

When station  arrived, Maya leaned into his car to turn it off and employ the emergency brake to keep it from moving. Ben evaluated his injuries and determined that the second they moved his car, he would bleed out and die. Desperate to save him, Ben asked Beckett to call the new fire chief and ask for authorization to use the PRT as it was his only chance at surivival. While they waited, they encouraged Terrence to call his wife and tell her to come.

When Delilah arrived, Terrence told her all the things he wanted her to tell their children. Then he asked her to sing to him as they prepared to move the car and get him into the PRT. He had her turn around once they started, so she wouldn't have to watch. She continued singing as they freed and moved him. The rest of his family arrived after he was moved. In the PRT, Carina and Ben clamped his aorta, buying them the time he needed to get to the hospital, where he was taken into surgery.

After his surgery, he was stable in the ICU and his family was with him singing carols in his room.



He is married to [[Delilah Tillerman]].


He and his wife have three kids: Penelope, Rory, and Tommy.


*He and his family live at  Christopher Court.

{{Firefighter Infobox |image = Sx-.jpg |name = Teodora Ruiz |status = Alive |title = Lieutenant |parents = *Maricella Gloriana Jimenez Ruiz *Father \u |grandparents = Teodora |other family = *Tom ''(stepfather)'' *Uncles *Aunts |job = '''Current'''
Fire Lieutenant '''Former'''

[[SFD Station ]] '''Former'''
SFD Station
[[SFD Station ]] |first appearance = *'''[[Station |S]]:''' [[Don't Look Back in Anger]] *'''[[Grey's Anatomy|GA]]:''' [[Bottle Up and Explode!]] |count = |seasons = *'''[[Grey's Anatomy|GA]]:''' [[Season (Grey's Anatomy)|]] and [[Season (Grey's Anatomy)|]] *'''[[Station |S]]:''' [[Season (Station )|]], [[Season (Station )|]], and [[Season (Station )|]] |portrayed by = [[Carlos Miranda]] }} '''Theo Ruiz''' is a lieutenant at [[SFD Station |Station ]] of the [[Seattle Fire Department]]. He is in a relationship with [[Victoria Hughes]]. Theo and Michael went to the fire academy together, where they quickly became friends. When Michael began dating Travis, they also became friends. After finishing the fire academy, they began working at station together. Theo was present when Michael and Travis became engaged. When a captain position opened up, Theo happily announced that he was in the running for it. He eventually got the promoted. He served as captain of station until he mistakenly told Michael it was safe to shelter in place, leading to Michael's death. After this incident, he asked to be demoted to lieutenant and he moved to station .[[No One is Alone]], x (S) After two weeks of spotting each other on their morning run in Bremerton Park, Theo got into a friendly race to the park entrance with Vic. When they'd both arrived, with Vic slightly ahead, they acknowledged that they'd both been jogging there a lot lately. When they each removed their masks at a distance, they realized they knew each other from fighting a fire together. Vic was put off when he mentioned being from station , but they said they'd see each other tomorrow. The next morning, Theo smiled when he saw Vic jogging by him and started running after her.[[Don't Look Back in Anger]], x (S) Theo and Vic met again when Vic went to Kaminski's, her parents' restaurant, to get celebratory pierogis after a three-alarm fire. Theo hadn't been there as his shift started after the fire was put out. He asked her out on a date, but she turned him down, saying she wasn't dating due to the pandemic.[[Out of Control]], x He told all his Instagram followers to try Kaminski's, saying they have the best pierogis in town.[[Train in Vain]], x Another day, Theo met Vic in the park again. He saw that she was upset and asked if she'd had a rough shift. She told him she actually hadn't started yet. He told her he'd seen the video of Sullivan and Dean being arrested and they talked about that for a while. She said she was usually the one to find the good in the bad, but she couldn't this time, which he understood. He reached his hand across the back of the bench where they were sitting and let their fingers brush together lightly. Later, Vic called Theo to try to set up a date between them, but was disappointed to learn he was on his way to meet up with someone. She was surprised when only a few moments later, he appeared at the station door with flowers for her. She asked when his next COVID test was and he said Tuesday, the same as hers, so they agreed to meet up on Wednesday.[[Learning to Fly]], x While they were on their date, Theo got a call asking him to sub at the next day. Vic asked him not to tell anyone there they were seeing each other and he agreed. The next day, they pretended not to know each other, but Travis recognized Theo as the captain who had gotten Michael killed. Because of this, Vic told Theo they couldn't see each other anymore, believing that Theo had really done something wrong as she knew Travis and didn't believe he could be so wrong about anything so important. However, she later comforted Theo when he said that the day Michael died didn't just haunt Travis. She was hugging him when Travis walked in.[[Make No Mistake, He's Mine]], x (S) Travis was angry that Vic was comforting him and realized Theo was the firefighter Vic had met in the park. This led to a fight between Travis and Vic that lasted for several days.[[No One is Alone]], x After parting ways, Vic and Theo ran into each other as he left her parents' restaurant. He asked if it was okay that he kept eating there and she said it was.[[Here It Comes Again]], x (S) When [[Kaminski's]] was set on fire, Theo went in to retrieve Vic's parents, carrying out a crock pot when her mother refused to leave without it. Later, once the fire was out, he came back from a fire down the street to help with overhaul. He brought bottles of water and helped Travis board up windows. While they boarded up windows, Theo apologized and Travis thanked him.[[Say Her Name]], x (S) Theo attended Maya and Carina's wedding after Anthony Hughes invited him. He got the couple a massager. After Travis gave Vic his approval, Vic went to Theo and they kissed.[[Forever and Ever, Amen]], x (S) [[Victoria Hughes]] He and Vic flirted over their morning jog.[[Don't Look Back in Anger]], x (S) He later asked her out on a date after seeing her outside her parents' restaurant, which he said had the best pierogi in town. She turned him down, saying she wasn't really dating because of the pandemic.[[Out of Control]], x (S) However, at a later meeting, Vic said she may have been a little rash turning him down and they made arrangements to go for a date after their next Covid test.[[Learning to Fly]], x The date went well, but while they were together, Theo got a call asking him to sub at station the next day. Vic asked him not to tell anyone they were seeing each other and he agreed to that. When they were at the station, Vic learned that Theo was previously a captain and was the reason Travis's husband, Michael, was dead. Vic told him they couldn't see each other anymore because of that, but later comforted him when he said that day didn't just haunt Travis.[[Make No Mistake, He's Mine]], x On the day of Maya and Carina's wedding, Anthony Hughes invited Theo to join the celebration. He did and after the wedding, he ended up kissing Vic outside her parents' restaurant.[[Forever and Ever, Amen]], x (S) High School Girlfriend In high school, he was helping his girlfriend parallel park while also trying to make her laugh, which resulted in her rolling the car over his foot and bruising it.[[No One is Alone]], x (S) His father, who was also a firefighter, died when he was eight. After this, his uncles, his father's firefighter buddies, and his mother's eventual husband all stepped in to be like father figures for him. He says that he had a lot of anxiety about this as he was worried about losing another dad.[[No One is Alone]], x (S) [[Michael Cooper Williams]] He and [[Michael Cooper Williams|Michael]] were best friends until his death, for which Theo was responsible. They attended the fire academy together and were probies together. They also lived together until Michael married Travis.[[No One is Alone]], x (S) [[Travis Montgomery]] Theo is a Lieutenant at [[SFD Station |Station ]] of the [[Seattle Fire Department]]. Following in the footsteps of his late father, he rose up the ranks quickly and was appointed Captain at a young age. He thus became Captain to [[Michael Cooper Williams]], with whom he had completed his training at the Fire Academy. Not long into his Captainship, he made a judgment error that cost Michael his life. Theo was demoted because of this and ended up at Station .[[Make No Mistake, He's Mine]], x (S) *He shops at farmers markets.[[Don't Look Back in Anger]], x (S) *He brought broccoli souffl\ue to his and Vic's first date.[[Make No Mistake, He's Mine]], x (S) *He cooked pernil for his first dinner date at home with Vic.[[Searching for the Ghost]], x (S) *When his mother took the green card exam, she made him learn the middle names of all the presidents.[[The Road You Didn't Take]], x (S) SxTheoRuiz.png SxTheoRuiz.png SxTheoRuiz.png SxTheoRuiz.png {{GalleryLink}} These episodes are Theo-centric or are otherwise very informative about his life: *[[No One is Alone]] {{Theo Ruiz Appearances}} {{Scrollbox}} [[de:Theo Ruiz]] {{DEFAULTSORT:Ruiz, Theo}} [[Category:Characters]] [[Category:GA Characters]] [[Category:GA S Characters]] [[Category:GA S Characters]] [[Category:S Characters]] [[Category:S S Characters]] [[Category:S S Characters]] [[Category:S S Characters]] [[Category:Firefighters]]

'''Tiffany''' is a woman whose house caught on fire due to a faulty laptop cord.


Tiffany was using her computer and then left to use the bathroom. While she was gone, her laptop cord sparked and started a fire. She waited in the bathroom until help arrived and evacuated her. After she was taken outside, the fire was put out. She was asked if she was alone in the house and she said Charlie was inside. Inside the house, they looked for Charlie and found a dog. Dean picked up Charlie and took him outside, where he was reunited with Tiffany, who thanked him profusely. Dean later invited Tiffany to his place, where they hooked up. She bought steaks to thank the team for saving her and Charlie. Dean let her stay at his place until she found a new home. Charlie ended up staying with Dean because Tiffany's new place wasn't pet-friendly.



She has an ex-boyfriend she's still hung up on. She stalks him on social media.

'''Tobias''' is a documentary filmmaker who tried to make a film about a "haunted" house.


Tobias, Cory, and Hattie were making a documentary about the Hackett Murder House when Tobias and Cory ended up trapped in the house while Hattie escaped. Hattie called for help and station  responded. Maya, Travis, Theo, and Sullivan entered the house to search for them while Hattie remained outside. Maya and Sullivan searched the downstairs while Travis and Theo checked upstairs. Maya and Sullivan found Tobias, who was trapped under a fallen shelf. They freed him and took him out. Then they noticed Travis and Theo weren't reachable by radio. Tobias informed them there was a trap door in the house, so they went back in and searched for it. When they found it, they broke through it and evacuated Travis, Theo, and Cory, who had all fallen down there.



He works with [[Cory]] and [[Hattie]], making documentary films.


He makes documentary films.


*He was the one who wanted to come to that house and convinced the other two.

'''Todd''' is a guy who hit on Maya and Carina during their vacation.


Maya and Carina were enjoying drinks by the poolside when Todd approached them and hit on them. They tried to get him to leave, but he persevered. Finally, Maya challenged him to a push up contest, saying if he won, he could buy them drinks. If he lost, he had to buy them drinks and then leave them alone. he said he'd do them with one hand to make it even. They both got into position and started doing pushups. After a few, he dropped onto both hands and after a few more, he dropped to the ground. Maya triumphantly ordered drinks on his tab and then kissed Carina as Todd and his friends gawked at them.


*He took Spanish in high school.

'''Todd Youngblood''' is an EMT who works with Pruitt.



Todd responded to the coffee processing plant fire with Pruitt, his new partner. Unaware of Pruitt's past as a firefighter, he suggested that he take it easy. Ryan then stepped in and defended Pruitt. When Pruitt got called upon to help manage the scene after Ripley went in after [[Ted Conlin]], Todd stood by and watched until he was finished and then they left together. ''("[[Friendly Fire]]")''


After picking up [[Ruby (Indoor Fireworks)|Ruby]] from her home and taking her to the hospital for treatment, Todd and Pruitt decided to stop by Rogers' Five and Dime to see if they could help. They were quickly told they weren't needed. ''("[[Indoor Fireworks]]")''

Later that day, they were called back to Ruby's apartment when her son accidentally shot Ryan. They picked up Ryan to take him to the hospital, where he unfortunately died. ''("[[Eulogy]]")''



He says his father has bad knees.


He is an EMT with Puget Ambulance Service, a private ambulance service.

'''Tommy Tillerman''' is the son of [[Terrence Tillerman]].


Tommy and his family were headed to their grandma's for a Christmas celebration. On the way, they put in a last-minute grocery order, but accidentally put in their home address for delivery. Not wanting them to go without their eggnog, Terrence drove back to the house to retrieve it, but ended up pinned between his car and another that was parked in the driveway.

As firefighters freed him and moved him into the PRT for treatment, Tommy and his siblings arrived and embraced their mother. Maya then told them the sirens on the PRT meant that Terrence was alive as he was transported to the hospital. At the hospital, Terrence was taken into surgery and aftward, the whole family was in his room singing Christmas carols.



He lives with his parents and two siblings. Their grandma lives on the other side of down.


*He and his family live at  Christopher Court.
*His favorite color is pink.
*He loves Janet Jackson.

'''Tony''' is the husband of [[Kelly (Station )|Kelly]].


Kelly was choking on something when Andy and Rigo arrived. Tony directed them to the backyard, where [[Jeff (Station )|Jeff]] was doing the Heimlich on Kelly as she wheezed. Rigo instructed him to stop, because the Heimlich wouldn't work on her as she was still breathing some. They were all then distracted when Andy started screaming because she saw a raccoon. Kelly's airway then became completely blocked, so Rigo did the Heimlich, dislodging the object, and then they loaded her into the ambulance to get checked out at the hospital.



He is married to [[Kelly (Station )|Kelly]].

'''Tori''' is a kid who was stuck in a building after it caught fire.


Tori was asleep when the building she was squatting in caught on fire. By the time she was awakened, the building was engulfed in flames and she was having trouble breathing. She was trapped in the building along with the rest of a group of kids who were all sleeping there. She was found by the firefighters, but remained trapped when the sprinklers were turned on, but contained an accelerant instead of water. When access to water finally came through, Tori was rescued along with the others and was then treated for smoke inhalation.



Tori, [[Brian (Lost and Found)|Brian]], [[Sean (Lost and Found)|Sean]], and [[Zoe]] became close as they all squatted in a building together while experiencing homelessness. Zoe was upset to know that the police would separate them after the fire.
